item.title: Ignorant Bliss ep 55: Get Out, Favs of Film & TV in 2016, a
item.description:
In this episode I review the new film Get Out by Jordan Peele starring Daniel Kaluuya, Alison Williams, Bradley Whitford and Catherine Keener. I talk with my friend and fellow film critic Roxana Hadadi about Film and TV in 2016 and awards season. Finally I review the film Logan by James Mangold starring Hugh Jackman, Sir Patrick Stewart and Dafne Keen.
Check out Roxana online:
http://www.roxanahadadi.com/
https://twitter.com/roxana_hadadi
Music in this episode:
You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean
Redbone - Childish Gambino
Paper Boi - Paper Boi (from the TV series Atlanta)
City of Stars - Ryan Gosling (La La Land soundtrack)
Surrender - Lalah Hathaway & Pharrell Williams (Hidden Figures soundtrack)
The Man Comes Around - Johnny Cash
All the music copyright their respective owners

item.title: Go Trek Yourself - ep 13 All about the Ensigns
item.description:
Reacting to the news that Sam Vartholomeos is cast as Ensign Conner, the new ensign aboard the Starship Shenzou in Star Trek Discovery, Darrell and J.K.discuss all the Ensigns in Trek history before choosing a favourite. In this episode, they are only interrupted once by "racist Worf" as they scour the Trek-verse and decide on a favourite "ensign episode" from all series,with a strong focus on Ro, Wesley and Kim. Finally, we end with another "brother Dusty" song from his Blood Star Halo project; "Industrial Carnage"

item.title: Star Wars Conversations ep 18 What If
item.description:
Welcome to our Star Wars fan podcast, where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
Please subscribe to our channel and share.
Featured in this episode:
News:
Woody Harrelson reveals his character's name in Han Solo movie https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/03/woody-harrelson-reveals-his-characters-name-to-be-beckett-in-the-han-solo-film.html
Lyra Erso was originally a Jedi in an early draft of Rogue One https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/03/lyra-erso-was-supposed-to-be-a-real-jedi-in-another-early-version-of-rogue-one.html
Riz Ahmed nearly played a crazed Engineer in Rogue One http://ew.com/movies/2017/03/23/rogue-one-riz-ahmed-bokan-bodhi-rook/
Two more alternate endings for Rogue One revealed https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/03/two-more-alternate-endings-for-rogue-one-a-star-wars-story-revealed-by-io9.html

item.title: Magnumcast ep 34: Americans are Hotter Than Englishmen
item.description:
Luke and the Colonel review the season 4 episodes Limited Engagement and Letter to a Duchess. It is the second episode where they discuss why Americans are, indeed, hotter than Englishmen. The proof is right there, people. Don't just take their word for it. And because the Colonel is actually trying to do something nice for other people, here's another note you might care about:
I'm running the Sefton Park 10k and Wirral Half Marathon for a children's hospice - any donations gratefully received. Click HERE to donate.
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 180- Greg Schigiel
item.description:
Gregg Schigiel is an artist who is part of the vanguard of new all ages characters in comics. Currently working on "Spongebob Squarepants", he is the creator of "Pix", a book about a teen fairy princess with superpowers trying to navigate high school. He tells us how the book fits in at Image, why he prefers to call them "kids books" over "all ages", the greatness of the NBC show "Ed", his legendary 90s Marvel Spider-Man comic "Fastlane", and working for Marvel during bankruptcy. He's also an avid podcaster with two shows- "Stuff Said" and "Cruisin Together", which leads to extensive Tom Cruise discussion as well as his unrelated hilarious analysis of "Rosemary's Baby". A lively and amusing episode to be sure!
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Go Trek Yourself - episode 12: Doctors, Heal Thyselves!
item.description:
Reacting to the news that Maulik Pancholy is cast as Dr. Nambue, the chief medical officer aboard the Starship Shenzou in Star Trek Discovery, Darrell and J.K.discuss all the doctors in Trek history before choosing a favourite. They also scour the the Trek-verse and decide on a favourite "doctor episode" from all series. Finally, we end with another "brother Dusty" song from his Blood Star Halo project; "Demon Ride"

item.description:
The seventeenth episode of our Star Wars fan podcast. Where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
Please subscribe to our channel and share.

News:
New details on the Han Solo Fuerteventura shoot:
https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/03/han-solo-new-details-on-the-fuerteventura-shoot.html
Are Frank Oz and Ewan McGregor returning to Star Wars?
https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/03/could-frank-oz-and-ewan-mcgregor-be-returning-to-star-wars-we-think-so.html
Gareth Edwards talks about working on Rogue One
https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/03/gareth-edwards-talks-with-fans-about-working-on-rogue-one-darth-plagueis-george-lucas-the-name-scarif-and-more.html
Gareth Edwards discusses lack of deleted scenes on the Rogue One Blu-Ray and the alternate ending of the movie AND the addidtion of the awesome Vader scene

item.title: Logan Spoiler Special
item.description:
This is our first of many special spoiler filled reviews. Logan is directed by James Mangold, who co-wrote the screenplay with Scott Frank and Michael Green, from a story by Mangold, and also stars Patrick Stewart, Boyd Holbrook, Stephen Merchant, Richard E. Grant and Dafne Keen. The film follows a past-his-prime Logan embarking on a road trip across America for one final mission.
Let us know what you are watching and we will read it on the show just email us at nothingsonpodcast@gmail.com
You can follow us on twitter : @NothingsOn123
http://www.stitcher.com/
https://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com xtremecomedyct.weebly.com
item.itunes:summary:
This is our first of many special spoiler filled reviews. Logan is directed by James Mangold, who co-wrote the screenplay with Scott Frank and Michael Green, from a story by Mangold, and also stars Patrick Stewart, Boyd Holbrook, Stephen Merchant, Richard E. Grant and Dafne Keen. The film follows a past-his-prime Logan embarking on a road trip across America for one final mission.
Let us know what you are watching and we will read it on the show just email us at nothingsonpodcast@gmail.com
You can follow us on twitter : @NothingsOn123
http://www.stitcher.com/
https://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com xtremecomedyct.weebly.com

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 54: A conversation about Art and things with
item.description:
Hey folks this episode basically just a friendly conversation about Art with my friends frequent guest Ronald Wimberly (Prince of Cats, Black History in it’s Own Words, Lighten Up) and Aerosyn Lex Mestrovic (worked with LVMH, CFDA, Public School, Nike & more). We cover subjects about the Instagram’s effect on Fine Art and the nature of branding in Fine Art. Some thoughts on this past year’s Art Basel in Miami, Florida and ComplexCon in Long Beach, Ca. Thoughts on reaching audience and who your market is and overall thoughts on personal views on working in the creative fields. I hope you enjoy.
Check out my friend’s works and sites and social media:
Follow Lex:
http://aerosynlex.com/
https://twitter.com/aerosynlex
https://www.instagram.com/aerosynlex/
Follow Ron:
Links: http://ronaldwimberly.com/
https://twitter.com/raynardfaux
https://www.instagram.com/ronaldwimberly
http://d3-14.tumblr.com
Music in this episode:
You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean
Moves - Big Sean
Nobody Speak - DJ Shadow featuring Run The Jewels
T-Shirt - Migos
Dance for Blessings - Sango
The Let Out - Jidenna
Controller - Hercules and Love Affair
Get To Know You (Kaytranada flip) - NAO
Flight At First Sight/Advance - Kid Cudi featuring Pharrell
All the music copyright their respective owners

item.title: Star Wars Conversations ep 16 HAN and BOBBA CROSSOVER
item.description:
The sixteenth episode of our Star Wars fan podcast. Where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
Please subscribe to our channel and share.
Featured in this weeks episode:
News:
Michael K Williams officially joins Han Solo movie! http://www.starwars.com/news/michael-kenneth-williams-joins-young-han-solo-film
Han Solo confirmed to be filming in Fuerteventura https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/03/57999.html
Rian Johnson hints at the meaning of The Last Jedi https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/03/rian-johnson-gives-a-brief-hint-on-the-meaning-of-the-last-jedi-title.html
The Last Jedi footage shown at Disney share holders meeting https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/03/details-on-the-last-jedi-footage-shown-at-disneys-shareholder-meeting-luke-to-rey-who-are-you.html
Star Wars Celebration News
Reviews:
Star Wars Rebels - Secret Cargo
Star Wars Character Encyclopedia Updated Edition
Social media stuff:
#StarWarsConvo Youtube Channel: tinyurl.com/StarWarsYT ITunes Podcast: tinyurl.com/StarWarsPod Facebook Page: tinyurl.com/StarWarsCFB Instagram:@StarWarsConvo Twitter:@StarWarsConvo Soundcloud: tinyurl.com/StarWarsSC RSS Feed: tinyurl.com/StarWarsCRSS Taylor Network Podcasts: tinyurl.com/TaylorNet Email: ForcedConvo@gmail.com
And contact us @The_J_Tank and @CaptainColin
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 47 "The Revenge of the Reaper"
item.description:
Welcome to episode 47 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. The books covered are Action Comics #753, Batgirl #7, Robin Year One, Detective comics #70 and Retroactive 1980s Batman
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and weâll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page. You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Magnumcast episode 33: Rick's friends and family
item.description:
The guys review two Rick-centric episodes this month: Smaller Than Life and Distant Relative. Listen along and see if you agree with the guys. Also, here's the notes from the Colonel's little announcement:
I'm running the Sefton Park 10k and Wirral Half Marathon for a children's hospice - any donations gratefully received. https://t.co/0os1CskBXu

item.title: Ignorant Bliss ep 53: A chat with TheBlerdGirl
item.description:
This episode I talk with Karama Horne better known as the The Blerd Girl. Recorded toward the end of last year we talk about a whole load of topics, from politics to comics to anime to being a creative professional. So much good talk in here it’s hard to summarize it all so give it a good listen.
On all social platforms - @TheBlerdGurl
http://theblerdgurl.com/
https://www.youtube.com/c/Theblerdgurltv
http://theblerdgurl.tumblr.com/
Music in this episode:
You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean
Blessings - Lecrae
Dent Jusay - Mark Martians feat. Syd & Steve Lacy
Heat of the Night - Eat More Cake
Rough Soul - Goldlink
Nothing (Club Mix) - Kingdom Feat. Sad
Show You The Way - Thundercat feat. Michael McDonald & Kenny Loggins
All the music copyright their respective owners

item.title: Go Trek Yourself - episode 11: Admirals are Dicks!
item.description:
Reacting to the news that Terry Serpico is cast as Admiral Anderson in Star Trek Discovery, Darrell and J.K.scour Trek history looking for a "decent" Admiral, analyzing their roles in the Trek world and decide on their favourite Admirals and favourite Admiral episodes. Finally, we end with another "brother Dusty" song from his Blood Star Halo project; "Chosen"​
contact us at gotrekyourselfbertrand@gmail.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Gotrekyourself

item.title: Culture Trappin ep 1 The Pilot episode
item.description:
Join us for the pilot episode of Culture Trappin starring Darrell Taylor, Shawn Pryor, Julian Lytle, Gil Colon and Martheus Wade. This show will dip its toe into music, politics, television, movies, comics and more. At times we are over the top crazy and other times insightful but always with a unique way to look at the world around us.
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Star Wars Conversations ep 15- The End of the Empire?
item.description:
The fifteenth episode of our Star Wars fan podcast. Where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
Please subscribe to our channel and share.
Featured in this weeks episode:
News:
JJ Abrahams discusses Mark Hamill, Carrie Fisher and the Han Solo movie:
https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/02/j-j-abrams-says-mark-hamill-is-underrated-praises-the-last-jedi-and-the-han-solo-film.html
D23 rumours:
https://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/02/rumor-why-you-should-be-excited-for-disneys-d23-event-this-year.html
The state of the Galaxy as The Last Jedi begins:
http://makingstarwars.net/2017/02/state-galaxy-star-wars-last-jedi-begins/
Reviews:
Star Wars Rebels - Through Imperial Eyes
Star Wars Aftermath: Empire's End by Chuck Wendig J.J. Abrams Says Mark Hamill is Underrated, Praises The Last Jedi and the Han Solo Film! Star Wars: The Force Awakens director J.J. Abrams was at the 12th annual Oscar Wilde Awards in Santa Monica, supporting the US-Ireland Alliance non-profit organization, hosted at Bad Robot. In several interviews, the director didn’t miss the chance to praise the upcoming Star Wars movies and the peo... starwarsnewsnet.com
Star Wars Aftermath: Empire's End
Social media stuff:
#StarWarsConvo Youtube Channel: tinyurl.com/StarWarsYT ITunes Podcast: tinyurl.com/StarWarsPod Facebook Page: tinyurl.com/StarWarsCFB Instagram:@StarWarsConvo Twitter:@StarWarsConvo Soundcloud: tinyurl.com/StarWarsSC RSS Feed: tinyurl.com/StarWarsCRSS Taylor Network Podcasts: tinyurl.com/TaylorNet Email: ForcedConvo@gmail.com
And contact us @The_J_Tank and @CaptainColin
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 46 The Batgirl Special
item.description:
Its the catch up episode where we dive into the current issues of Batman, All Star Batman, Batman Beyond, Batgirl, Batgirl and the birds of prey, Nightwing, Detective comics, Red Hood and the Outlaws, Justice League of america, Super Sons, Titans , Teen Titans and Mother Panic. Plus we throw in Batgirl vol 1 issues 1-6 , Batgirl Special issue 1 and Batman Mad love

item.title: Peridyym Shift ep 2- “Arrival!”
item.description:
Hex, Mervis and Sellick arrive through the other side of the portal with Sgt. Jerik and Sister Marnas Corwainer, on the next leg of the quest to hunt goblins for the town of Torran!
Game Scenario based on The Goblin Undertaking, a Roll20.net –based adventure by Larry Roberts
Our players are
Bob Frantz – author of Monty The Dinosaur http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/monty-the-dinosaur-volume-1-bob-frantz/1124324032?ean=9781632292087
Anton Kromoff –Designer, writer: https://www.behance.net/antonkromob9ce
Jim Dietz -- Social Media Strategist at Action Lab Entertainment: http://www.actionlabcomics.com
Soundtracks provided by Kevin MacLeod’s Incompetech
https://incompetech.com/music/royalty-free/music.html
Contact us at
Facebook
www.facebook.com/peridyymshift
Twitter
www.twitter.com/peridyymshift
Email
peridyymshift@gmail.com
(For iTunes & Stitcher):
Title: Peridyym Shift
Subtitle: Adventure in the World of Peridyym, A Homebrew Pathfinder Campaign
Author: Alan White
Description/summary: An Actual Play Pathfinder podcast
Owner name: Alan White
Owner email: PeridyymShift@gmail.com
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 179 Dan Daugherty
item.description:
The multifaceted Dan Daugherty joins Wendi for a brief minisode to discuss his band, On the Off Chance. In addition to his exemplary art skills on the webcomic, "Beardo", his supernatural thriller "Touching Evil", his work with Dirk Manning and teaching at the International School of Comics, Dan is a longtime songwriter and guitarist. He has a new kickstarter to release the vinyl of their debut album, "White Shoes, Black Water".
You can hear their "beautiful harmonies, powerful lyrics and hooks to spare" and support their album at
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.description:
In this episode we cover Batman vol 1 #121, Legends of the DC universe #6â and more episodes of the Batman cartoon.
The writer of Batman Tom King did a ranking of who the best fighters in the Batman family
Tom King List
Cassandra Dick Bruce Damian Kate Helena Jason Duke Stephanie Tim So in our outrage on how wrong his list is we did our own.

1. Cassie 2. Bruce 3. Dick 4. Tim 5. Damian 6. Jason 7. Helena 8. Barbara 9. Kate 10. Luke

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 178 Daniel White
item.description:
A very special Valentine's Day episode of Double Page Spread with dear friend, artist Daniel White! Daniel discusses the nature of heartbreak and loss in his work, using art to overcome break ups, working for the legendary Peter Max, NY architecture, their favorite pro skateboarders, where to find the best cannolis, the lesser known roles of Tony Danza and much more!
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Peridyym Shift ep 1 “The Mission Guild”
item.description:
Welcome to the first episode of the D&D podcast Peridyym Shift :
“More than survival,” has been the Peridyymian creed these past ten years. The Boroding family has been made the ruling house over its’ culture and its’ patriarch crowned as Good King Peridyym the First, sending explorers out to colonize and expand the growing population of former sailors yearning to till soil once again, shepherd livestock… stand once again on firm unyielding ground and hand down to their children the security of a world that could no longer capsize them by the dozens on any mercurial swell of the tide, nor devour them by the hundreds on the capricious hunger of the unseen, rising leviathan.
You are invited now to listen to the adventures of one such band of explorers, charged by Good King Peridyym and guided by the divine province of his chief adviser, The Lord Prefect Archlon Balmoral, into the settlements and strongholds of expansion, into the unknown challenges and mysteries of the land laid out before them … into more than just survival … this … is the World of Peridyym!
Everyone has a noble or adventurous motive for joining the Mission Guild… and then there’s Hex, Mervis and Sellick! You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.description:

item.title: Magnumcast Episode 32: Luther Gillis is Home From the Sea
item.description:
The boys start off a new year with the start of a new season. They kick off season 4 with reviews of the masterpiece Home From the Sea, and the not-quite-a-masterpiece Luther Gillis: File #521. So you know what the guys think of them, but do you know why? Of course not. You have to listen to the episode to get all that. You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 177 Andrew Huerta
item.description:
Andrew Huerta has been honing his art skills for years for companies like IDW, Dynamite and BOOM!. He is now creating his own book with "Sovereign"- a post-apocalyptic sci fi action tale with a very diverse cast and a 90s cartoon bent.
Check out what he's doing and donate to the kickstarter right over here...
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1111522979/sovereign-the-return-vol-1-graphic-novel-0

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 176- Joe Illidge
item.description:
Joe Illidge is a veteran of every aspect of the comic industry- writer, editor, columnist, public speaker on marketing and promotion. He got his start at Milestone Comics working with such luminaries as Dwayne McDuffie, which primed him for a career at DC editing Batman titles such as "Birds of Prey" and "No Man's Land". Now he's ready to talk about his new undertaking, senior editor at Lion Forge overseeing the new ambitious superhero universe, Catalyst Prime. He talks about the impressive creative teams spearheading these new titles, such as David Walker, Amy Chu, and Alex DeCampi, as well as Barbara Gordon's footwear, and establishing the meritocracy of comics.
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Star Wars Conversations ep 11 You came in that thing?
item.description:
The eleventh episode of our Star Wars fan podcast. Where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
Please subscribe to our channel and share.
Featured in this weeks episode:
News:
Wedge WAS in Rogue One http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/01/lucasfilm-staff-explain-where-wedge-was-during-star-wars-rogue-one.html
Young Han Solo Begins Principal Photography http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/01/star-wars-han-solo-begins-principal-photography.html
Discussion: Dr Evazan, Ponda Baba and Tam Posla back story and could stories like this ever be seen as anthology movies?
Review: : Legends of Tomorrow Raiders of the last art. While trying to capture Rip Hunter in 1967, Damien Darhk and Malcolm Merlyn create a huge aberration; Rory requests help from Stein but asks him to keep it a secret from the team. Season number: 2 Episode number: 9 Air date: 24 January 2017
Spotlight: Jaina Solo
Comments: Dan: "If you had sole control over Episode 8 where would all the main characters be at the end of it, as in, dead, alive, light, dark, and when I say main characters I'm thinking Luke, Snoke, Kylo Ren and Rey
Darrell One storyline from outside of canon that you wish they would use in the films.
One character outside of canon that you wish they would use.
Donny At the end of this new trilogy do you wanna see kylo ren redeemed or become full on new Sith Lord?
Jim If they bring Thrawn back into canon will he appear in the new numbered chapters (farther up the time;line) or in one of the Anthology movies?
Dash Rendar worth bringing back or just a second string Solo?
What is your favorite SW collectible in your collection?
Social media stuff:
Youtube:http://tinyurl.com/ForceCYT Tweet: @StarWarsConvo - #StarWarsConvo Email: ForcedConvo@gmail.com Facebook:http://tinyurl.com/ForceCFB RSS: https://soundcloud.com/forced-conversations-a-star-wars-fan-show Taylor Network: http://tinyurl.com/TaylorNet iTunes: Podcast: http://tinyurl.com/ForcePod Instagram: http://www.instagir.com/forcedconvo
And contact us @The_J_Tank and @CaptainColin

item.title: Forced Coversations ep 10 : The Last Jedi
item.description:
The tenth episode of our Star Wars fan podcast. Where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
Please subscribe to our channel and share.
This weeks episode is made up of the 3 youtube video's we released this week. we covered:
News:
Did Woody Harrelson reveal who he's playing in Young Han Solo? http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/01/did-woody-harrelson-just-reveal-the-character-hes-playing-in-the-upcoming-han-solo-film.html
Cad Bane, Aurra Sing and Captain Phasma to appear in new Marvel Comics http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/01/cad-bane-and-captain-phasma-to-appear-in-marvels-star-wars-comics.html
Star Wars Episode VIII gets a title. The Last Jedi
Star Wars Rebels Review: Trials of the Darksaber
Comics:
Dr aphra 003 Written by: Kieron Gillen Art by: Kev Walker
Star Wars 26 and 27 Writer Jason Aaron Art Salvador larroca Cover Stuart Immonen
Viewer Comments:
Daniel Hackett: If there was one bit of Canon you could change what would it be and why?
Music clip by http://www.bricktrick.de
Social media stuff:
Tweet: @ForcedConvo - #ForcedConvo Email: ForcedConvo@gmail.com Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1667335663556068/ RSS: https://soundcloud.com/forced-conversations-a-star-wars-fan-show Taylor Network: https://itunes.apple.com/gb/podcast/taylornetwork/id500582624?mt=2 iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/gb/podcast/forced-conversations-star/id1180224502?mt=2 Instagram: http://www.instagir.com/forcedconvo

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 41 The Chase
item.description:

We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and weâll read it on the show.

item.title: Wades World ep 12 The Final Frontier
item.description:
Lots have been going on in the Wade's House of Art. From Christmas, to new comics book illustrations, to Boy Scouts, to Patreon, they have been up to their necks in work and play. In this edition of Wade's World, Martheus and Anakin take you on a ride that covers Yokai Watch, Patreon, and the future of artwork from the Wades.
Let us know what you think!!!!! wadesworldpodcast@gmail.com
https://www.patreon.com/MAWProductions http://toshigawauniverse.storenvy.com

item.title: Gotham by Geeks: James Tynion IV
item.description:
Join us for another creator spotlight episode and joining us is the writer of Detective comics James Tynion IV. We discuss the current story lines in detective as well as a few tidbits of what we have to look forward to in the next couple arcs. We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and weâll read it on the show.

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 40 Birds of prey
item.description:
In this bat-centric episode we cover the upcoming DC comics price increase, the upcoming Batman-Flash crossover titled 'The button', Justice League vs Suicide Squad 1-4, Injustice 2 news , Birds of Prey 1-6, Red hood and the Outlaws before covering our comic book picks which are:
Batman vol 1 issue 134 , The Batman animated, Legends of the dark knight 11-13 and Birds of Prey vol 1 issues 1-4
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and weâll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Forced Conversations ep 9 Clumsy and Random
item.description:
The ninth episode of our Star Wars fan podcast. Where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
A very random episode where Colin has gone slightly mad due to sleep deprivation.....
Please subscribe to our channel and share.
Featured in this weeks episode:
News:
Happy 86th Birthday to James Earl Jones
Late Changes to Rogue One resulted in one of the movie's most iconic scenes. In an intervie with Yahoo, editor John Gilroy says that a big change late in production resulted in one of the movie's most exciting scenes. http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/01/late-changes-resulted-in-one-of-rogue-ones-most-iconic-scenes.html
ILM's John Knoll confirms that the crew of the Hammerhead ships in Rogue One DID escape. http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/01/the-mystery-of-the-rogue-one-hammerhead-crew-did-they-survive.html
Episode 8 filmed in Bolivia and possible return of a familiar ship? http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/01/star-wars-episode-viii-filmed-in-bolivia-familiar-ship-teased.html
Reviews:
Star Wars Rebels: Warhead
Discussion: Episode 8 : where's the trailer Rant and possible title ideas (Thanks Warren for the suggestion)
Social media stuff:
Tweet: @ForcedConvo - #ForcedConvo Email: ForcedConvo@gmail.com Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1667335663556068/ RSS: https://soundcloud.com/forced-conversations-a-star-wars-fan-show Taylor Network: https://itunes.apple.com/gb/podcast/taylornetwork/id500582624?mt=2 iTunes: https://itunes.apple.com/gb/podcast/forced-conversations-star/id1180224502?mt=2
And contact us @The_J_Tank and @CaptainColin

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 175 Lilah Sturges
item.description:
Brand new Double Page Spread for your earholes!
Comic writer Lilah Sturges appears on the show this week for an enlightening and insightful conversation about transgender issues and her new book in the Fables pantheon, "Ever After", with artist Dave Justus. She breaks down issues and stereotypes regarding gender expression vs. gender identity, writing trans characters, hormones and much more.
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 39 The Return of Two-Face
item.description:
Welcome to episode 39 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. in this fun episode the guys answer some emails that spark a fun conversation on what creators they would want to work on a Batman related book. They also cover All Star Batman #5, Batman Beyond #3, DKIII #6-7, Detective comics #947, Batman vol 1 #234 and Batman Beyond 2.0
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and weâll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Forced Conversations ep 8 part 2 Comic Catch Up
item.description:
Part Two of the 8th episode of our Star Wars fan podcast. Where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
Please subscribe to our channel and share.
Reviews:
Star Wars Rebels: Ghosts of Geonosis - Both
Star Wars Galactic Atlas - Jay
Star Wars Comics Round Up:
Star Wars issue 25
Writer: Chris Eliopoulos, Jason Aaron
Penciller: Chris Eliopoulos, Jorge Molina
Cover Artist: Mike Deodato
Poe Dameron 9: The Gathering Storm, Part II is the ninth issue of the Marvel comic bookseries Star Wars: Poe Dameron. Written by Charles Soule, with art by Phil Noto, it was published on December 14, 2016.
Doctor Aphra 2: Aphra, Part II is the second issue of the Marvelcomic book series Star Wars: Doctor Aphra. Written by Kieron Gillen, with art by Kev Walker, it was released on December 21, 2016

item.title: Go Trek Yourself ep 8 Anthony Rapp:Mushrooms in Space!
item.description:
Darrell and JK respond to the casting of Anthony Rapp and discuss the character he'll play in the new series. He will be Star Trek's second openly gay character which sparks the discussion about sexuality in Star Trek and how its been handled over the years from TOS and on. The discussion includes an episode of TNG ("Blood and Fire") that was never filmed, but found new life in an episode of Star Trek:Phase 2. See it here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QtifyhPScCwâ
email us your questions or comments to Gotrekyourselfbertrand@gmail.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Gotrekyourself
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/go_trek_yourself/
https://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/go-trek-yourself/ Rate and Review us on iTunes

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 174- Ed Brisson
item.description:
Writer Ed Brisson joins Wendi this week to talk about his new Marvel gig, "Iron Fist", and his upcoming Daredevil miniseries spinoff, "Bullseye". But first some talk about his various creator owned comics like "The Violent" and "Sheltered", his misspent youth, teen runaway stories and more!
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.description:
The seventh episode of our Star Wars fan podcast. Where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
Featured in this weeks episode:
News:
Woody Harleson in talks to play an early mentor of Han Solo:
http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/han-solo-movie-woody-harrelson-talks-star-wars-spinoff-960497
Star Wars Rebels returning on Jan 7th mid season premiere trailer breakdown.
Stephen Stanton to voice an older Obi Wan in Rebels:
http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/01/stephen-stanton-is-voicing-obi-wan-for-star-wars-rebels.html
Disney/LF considering what to do after Carrie Fisher's death:
http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/heat-vision/carrie-fisher-episode-viii-how-star-wars-will-handle-leias-future-960849
Speculation:
Adam Driver talks about Kylo Ren on Larry King:
http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2017/01/adam-talks-about-a-different-kylo-ren-in-star-wars-episode-viii.html
Reviews:
Star Wars Aftermath: Life Debt
Social media stuff:
Tweet: @ForcedConvo - #ForcedConvo
Email: ForcedConvo@gmail.com
Youtube: http://tinyurl.com/ForceCYT
Facebook: http://tinyurl.com/ForceCFB
And contact us @The_J_Tank and @CaptainColin

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 38 Mitch Gerads on a rooftop
item.description:
In the first episode of 2017 we are joined by a special guest comic artist Mitch Gerads to talk about not only his more recent work on the two part arc in Batman 14-15 titled Rooftops as well as his previous works like Marvels Punisher and the critically acclaimed Vertigo book Sheriff of Babylon
twitter : @MitchGerads
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Ignorant Bliss ep 51: Yellow Perils, Art Fights & Toku with
item.description:
Happy New Year - this episode is with my friend Jamie Noguchi, creator of the webcomic Yellow Peril and one of the creators of Super Art Fight. We talk about making comics, illustration for a living, Super Art Fight growing success, and a ton of Tokusatsu (Kamen Rider, Super Sentai and such).
Follow Jamie on twitter @angryzenmaster and on instagram @jamienoguchi
Music in this episode:
You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean
Cash Machine - D.R.A.M.
F + L - Point Point
Super Mario World (Game Over Remix) Extended
Flippin On You - Kaytanada
Vivid Dreams (Ft. River Tiber) - Kaytranada
How Great - Chance the Rapper feat. Jay Electronica and My Cousin Nicole
All the music copyright their respective owners

item.title: Nothings On ep 227 He has lost his Criminal Mind
item.description:
The trio is back for the first show of 2017 to answer emails and talk about the shows/films they watched over the holidays which were Hell or high water, Dr Strange, Chicago PD mid winter finale, Chicago Fire winter finale, Flash winter finale, Justice League action, Ash vs Evil season 2 , Netflix OA, Spectral and at the end Donny shares his thoughts on the passing of Carrie Fisher
Let us know what you are watching and we will read it on the show just email us at nothingsonpodcast@gmail.com
You can follow us on twitter : @NothingsOn123

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 173- Best of 2016/Tom Cruise
item.description:
When two of the Taylor Network of Podcasts finest, Rafael Sanz and Gil Colon, drop by, you are in for a raucous party. We kick it off with a breakdown of the "Fate of the Furious" trailer, followed by our countdown of the best comics of 2016. A surprising lovefest of Nick Spencer, Tom King, Warren Ellis, Mark Millar, Kaare Andrews and more! Please feel free to shoot your opinions and faves to doublepagespread@gmail.com or @doublepgspread on twitter.
The last 30min are devoted to our shared love of the greatest blockbuster star of the past 3 decades, Tom Cruise! We laugh about Scientology, praise his work ethic and examine his career. Along the way we discuss our club names, make inappropriate "Requiem for a Dream" jokes and try to break out of Facebook jail.​
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Forced Conversations ep 6 New Year, New Hope
item.description:
The sixth episode of our Star Wars fan podcast. Where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
Please subscribe to our channel and share.
Featured in this weeks episode:
NEWS:
Carrie Fisher suffers serious heart attack on flight from London to LAX - 23/12/16 http://deadline.com/2016/12/carrie-fisher-heart-attack-hospitalized-star-wars-1201875492/
Boba Fett origin movie rumoured to be back on the cards: http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2016/12/rumor-boba-fett-movie-may-possibly-resume-development.html
Ben Mendelsohn talks different versions of Rogue One: http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2016/12/ben-mendelsohn-talks-shooting-different-versions-of-rogue-one.html
Episode 8!
Rogue one Blu ray - april
SW celebration
Darth Maul is the forthcoming first issue of the five-part Marvel comic book miniseries Star Wars: Darth Maul. The issue, set for release on February 1, 2017, is written by Cullen Bunn with art by Luke Ross. The story centers on the character of Darth Maul before the events of Star Wars: Episode I The Phantom Menace.
Thrawn is an upcoming novel written by Timothy Zahn. The novel is about the character Thrawn, who was canonically reintroduced in the third season of Star Wars Rebels. Zahn was the creator of the original character in the author's Thrawn Trilogy. The novel is scheduled to be released on April 11, 2017.
Aftermath: Empire's End is an upcoming canon novel written by Chuck Wendig. It is the third and final book in The Aftermath Trilogy, it is scheduled to be released on February 21, 2017. The novel will feature the Battle of Jakku, the final battle of the Galactic Civil War.
Discussion: TV series - ABC and LucasFilm are in ongoing talks for a Live-Action Star Wars TV show, which could follow a great many ideas in this expansive universe. tvweb.com
What we are looking forward to in 2017
Listener Questions & Comments:
Tom wells I hope it's not a question in bad taste, but I wanna know how you would address Carrie Fisher's death in Episode 9. Would you recast her? Give Leia an off-screen death? Maybe just somehow write her out of the script? Maybe even use CGI? I personally think they should put a death scene near the start of the movie, maybe with her ship being destroyed, with most shots of her being from behind, as well as using old footage, CGI, etc to create somewhat of a story arc with the First Order killing the leader of the Resistance. What do you guys think?
Darrell Taylor What do you think the connection will be if any with the Guardians of the Whills and the Knights of Ren?
Reviews:
Sphero BB8
Social media stuff:
Tweet: @ForcedConvo - #ForcedConvo Email: ForcedConvo@gmail.com Youtube: http://tinyurl.com/ForceCYT Facebook: http://tinyurl.com/ForceCFB
And contact us @The_J_Tank and @CaptainColin

item.title: Nothings On Special ep: Star Wars Rogue One
item.description:
We could not let the year go out without giving you one more episode before we start the new year with more tv and movie talk. With Donny away because of work and touring we had to pull some of our fellow podcasters from the TaylorNetwork to not only do a spoiler filled discussion of Star Wars Rogue One but also discuss the contributions of Carrie Fisher to not only Star Wars but her work infront and behind the camera. So joining us on this special episode is new to the network Colin and Jay of the podcast Forced Conversations: A Star Wars Fan Show . Julian Lytle of the Ignorant Bliss podcast & Martheus Wade of The Wades World podcast
Let us know what you are watching and we will read it on the show just email us at nothingsonpodcast@gmail.com
You can follow us on twitter : @NothingsOn123

With Donny away because of work and touring we had to pull some of our fellow podcasters from the TaylorNetwork to not only do a spoiler filled discussion of Star Wars Rogue One but also discuss the contributions of Carrie Fisher to not only Star Wars but her work infront and behind the camera. So joining us on this special episode is new to the network Colin and Jay of the podcast Forced Conversations: A Star Wars Fan Show . Julian Lytle of the Ignorant Bliss podcast & Martheus Wade of The Wades World podcast
Let us know what you are watching and we will read it on the show just email us at nothingsonpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Go Trek Yourself - episode 6: The casting of Lieutenant Sa
item.description:
More casting news! Doug Jones was announced to play Lt. Saru! J.K.had a potential opportunity to talk to Doug Jones when he walked into a group showing at a gallery, but decided "he didn't want to bother the guy". Darrell spends most of the episode berating him for this, but they eventually talk about Doug Jones, his previous work, speculation on what this character will be like and what this new species might be. email us your questions or comments to Gotrekyourselfbertrand@gmail.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
Twitter: https://twitter.com/Gotrekyourself
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/go_trek_yourself/

item.title: Forced Conversations - ep 5: Merry Sithmas
item.description:
The fifth episode of our Star Wars fan podcast. Where two heroic scruffy looking nerf herders discuss a galaxy far, far away using the magic of the Internet.
Please subscribe to our channel and share.
Featured in this weeks episode:
NEWS: Rogue One - Hera, Ghost, C1-10P http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2016/12/clarification-on-the-star-wars-rebels-easter-egg-in-rogue-one.html
Rogue One - Vader's castle. Will we see it in Ep8 with Kylo visiting? Story group were setting up future locations. Palpatine decided that Vader should be made to live there. https://www.comicbookmovie.com/sci-fi/star_wars/surprising-details-and-artwork-revealed-about-darth-vaders-a147624
Saw Gerrera coming to Rebels http://ew.com/movies/2016/12/20/rogue-one-saw-gerrera-star-wars-rebels/
Rogue One - Previously unseen footage for Red and Gold Leader: http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2016/12/gareth-edwards-reveals-how-they-used-a-never-before-seen-footage-from-a-new-hope-in-rogue-one.html
Disney allowing character deaths, slightly more graphic. What does this mean for future SW movies? http://www.starwarsnewsnet.com/2016/12/gareth-edwards-discusses-the-rogue-one-ending.html
Jediism not a religion : Uk charity commission ruling
Discussion: Is this the last time we'll see Vader in a movie? Would you want a movie about Vader and would you like Hayden Christensen to appear in it?
Listener Questions & Comments Rey isn't her real name.. from Matt Scott - Kira?
Favourite character in Rogue One: Daniel Hackett
Ideas for the next standalone film : Tom Wells
Obi wan is Reyes grandfather: Daniel Hackett
Will Rogue one effect the direction of the new Han Solo film? : Tom Wells
Reviews Rogue one ultimate visual guide Doctor Alphra #1 Rogue one novelisation (audible)
Spotlight SW Holiday special
Social media stuff:
Tweet: @ForcedConvo - #ForcedConvo Email: ForcedConvo@gmail.com Youtube: http://tinyurl.com/ForceCYT Facebook: http://tinyurl.com/ForceCFB
And contact us @The_J_Tank and @CaptainColin

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 172- Christmas Classics
item.description:
Wendi is rejoined by very dear friends, Bill Zanowitz of the "Comic Book Bears" podcast and writer of "The Crimefighter Inquiry", and writer/folk artist Jeff "Bean" Douglas. They have a full and lengthy discussion of the best Christmas comics from Batman, Starman, DC digests, X-Men, Lobo and Disney to name a few. Things take a hilarious turn in their discussion of best holiday songs as Bill explains the history of "Nestor the Long Eared Christmas Donkey" and a favorite album of a drag queen and some mentally challenged children.
So pull up a glass of eggnog, break open the longbox and celebrate the season as we tell stories of which comic characters are Jewish, tragic deaths of artists who worked too hard and why "Diner" is the best holiday movie.
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Go Trek Yourself ep 5 A Lieutenant Commander with Caveats
item.description:
Darrell and J.K. respond to the announcement of Sonequa Martin-Green being cast as the lead of Star Trek: Discovery. As always we talk about our opinions on the news, review her past roles, speculate about the upcoming show, and discuss the choice as it relates to past Trek precedent.
Discussions include Star Trek VI:The Undiscovered Country, the relationship between captains and first officers in past Trek Shows, the veteran starring role actress/first-time starring role actress dynamic, imagining what a "2 ship show" might look like, Chekote in the 7 year "friend zone", and Captain Picard's muscle-y arms.
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand Twitter: https://twitter.com/Gotrekyourself Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/go_trek_yourself/ https://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/go-trek-yourself/
Rate and review us on iTunes!

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 36 Bruce Wayne is a good boy
item.description:
Welcome to episode 36 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. Also joining us is special guest Donny Salvo comedian and co host of the Nothings On tv/movie podcast to discuss the top 5 writers who runs just did not work. Along with announcing a new contest.
Donny: New Teen Titans vol 1 issue 37 by Marv Wolfman, George Perez
Batman and the Outsiders vol 1 issue 5 by Mike W Barr, Jim Aparo
Darrell : Shadow of the Bat issue 4 by Alan Grant, Norman Breyfogle
Russ: Brave and the bold vol 2 issue 1 by Mark Waid, George Perez
Mike : Batman and Robin issue 23.4 by Tim Seeley , Francis Portela
Chris : Batman: Whatever happened to the Cape Crusader? by Neil Gaiman, Andy Kubert
If you are interested in supporting a great kickstater follow this link: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/23808096/force-a-football-comic-book-series We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and weâll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Double Page Spread 171- Sarah Dyer and Stephanie Buscema
item.description:
Sarah Dyer is a colorist, writer, and zine historian. In 1994 she launched "Action Girl Comics", an all female anthology, as well as writing for "Space Ghost Coast to Coast", "Superman Adventures" and "Batman Beyond". Currently she is art director for Pinup Girl Clothing, creating fun, retro style fashions for women of all sizes.
Stephanie Buscema is a painter, comic artist and illustrator who started as an inker for her grandfather, legendary "Conan the Barbarian" artist, John Buscema. She's worked on a diverse array of projects from children's books to Marvel covers and now fabric for Pinup Girl Clothing. Together Sarah and Steph talk about everything from the truth about art school to Monster High dolls.
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Magnumcast ep 30: Luke gets annoyed
item.description:
No, your downloads aren't wonky. The guys did release two episodes within two weeks of each other. The two of them are rounding the bend on season three, covering "Legacy From a Friend" and "Two Birds of a Feather." The latter is what makes Luke so annoyed, and the only way to find out why is to listen. So strap in and come along for the ride!
Luke Foster Cartoonist The Center of Somewhere http://centerofsomewhere.com
Drawn Away: A Cartoonist Tours America
http://drawnaway.centerofsomewhere.com
Moon Freight 3 http://moonfreight3.centerofsomewhere.com The Gang From the Store: True Tales From the Comic Book Shop http://gangfromthestore.centerofsomewhere.com

Drawn Away: A Cartoonist Tours America
http://drawnaway.centerofsomewhere.com
Moon Freight 3 http://moonfreight3.centerofsomewhere.com The Gang From the Store: True Tales From the Comic Book Shop http://gangfromthestore.centerofsomewhere.com

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 170- Standing Rock Experiences
item.description:
Please excuse the boomy audio of this episode, it was recorded live from the International School of Comics in Chicago. This is a very special dialogue with artists Jill Thompson (Scary Godmother, Wonder Woman: The True Amazon, Sandman), Jim Terry (The Crow: Skinning the Wolves, Alice Cooper vs. CHAOS), and Maria Wolf Lopez. Separately, the three of them have gone to the Standing Rock camp in ND where Native American Water Protectors are trying to prevent construction of the Dakota Access Pipeline, which will pollute important water aquifers all across the midwest. They explain the situation from an eye witness perspective, discuss what supplies are desperately needed at the camps, extol on the spirituality and generosity the people and Maria tells us of her experiences at the first Indigenous Comic Convention.
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 169- Jim Rugg
item.description:
In this episode, the independent and insightful Jim Rugg stops in to discuss his long running webcomic, "Street Angel", the story of the deadliest girl alive- an orphan skateboarder named Jesse Sanchez. He answers listener questions, describes the concept of "narrative collapse", shares about his extensive collection of oddball indie comics from the 80s, works in ballpoint pen, and gives significance to the career of Vanilla Ice.
Become a patron of his patreon at www.patreon.com/streetangel
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 35 The Power that Doomed Batman
item.description:
Welcome to episode 35 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. Before getting to the guys episode picks they catch up and grade some of the current batman line such as Batman Beyond, Batgirl, Detective comics and Nightwing
Darrell: Batman Shadow of the Bat #3 by Alan Grant, Norm Breyfogle
Russ : Batman The Blue, the Gray, and the Bat by Elliot S Maggan, Alan Weiss
Chris: Detective comics vol 1 #375 by Gardner Fox, Chic Stone
Detective comics vol 1 #268 by Bill Finger, Sheldon Moldoff
If you are interested in supporting a great kickstater click on here and pick from a list of value filled incentives https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/23808096/force-a-football-comic-book-series
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: No Apologies ep 260 Whiteys on the moon
item.description:
In this episode we discuss the 10 Worst Black TV Shows of All Time along with giving some non spoiler thoughts on the recent four part story that ran through Supergirl, The Flash, Arrow & Legends of Tomorrow. But the heart of the episode is dedicated to the state of the current Marvel comics X-men books. Along with a spoiler filled discussion on the Death of X mini series and X-men v Inhumans 0.

item.title: Ignorant Bliss ep 50: Shawn Pryor and the F.O.R.C.E
item.description:
Here we have the 50th episode and the guest is my homie Shawn Pryor. I’m talking to him about the release of Cash + Carrie, the release of the book Kentucky Kaiju and his new kickstarter for F.O.R.C.E. - a football comic series. Along the ways we also talk about music and pop culture in general plus working cons and selling comics.
Also of note thank you to everyone and anyone who listens to my podcast. You guys are sometimes the only reason I continue to make the show.
website: http://www.crowntakerstudios.com/
twitter: @shawnrpryor
F.O.R.C.E. Kickstarter:
http://kck.st/2fImbqH
Music in this episode:
You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean
Way Too Gone (Instrumental) - Young Jeezy
Alright (Kaytranada flip)- Janet Jackson
Padeya - Spaceship Boi
Dang! - Mac Miller feat. Anderson .Paak
Father Stretch My Hands Pt. 1 (version 3) - Kanye West feat. Kid Cudi
GIRLS - Joey Purp feat. Chance the Rapper
Outta Sight/Dark Lavender Interlude - Big Baby D.R.A.M.
This Girl - Kungs vs Cookin on 3 Burners
Me and Your Mama - Childish Gambino
All the music copyright their respective owners

item.title: Ignorant Bliss ep 49: Real Talk with Chuck Collins on Everyt
item.description:
Chuck Collins is my guest on this episode of Ignorant Bliss. He’s the artist and creator of the webcomic Bounce! He was also recently announced to be one of the creators on the initial wave of the Catalyst line of comics coming from Lion Forge in 2017. Chuck and I talk about his webcomic, being a bouncer, writing comedy, manga & anime, the state of comics culture along with politics and society as a whole. It’s a good long one. Take some time out to check out Chuck’s work and follow him online!
Website: http://www.bouncethecomic.com/
twitter & instagram: @BOUNCE_COMIC
Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/Bounce
Music in this episode:
You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean
Ain’t No Half-Steppin’ - Big Daddy Kane
I Got Cha Open - Black Moon
Survival of the Fittest - Mobb Deep
Black Jesus - Ghostface Killah feat. Raekwon
Flava in Ya Ear (Remix) - Craig Mack feat. Notorious B.I.G., LL Cool J, Rampage, and Busta Rhymes
Stakes is High - De La Soul
All the music copyright their respective owners

item.media:title: Ignorant Bliss ep 49: Real Talk with Chuck Collins on Everyt
item.media:text:
Chuck Collins is my guest on this episode of Ignorant Bliss. He’s the artist and creator of the webcomic Bounce! He was also recently announced to be one of the creators on the initial wave of the Catalyst line of comics coming from Lion Forge in 2017. Chuck and I talk about his webcomic, being a bouncer, writing comedy, manga & anime, the state of comics culture along with politics and society as a whole. It’s a good long one. Take some time out to check out Chuck’s work and follow him online!
Website: http://www.bouncethecomic.com/
twitter & instagram: @BOUNCE_COMIC
Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/Bounce
Music in this episode:
You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean
Ain’t No Half-Steppin’ - Big Daddy Kane
I Got Cha Open - Black Moon
Survival of the Fittest - Mobb Deep
Black Jesus - Ghostface Killah feat. Raekwon
Flava in Ya Ear (Remix) - Craig Mack feat. Notorious B.I.G., LL Cool J, Rampage, and Busta Rhymes
Stakes is High - De La Soul

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 34 The Dynamic Duo
item.description:
Welcome to episode 34 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. In this latest episode Darrell and Chris are left to defend Gotham city against all threats while answering twitter/facebook questions. We do a few quick reviews of the classic Batman comics Chris picked up at the last few comic cons he attended as well as our official picks which are

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 168 Onrie Kompan
item.description:
Onrie Kompan has defied the rules of the comic industry to be very successful on his own terms. Without the help of a publisher or mainstream comic distribution he is a one man army. Currently he has a documentary being made about his remarkable achievement of selling over 1500 comics at NYCC. Not bad for an American writing a historical comic about a Korean sea battle. His work is featured in Korean museums, he has been invited to do many speaking engagements and has been a consultant on a movie about the life of Yi Soon Shin. This is an uplifting episode about the power of believing in comics and the lessons of how to be a good neighbor at conventions and raise everyone up with you.
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Ignroant Bliss ep 48: Morning Chat with Chris Kindred and R
item.description:
This episode is with Chris Kindred and Richie Pope. Two serious newly recognized talents in this comics game. Both are also accomplished Illustrators. The conversation was recorded on Sunday of Small Press Expo this past September. Ron Wimberly was also around and is in the episode and we all cover a lot stuff like how they started, their group of peers, making illustration and views on the comics industry and making work in general. Twitter: @itskindred @richiepope
instragram: @richiepope @chris.kindred
websites: http://richiepope.com/ http://chriskindred.com/
Music in this episode:
All Night (Kaytranada extended edit) - Chance the Rapper feat. Knox Fortune
Get it Myself - D.R.A.M.
Cranes in the Sky (Kaytranada DJ edit) - Solange

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 167 Brian Pulido
item.description:
Artist/Writer Brian Pulido is a longstanding pioneer of independent horror comics. Known for creating such characters as Evil Ernie, Purgatori and Lady Death, he has always had an uncompromising vision and rock and roll sensibility. Recently his Lady Death Kickstarters have been setting records and breaking the comic distribution model. He shares the story of losing his Chaos Comics characters to lawsuits and how he overcame that adversity to achieve his current success. Pulido is still a groundbreaker in variant covers, using materials like Swarovski crystals and leather, we predict the Gwar comic a week before it was announced, and discuss his love of punk and metal with an analysis of what makes a good "Cookie Monster singer".
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Ignorant Bliss ep 47: MARCH WITH ANDREW AYDIN & NATE POWEL
item.description:
The March trilogy relates the story of the U.S. Civil Rights Movement through the perspective of civil rights leader, Congressman John Lewis. Join co-author Andrew Aydin and artist Nate Powell as they complete their years-long journey of working with Rep. John Lewis to tell the powerfully moving story of his life dedicated to making change by enacting legislature and practicing non-violent protest. Moderated by comics critic Julian Lytle.
recorded at SPX Sept. 17th 2016
Music in this episode:
You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean
Freedom - Beyoncé feat. Kendrick Lamar
All the music copyright their respective owners

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 30 The Batman contest
item.description:
Welcome to episode 30 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. After discussing some of the interesting January solicits we announce our first contest so be sure to listen in and maybe win a Golden Age #Batman Omnibus as well as other great collections.
Darrell: Batman 445-447 , Marv Wolfman, Jim Aparo
Mike: Batman 521-522 , Doug Moench, Kelly Jones
The Batman chronicles 3 , Doug Moench, Brian Stelfreeze
Detective comics 808-810 David Lapham, Ramon Bachs
Robin vol 1 issue 1 Chuck Dixon, Tom Lyle
Detective comics vol 1 445-448 Len Wein, Jim Aparo
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 166 Brian Kirst
item.description:
Film blogger Brian Kirst (Fangoria, Hidden Horror) is the funny, irreverent man behind Big Gay Horror Fan. He and Wendi have a great time this week discussing the outsider nature of scary movies, their deep love of final girls, the year in horror films, asses, and the connections between scream queens and comics, like Brinke and Dave Stevens & Julie Strain and Kevin Eastman, and share memories of Herschell Gordon Lewis. So join two people completely unattracted to women as they giggle over their fondness for titties!
Check out Big Gay Horror Fan right here- https://biggayhorrorfan.wordpress.com
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.title: Double page Spread ep 165- Ming Doyle
item.description:
Artist/writer Ming Doyle joins this episode to discuss her recent work, including last year's phenomenal woman centric mafia story, DC/Vertigo's "The Kitchen". She divulges the nature of reverent nostalgia vs. kitsch, how American comic artists work vs. manga studios, her time co-writing "Constantine: The Hellblazer" with James Tynion IV and making bisexuality more than his "cool trick", along with fan attachment to THAT coat. Currently she is pencilling "Girl Over Paris" with writer Kate Leth, based on the popular YA novels by Gwenda Bond, and has a story in "Love is Love", the comic anthology benefitting families of the victims of the Pulse nightclub shooting in Orlando.
You can support her Patreon right here- https://www.patreon.com/mingdoyle
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork

item.description:

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 27 Beware of Killer Croc
item.description:
Welcome to episode 27 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. In this episode Martin Ferretti from the podcast I am Gotham joins us while Russ goes on an important mission for Batman. The rest of the gang catch up on the most recent Batman and batman family of books:
Batman #7 , All Star Batman #2 , Birds of Prey #2 , Detective comics #939-940 , Nightwing #5 , Red Hood and the outlaws #2 and Trinity #1 before covering our usual picks which are:
Martin- Batman:Legends of the Dark Knight #94 writer/artist : Michael T Gilbert
Darrell/Mike - Batman Vol 1 358-359 Detective Comics Vol 1 525-526 writers: Gerry Conway artists: Don Newton, Dan Jurgens , Curt Swan
Chris- Batman vol 1 #211 writer: Frank Robbins, artist: Irv Novick
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.media:title: Gotham by Geeks ep 27 Beware of Killer Croc
item.media:text:
Welcome to episode 27 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. In this episode Martin Ferretti from the podcast I am Gotham joins us while Russ goes on an important mission for Batman. The rest of the gang catch up on the most recent Batman and batman family of books:
Batman #7 , All Star Batman #2 , Birds of Prey #2 , Detective comics #939-940 , Nightwing #5 , Red Hood and the outlaws #2 and Trinity #1 before covering our usual picks which are:
Martin- Batman:Legends of the Dark Knight #94 writer/artist : Michael T Gilbert
Darrell/Mike - Batman Vol 1 358-359 Detective Comics Vol 1 525-526 writers: Gerry Conway artists: Don Newton, Dan Jurgens , Curt Swan
Chris- Batman vol 1 #211 writer: Frank Robbins, artist: Irv Novick
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 163- Steve Lieber
item.description:
This week's guest is artist Steve Lieber, currently penciling the hilarious crime caper "The Fix" from Image Comics, with writer Nick Spencer. He discusses how they honed their comedic chemistry on Marvel's "Superior Foes of Spider-Man", the distractions of fill in artists, the beauty of obscure fan art, the difficulty of conveying music in comics, Animal Planet's "Vet Life", being recognized for the movie version of "Whiteout" and lots, lots more.
You can find other great podcasts on the network as well as comic and entertainment news by jumping on twitter and following @taylornetwork iTunes

item.title: Gotham by Geek ep 26 Steve Orlando
item.description:
Welcome to episode 26 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. In this episode we are joined by creator Steve Orlando to chat with us about the first Batman crossover post DC rebirth 'Night of the Monster men' which runs through BATMAN #7-8, NIGHTWING #5-6 and DETECTIVE COMICS #941-942. We also talk about his other work on the new Supergirl series , his upcoming Apollo and the Midnighter mini series , Namesake which is published by Boom! studios
http://www.thesteveorlando.com/
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 162 Casefile Arkham
item.description: It's a return visit from the crew of 01 Publishing- Josh Finney, Kat Rocha and Patrick McEvoy. They have a sequel to their successful graphic novel, "Casefile: Arkham". The all new book, "Casefile: Arkham- Her Blood Runs Cold" continues the hard boiled adventures of Detective Hank Flynn on the mean streets of Lovecraft's most cursed of cities-- Arkham. They discuss all the extensive work that goes into (Love)crafting an effective noir story, from believable dialogue to a strong femme fatale. "Casefile: Arkham" is a love letter to 40s films, radio plays and Philip Marlowe, as well as a supernatural thriller.

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 25 Batman day
item.description:
Welcome to episode 25 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books.
In this episode we celebrate Batman day with guest Martin Ferritti of the new Batman podcast "I am Gotham". This ep is full of Batman love for our favorite runs to how the dark knight is able to adapt and change but never fall out of the public eye for very long.

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 24 Two Jokers are better than one
item.description:
Welcome to episode 23 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. Before diving into our picks we discuss the sad passing of Leslie Martinson who directed the Batman 66 film and on a much lighter note we do a Baltimore Comic Con recap Buying comics at Baltimore, tips and trusted dealers and the overuse of characters in comics
Chris –Detective comics #85 by Bill Finger , Ed Kressy , Dick Sprang , Jerry Robinson
Mike -Batman: Gotham Knights #47, Scott Beaty , Roger Robinson
Birds of Prey #91 , Jim Alexander , Brad Walker
Russ-Legends of the World’s Finest (1-3) ,Walter Simonson & Dan Brereton

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 161 Cory Levine/Sanya Anwar
item.description:
"Bowery Boys" is a webcomic from writer Cory Levine and artists Ian Bertram and Brent McKee, recently released in print by Dark Horse Comics. Levine discusses the intricacies of his historical slice of New York, from the gangster slang to the brutality of kid gangs, the organization of unions and the evolving ethnic landscapes.
The second half of the episode is a conversation with Sanya Anwar, artist of the exceptional webcomic "1001", the tale of "1001 Arabian Nights" from Scheherazade's perspective. Her gorgeous, flowing style can also be seen on variant covers from "Assassin's Creed" to "Jughead". She talks about nerding out on art supplies, growing up Pakistani in Canada, and working her first SDCC.
Please forgive the background audio noise at the beginning that lasts less than 10min.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 160 Stranger Things
item.description: In a return engagement, Andrew Shaw of Earth 2 network's "Boob Toob" show comes back to discuss the Netflix original series "Stranger Things" and he's joined by comic writer/artist Alan White of "The Power Principle". Together they break down what made the show such a phenomenon, how accurate it is to the time, why is Barb so popular, the ways little kids argue and which boy Nancy really should have ended up with. This episode is nothing but one big spoiler, so be prepared.

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 45: David Brothers x Ron Wimberly SDCC Spotli
item.description:
I was at San Diego comic con and there while getting to meet people I haven’t known before I got to see old friends. A good thing while there is that I got get a couple of panels recorded. The first one of these is the Spotlight on Ronald Wimberly panel moderated by David Brothers. Both are the homies and been guests on this show. Check out the programing information below.
“For the past 14 years, Ronald Wimberly has been telling stories that pair his world view with his strong storytelling instincts, resulting in works like the Eisner Award-nominated Lighten Up and The Prince of Cats, his collaborations with brands like Nike and Mishka, and even designing for animation like Black Dynamite. Wimberly will share his perspective on designing stories, agitprop and the politics of aesthetics, culture and appropriation, the importance of iconoclasm and why he suspects he'll never work for Marvel or DC again. Moderated by David Brothers.”
Links: http://iamdavidbrothers.com/ http://tumblr.iamdavidbrothers.com/ @hermanos | Twitter https://www.instagram.com/davidbrothers/
https://imagecomics.com/features/theiword https://imagecomics.com/comics/series/image-plus
http://ronaldwimberly.com/ @raynardfaux | Twitter @ronaldwimberly | Instagram http://d3-14.tumblr.com
Prince of Cats Image Comics page | https://imagecomics.com/comics/releases/prince-of-cats-hc
Music in this episode: You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean Hot Boys (remix) instrumental - Missy Elliot featuring Nas, Eve, & Q-Tip prod. Timbaland Groovy Tony/Eddie Kane (feat. Jadakiss) - Schoolboy Q
All the music copyright their respective owners
Summer Playlist Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/user/julianlytle/playlist/4Rh8vDDPEIQJp6ZZRu9c1S Apple Music: Ignorant Bliss Summer 2016
Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, IG, Snapchat, Tumblr, Soundcloud & Vine
My webstore: http://julianlytle.storenvy.com/ My threadless Artist Shop: https://julianlytle.threadless.com/
email the show at ignorantblisspodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 44: Ronald Wimberly 5
item.description: So a few weeks back Ron posted a piece of writing on Tumblr called “Stop doing spec pages: Why DC, Marvel, Boom etc. should pay you for your test pages.” He wrote about how the Majors of the comic book industry shouldn’t solicit free spec pages from artists they might want on their comics. We talk that and some of the discussion it caused in some places online. We go into more comic business ethics talk and identity within the culture of comics. There are some tangents on film and television. The post: http://d3-14.tumblr.com/post/146812301568/stop-doing-spec-pages-why-dc-marvel-boom-etc A follow up post: http://d3-14.tumblr.com/post/146881281348/corporations-should-pay-for-the-samples-they Links: http://ronaldwimberly.com/ @raynardfaux | Twitter @ronaldwimberly | Instagram http://d3-14.tumblr.com Prince of Cats Image Comics page | https://imagecomics.com/comics/releases/prince-of-cats-hc Music in this episode: You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean I Got The Keys - DJ Khaled featuring Jay-Z and Future No Problem - Chance the Rapper featuring 2 Chainz and Lil’ Wayne THat Part - Schoolboy Q featuring Kanye West 4PM in Calabasas - Drake All Nite - Clams Casino featuring Vince Staples Lockjaw - French Montana featuring Kodak Black All the music copyright their respective owners Summer Playlist Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/user/julianlytle/playlist/4Rh8vDDPEIQJp6ZZRu9c1S Apple Music: Ignorant Bliss Summer 2016 Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, IG, Snapchat, Tumblr, Soundcloud & Vine My webstore: http://julianlytle.storenvy.com/ My threadless Artist Shop: https://julianlytle.threadless.com/ email the show at ignorantblisspodcast@gmail.com Subscribe on iTunes - https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/ignorant-bliss-podcast-feed/id415595194?mt=2 also please leave a review if you can! Also on Stitcher - http://www.stitcher.com/podcast/ignorant-bliss Also on Soundcloud - https://soundcloud.com/julianlytle Also on Google Play Music - https://play.google.com/music/m/Ipbp7daje4f62qiyzyfujoxhpwi?t=Ignorant-Bliss Also on Mixcloud - https://www.mixcloud.com/julianlytle/ Also on the Taylor Network of Podcasts - http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/?s=ignorant+bliss&submit=Search

We talk that and some of the discussion it caused in some places online. We go into more comic business ethics talk and identity within the culture of comics. There are some tangents on film and television. The post: http://d3-14.tumblr.com/post/146812301568/stop-doing-spec-pages-why-dc-marvel-boom-etc A follow up post: http://d3-14.tumblr.com/post/146881281348/corporations-should-pay-for-the-samples-they Links: http://ronaldwimberly.com/ @raynardfaux | Twitter @ronaldwimberly | Instagram http://d3-14.tumblr.com Prince of Cats Image Comics page | https://imagecomics.com/comics/releases/prince-of-cats-hc Music in this episode: You Are Luhhh - Frank Ocean I Got The Keys - DJ Khaled featuring Jay-Z and Future No Problem - Chance the Rapper featuring 2 Chainz and Lil’ Wayne THat Part - Schoolboy Q featuring Kanye West 4PM in Calabasas - Drake All Nite - Clams Casino featuring Vince Staples Lockjaw - French Montana featuring Kodak Black All the music copyright their respective owners Summer Playlist Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/user/julianlytle/playlist/4Rh8vDDPEIQJp6ZZRu9c1S Apple Music: Ignorant Bliss Summer 2016 Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, IG, Snapchat, Tumblr, Soundcloud & Vine My webstore: http://julianlytle.storenvy.com/ My threadless Artist Shop: https://julianlytle.threadless.com/ email the show at ignorantblisspodcast@gmail.com Subscribe on iTunes - https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/ignorant-bliss-podcast-feed/id415595194?mt=2 also please leave a review if you can! item.title: Double Page Spread ep 159 HeroesCon
item.description:
Live from Heroes Con in Charlotte, NC, it's Double Page Spread! First up is an interview with the legendary Mike Grell, writer/artist on "The Warlord", "Jon Sable, Freelance", and "Starslayer". We discuss his influential work on "Green Arrow" and what he thinks of the show "Arrow", dream casting of Jon Sable, adapting James Bond, stories of doing creator owned work in the 80s and more.
Next is a conversation with Amy Chu covering her perseverance releasing her own anthology series, how a chance meeting brought Larry Hama out of drawing retirement, "coming out" to her family as a comic writer, her work on "Poison Ivy" and writing Wonder Woman for "Sensation Comics".

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 158 Wrestling roundtable
item.description: This week Wendi goes inside the squared circle with podcaster Matthew Peters, comic shop owner Terry Gant and artist Dean Stahl (Headlocks and Headaches). They discuss what they love about the spectacle and sport, pitch ideas for WWE comics, the Chaos! comics from the 90s about the Undertaker and Chyna, the NXT roster, famous family dynasties, artists who cross over like Jill Thompson designing ring gear and Art Baltazar and Franco of Aw Yeah! doing comics with Christopher Daniels and Kazarian, is CM Punk a good comic writer? and so much more!

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 43: A talk with Ulises Farinas about Buño
item.description:
I had to pleasure to talk to my friend Ulises Farinas about his new publishing venture Buño with Magnetic Press. We talk about his motivations, his goals, and projects he’s releasing with Buño. We also talk comics industry in general in regards to marketing, self publishing, work, editors and tactics in dealing with the industry.
Preorder the first book from Buño, Light in the Previews catalog for books being released in September.
https://ulisesfarinas.com/ https://bunobooks.com/ - Comixology link: https://www.comixology.com/Buster-Norah-Press/comics-publisher/6490-0?ref=Y29taWMvdmlldy9kZXNrdG9wL3B1Ymxpc2hlckluZm8
Music in this episode: New Level - A$AP Ferg featuring Future Feedback - Kanye West Stretch 2-3-4 - WatchTheDuck featuring Pharrell Williams Lite Spots - Kaytranada
All the music copyright their respective owners
Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, IG, Snapchat, Tumblr, Soundcloud & Vine

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 19 Rebirth of a hero
item.description:
Welcome to episode 19 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. In this episode we cover the current Batbooks and our individual picks of the week. Current books:
Batgirl #1 by Hope Larson , Rafael Albuquerque
Red Hood and the Outlaws: Rebirth #1 by Scott Lobdell, Dexter Soy
Nightwing #1 by Tim Seeley, Javier Fernandez
Detective Comics #935-7 by James Tynion IV, Alvaro Martinez
Batgirl and the Birds of Prey: Rebirth #1 by Shawna Benson, Julie Benson , Claire Roe Batman #3 by Tom King, David Finch Show picks:
Mike-Punisher/Batman #1 by Chuck Dixon, John Romita Jr
Chris-Batman: Dark Allegiances by Howard Chaykin
Darrell-Batman: Venom by Denny O'neil , Â· Trevor Von Eeden Â· Russell Braun Â· Jose Luis Garcia Lopez
Russ-Vengeance of Bane 2 by Chuck Dixon , Graham Nolan
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and weâll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Wades World ep 11 Summertime
item.description:
Martheus, Janet and Anakin are back. After a LOOOOONG hiatus that took the family from the woods of Camp Kia Kima, to the convention halls of Anime Blues Con, the Wades have a lot to fill you in on. Join them as they talk Boy Scout Camping, Drawing for Patreon, Indy Comics, Comic Conventions, Overwatch, Street Fighter 5 and Star Wars Battlefront. Let's get caught up!!!
Let us know what you think!!!!! wadesworldpodcast@gmail.com

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 42: A quiet Saturday with K-Sade and Steven (
item.description:
So with things being busy with going to a few conventions this summer I decided to go into my stash and put up an episode I haven’t released. This is a conversation with two friends of mine, K-Sade and Steven. We talk about a lot of stuff and is completely casual.
Music in this episode:
Bother – Les Sins
Workin’ – Puff Daddy and the Family
Tell Your Friends (Chop not Slop) – The Weeknd

The Hills – The Weeknd
