Replaceable Girl – Drake featuring Trey Songs
Mt. Olympus – Big K.R.I.T.
I Wonder (instrumental) – Kanye West
Bad Blood – NAO
Brown Skin Girl – Leon Bridges
Watch out for the Big Girl – DJ Deja
Comfortable (instrumental) – Lil’ Wayne featuring Babyface

Find A Way (instrumental) – A Tribe Called Quest

item.title: Nothing's On ep 215 SDCC and Beyond
item.description:
With Darrell fresh out of San Diego the gang dive into the SDCC2016 movie and tv news. First they go down the list of all the SDCC2016 movie/tv teasers and trailers which you can look at here . Along with discussing Netflix Stranger things, new Ghostbusters movie, Bates motel, X men Apocalypse, Jungle book, Ultimate Spider-man animated cartoon and Star Trek Beyond plus answering listener emails while falling down the IMDB rabbit hole.
Let us know what you are watching and we will read it on the show just email us at nothingsonpodcast@gmail.com
You can follow us on twitter : @NothingsOn123
http://www.stitcher.com/

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 157- Rafer Roberts
item.description: Rafer Roberts is the hilarious and inventive writer of the current Valiant series, "A&A: the Adventures of Archer and Armstrong". He is also up for a Harvey award for his art in a recent issue of "X-O Manowar". He tells us what's going on over at Valiant, the status of their movie plans, the 4001AD crossover, how adorable Faith and Archer are together, the popularity of comic and beer tie ins, and raves about artists Mike Norton and David LaFuente! Check out Rafer's Patreon at https://www.patreon.com/plasticfarm

item.title: Double Page Spreads ep 156- Gabriel Hardman/ Corinna Bechko
item.description:
The creators of Image Comics "Invisible Republic", Gabriel Hardman and Corinna Bechko discuss their political sci fi epic, the nature of unreliable narrators in revolution, how zoology relates to writing "Planet of the Apes", "Star Wars: Legacy", why you shouldn't put "Kazaam" on your resume and the influence of Francois Truffaut on Austin Powers!
Brought to you by www.dcbservice.com, the Discount Comic Book Service, giving you the highest level of customer service and the lowest discounts on the hottest titles.
If you're in Chicago check out www.thirdcoastcomics.com, a friendly neighborhood store for all your comic needs.
as well as www.blackphoenixalchemylab.com, providing limited edition fragrances and decadent hair gloss and claw polish!

item.title: Gotham by Geeks: The Introduction to No Man's Land
item.description:
Welcome to another special event topic episode of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. In this episode we discuss whats going on in the video game section of Batman before giving some background on Batman No Mans Land and covering
Batman no Man's Land #1
Batman Shadow of the Bat #83
Batman #563
Detective #730
Azrael Agent of the Bat #51
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and weâll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 18 Who Knows What Evil?
item.description:
Welcome to episode 18 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. In this episode we cover the first two weeks of Batbooks which are:
Batman #2 Tom King and David Finch
Batman/Daredevil by Alan Grant and Eduardo Barretto
Legends of the Dark Knight: Gothic issues 6-10 by Grant Morrison and Klaus Janson
Batman vol 1 #253 by Dennis O'neil and Irv Novick
And we discuss our top 5 times Batman was beaten in a fight or has given up
We want to hear from you on suggestions for future stories to read or feedback for past episodes so send us your emails to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
You can also Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 155- Scoot McMahon
item.description: Aw Yeah! Time for a conversation with the very endearing Scott "Scoot" McMahon! He discusses being part of the Aw Yeah! Comics crew, what he's learned from Art Baltazar and Franco, Darwin Cooke and the acceptance of cartoon styles, capturing a childlike sense of humor, his book "Sami, the Samurai Squirrel", and how he and Franco used Patreon to create the super fun "choose your own adventure" style comic, "Spot on Adventure"!

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 17 Batman on a plane
item.description:
Welcome to episode 17 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. In this episode we cover the first two weeks of Batbooks which are:
Batman #2 by Tom King & David Finch
Detective comics 934-935 by James Tynion IV & Eddy Barrows
The Dark Knight Returns: The Last Crusade by Brian Azzarello/Frank Miller & John Romita Jr
Dark Knight III The Master Race #1-4 by Brian Azzarrello , Frank Miller & Andy Kubert
Dark Night: A True Batman Story by Paul Dini & Eduardo Risso
We want to hear from you so send us your feedback to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 154- Vivek Tiwary
item.description: Vivek Tiwary is the writer/historian behind the Eisner award winning graphic novel "The Fifth Beatle" and has so much exciting news! He's recently gotten a tv deal to turn the story of Brian Epstein into a tv show and hopes to create more seasons about other famous managers. He and Wendi discuss the fascinating network of behind the scenes people who supported the Beatles, like the impact of George Harrison's sister in America. We also get to hear about Vivek's unique upbringing in NY and the equal influence of punk rock and Broadway that led him to helping produce Green Day's "American Idiot". He is also currently publishing his online illustrated young adult novel "Asha Ascending", with artist Sara Richard, which is open to input and changes with audience feedback. Hear all that as well as Tony award and Hamilton discussions, current music related tv shows, the Musicians on Call non-profit, Valiant comics and so much more!

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 15 Chuck Dixon
item.description:
Welcome to episode 15 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. In this episode we are joined by comic veteran Chuck Dixon to talk about his work on the DC characters Batman, Nightwing , Robin , Black Canary, Huntress & many others. We also talk about his current work writing the thriller Levon's Ride along with popular time travel thriller series Bad Times and more. To learn more about his current books go to http://dixonverse.blogspot.com/ and pick up his books on amazon
We want to hear from you so send us your feedback to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and weâll read it on the show.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 153 Steve Bryant/Mark Stegbauer
item.description: This week brings the debut of the new Action Lab Comics all ages book, "Ghoul Scouts". Writer Steve Bryant (Athena Voltaire) and artist Mark Stegbauer join Wendi to discuss their new sojourn into the supernatural, a story of kids who are busier fighting monsters than earning merit badges, perfect for fans of adventures like "Monster Squad" or "Lumberjanes". We talk about the perfect weapons for pre-teens, establishing voice for your characters, and the genius of "Real Genius".

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 14 Tom King spotlight panel
item.description:
Welcome to episode 14 of Gotham by Geeks. At the recent Awesome con Darrell , Chris and creator Christina Blanch moderated a panel spotlighting Tom King the writer on DC's Batman , Sheriff of Babylon and The Vision published by Marvel. There is plenty of comic tidbits on his upcoming Batman run along with his work from his novel A Once Crowded Sky all the way to his current work including a very personal story in the Vertigo Quarterly:Black titled Black death in America.
We want to hear from you so send us your feedback to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and weâll read it on the show.
Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 152 Brent Schoonover
item.description: This week Wendi is joined by artist Brent Schoonover. She laments the loss of "Howling Commandos of SHIELD" (only 6 issues??), a book that combined the best Marvel monsters of every era. He also shares about his work on "Ant Man", "Back to the Future", and what it's like to be known for a retro penciling style. Brent tells the story of being hired as a sketch artist at a Paisley Park party for Morris Day and the Time where no cameras were allowed. (This episode was recorded the week before Prince passed). He also answers the very important question- "Dirty Dozen or Great Escape"?

item.title: Nothings On ep 211 Season finales & Game of thrones
item.description:
Join Darrell, Donny & Jim as they discuss all the recent tv/movie news as well as discussing the current shows/films that you are probably watching or thinking of watching. And for this episode we have special guest Rene Alvarado the host of Rants and Raves podcast as well as the comic con photographer for this taylornetwork. Before delving into the current season of Game of Thrones we cover the show finales for The Flash, Arrow, Legends of Tomorrow, Grey's Anatomy, Empire, Chicago PD, Gotham, Scandal, Chicago Fire, Blackish and much more
Let us know what you are watching and we will read it on the show just email us at nothingsonpodcast@gmail.com
You can follow us on twitter : @NothingsOn123
http://www.stitcher.com/

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 13 Rebirth
item.description:
Welcome to episode 13 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. In this episode as we discuss some of the Bat family books wrapping up such as We are Robin and Batgirl before diving into Rebirth and Batman Rebirth where we have a surprise visit by Tom King the co writer of of the book and new writer on the Batman title moving forward. Tom shares his thoughts on the book as well as on the first arc of his upcoming run.

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 41: Cloth Talk on Infinite Earths
item.description:
This time it’s my friend Kenny Keil talking with me. We cover a lot of subjects here. Some good rap and music talk. We talk some TLOP (The Life of Pablo) and Kanye. We talk about the craft of making comics and drawing in vector along with comedy writing on Mad Magazine and why Cracked was dope. Kenny tells me how he going into writing Rap video treatments. We talk about Kenny’s comics, Rhyme Travelers, Death trip, Tales to Suffice, and Ferrari Boyz webcomic. We also talk about biting, hip hop culture and comic fandom (read the subtext bruh). Plus a manga talk all throughout. Enjoy this cloth talk. Major keys are laid down.
Check out Kenny online: http://talestosuffice.com/ http://ferrariboyz.talestosuffice.com/ http://kennykeil.blogspot.com/
Twitter - https://twitter.com/kennykeil
Buy his comics on comixology: Rhyme Travelers - https://www.comixology.com/Rhyme-Travelers/comics-series/42918?ref=Y29taWMvdmlldy9kZXNrdG9wL2JyZWFkY3J1bWJz
Death Trip - https://www.comixology.com/Death-Trip/comics-series/13283

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 151 Shawn Pryor
item.description:
In one of her very favorite conversations, Wendi is joined by writer, publisher, podcaster, talent scout and master raconteur, Shawn Pryor. He talks about the hard work of the comic hustle, how to avoid burnout, the difference between diversity and equality and his time at Action Lab Comics and his new imprint Crowntaker Studios, his current all ages mystery story "Cash and Carrie", the upcoming "Motherless Creatures" with Tressina Bowling, as well as "F.O.R.C.E.", a football story not just for sports fans.
Plus hilarious pop diva speculations and storytelling about Janet Jackson and Mariah Carey, the lost Fox hip hop cop shows "New York Undercover" and "Fastlane", what is Jon B up to? and so much more! (Please note this episode was actually taped the week before Prince passed and Janet announced her pregnancy).

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 12 Spoiler levels up
item.description:
Welcome to episode 12 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris with special guest Brian Letendre of the Secret Identity podcast http://www.secretidentitypodcast.com/ as they discuss the world of Batman comic books.
Before getting into this weeks picks we discuss the Ben Affleck getting a promotion by Warner bros , the criticism of Marvel and DC franchises and the Killing Joke trailer.
Detective #719
Batgirl #9-12 Bryan Q miller, Lee Garbett , Pere Perez
Batman: The Man who laughs #1 Ed Brubaker , Doug Mahnke
Batman in Barcelona Mark Waid, Diego Olmos
Batman: Dreamland Alan Grant, Norman Breyfogle
Top five Batman gadgets
We want to hear from you so send us your feedback to gothambygeeks@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 40: Trill talk with Martheus Wade
item.description:
So on this episode I’m talking to my friend Martheus Wade about his projects and making comics independently for many years. We also talk about pop culture and fandom and how that affects making stories in the comic industry and entertainment in general. Honest talk and I hope you enjoy.
Check out and follow Martheus online: https://twitter.com/martheusaw https://www.instagram.com/martheusaw/
Follow his work: His website: http://toshigawa.com/
The Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/MAWProductions?ty=h
Shinobi Ninja Princess on Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/Shinobi-Ninja-Princess-Martheus-Wade/dp/1632290847
Shinobi Ninja Princess on Comixology: https://www.comixology.com/Shinobi-Ninja-Princess/comics-series/22554
Music in this episode: Game Over Remix - Lil’ Flip featuring Young Buck and Bun B (<-Martheus’ favorite song!) You Don’t Want Drama - 8Ball and MJG Popping’ My Collar - Three 6 Mafia Elvis Presley Blvd - Rick Ro$$ featuring Project Pat Señorita - Justin Timberlake
All the music copyright their respective owners

item.title: Gotham by Geeks: A tribute to Darwyn Cooke
item.description:
Welcome to another episode of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books. This week we mourn the recent passing of the award wining comic legend Darwyn Cooke and we decided to do this by celebrating the great contributions Mr Cooke made to comics.
New Frontier 1-6
Batman/Spirit 1
Jonah Hex 33
Detective comics 759-762
Catwoman 1-4

item.title: Ignorant Bliss ep 39: Fly times with Ted Lange IV & Turner L
item.description:
This episode is with the homies Ted Lange IV and Turner Lange. Out in the beauty that is LA they are making fresh and exciting comics. I met Ted and Turner in our art school days in Brooklyn NYC. So in this episode I talk with Ted about his comic Warp Zone and Turner about his comic The Adventures of Wally Fresch. We also talk about making more diverse comics in the landscape, black heroes in fiction and crafting worlds with culture in fiction, The Force Awakens, ton of Star trek talk, writing general and more. Also Ted got me to talk about some of my New Gods ideas so when they get bit you know where they got the keys from.
Turner Lange: Twitter - https://twitter.com/WallyFresch Site - http://turnerlange.wix.com/turnerlange Comixology (buy the comic!) - https://www.comixology.com/Turner-Lange/comics-creator/68891
Ted Lange IV: Twitter: https://twitter.com/Tlange4 Tumblr: http://hellotedward.tumblr.com/ WARP ZONE DROPS ON COMIXOLOGY ON APRIL 20TH 2016!! GO COP!!
Music in this episode: Frank Ocean - You Are Luh Black Moon - Buck’em Down Digital Underground - Kiss You Back Camp Lo - Luchini Black Star - Definition Nas - Halftime De La Soul - Stakes is High Janelle Monae - Many Moons Ice T - 6 In the Mornin’
All the music copyright their respective owners
Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, IG, Snapchat, Tumblr, Soundcloud & Vine Subscribe on iTunes - https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/ignorant-bliss-podcast-feed/id415595194?mt=2 also please leave a review if you can!
Also on Stitcher - http://www.stitcher.com/podcast/ignorant-bliss
Also on Soundcloud - https://soundcloud.com/julianlytle
Also on the Taylor Network of Podcasts - http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/?s=ignorant+bliss&submit=Search

We also talk about making more diverse comics in the landscape, black heroes in fiction and crafting worlds with culture in fiction, The Force Awakens, ton of Star trek talk, writing general and more. Also Ted got me to talk about some of my New Gods ideas so when they get bit you know where they got the keys from.
Turner Lange: Twitter - https://twitter.com/WallyFresch Site - http://turnerlange.wix.com/turnerlange Comixology (buy the comic!) - https://www.comixology.com/Turner-Lange/comics-creator/68891

item.title: Double Page spread ep 150 FCBD
item.description:
In this very special Free Comic Book Day episode, Wendi is live from Defiant Comics in Forest Park, IL with owner Brian Fisher. He fills in on the state of retail, the hot books on FCBD, the return of ROM: Space knight and which Image books are selling like hotcakes.
Then writer Rafael Nieves comes over for a chat about his new book, "Compulsion" with Hugo Petrus that further combines his unique style of suspense and humor. Find him at www.rafwrites.blogspot.com
The Boob Toob crew is reunited! Dapper Dan Pua and Amazing Andrew Shaw weigh in on Captain America: Civil War (spoilers!) as well as reminisce about the significance of the late Darwin Cooke.

item.title: No Apologies ep 243 Requiem for a Dream
item.description:
In this episode we discuss the changing dynamic with DC and Marvel television , Fantastic Four film , Black Panther film adding Michael B Jordan , Black Panthers arch villains, Negro Loki falls in love, Game of thrones, Nino Brown, The greatness of HBO's Oz, Raf's perfect comic memory, Spider-man:Reign before we learn during the recording of the untimely passing of the comic great Darwyn Cooke and with that we reflect on the contributions he made to comics.
Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx
Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/

item.title: Ignorant Bliss ep 38: 2015 in Film and TV with Joey Aulisio
item.description:
On this episode Joey and I talk about many things from going to film screenings, films of 2015, my going to see less films in theaters, films I missed, Star Wars the Force Awakens, Jurassic World, Person of Interest, Christopher Nolan & Interstellar, and much more. This episode is split in two parts. Side A & B.
Enjoy!
Check out and follow Joey online: @joey_aulisio
Music in this episode: R.I.P. Phife Dawg A Tribe Called Quest
All the music copyright their respective owners

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 10 Jokers are wild
item.description:
Welcome to episode 10 of Gotham by Geeks. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books.
This week we dive into some Movie talk, physical media vs digital media, Atari 2600 on Black and White TV's before diving into our weekly picks which are:
Batman vol 1 # 431
Batman DOA
Legends of the Dark Knight #50
Batman vol #68
Top 5 Characters you want to have a smaller role going forward in the new Rebirth
Also stay tuned to the end for some pre recording banter and debate about the books deemed lame duck issues.
We want to hear from you so send us your feedback to thetaylornetworkofpodcasts@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Ignorant Bliss ep 36 2015 in Film with Dominic Griffin
item.description:
Episode 36 starts a three episode stint on 2015 in Film. The first conversation is with my friend Dominic Griffin. He writes reviews of film (and other forms of art) on different blogs along with the Baltimore City Paper. We go over our thoughts on some of the films this year and filmmakers and the industry itself. We also talk a bit about the Academy Awards which is prime for this year’s Oscars.
Check out and follow Griffin online: https://twitter.com/captain_fuck http://deadshirt.net/author/dom/ http://www.citypaper.com/search/dispatcher.front?Query=Dominic+Griffin&target=all&spell=on
Music in this episode: Frank Ocean - You Are Luh Kanye West (feat. Kid Cudi) - Father Stretch My Hands pt. 1 A$AP Rocky (Feat. Pharrell) - Hear Me Kali Uchis - Ridin’ Round J.U.S.T.I.C.E. League (feat. Rick Ro$$ & Drake) - Empire Baauer (feat. Novelist & Leikeli47) - Day Ones Azealia Banks - The Big Big Beat Kanye West - 30 Hours (GOOD Fridays version)
All the music copyright their respective owners
Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, IG, Snapchat, Tumblr, Soundcloud & Vine Subscribe on iTunes - https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/ignorant-bliss-podcast-feed/id415595194?mt=2 also please leave a review if you can!
Also on Stitcher - http://www.stitcher.com/podcast/ignorant-bliss
Also on Soundcloud - https://soundcloud.com/julianlytle
Also on the Taylor Network of Podcasts - http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/?s=ignorant+bliss&submit=Search

item.title: Gotham By Geeks ep 9 The collected edition
item.description:
Welcome to episode 9 of Gotham by Geeks, a Batman comics podcast. Join co-hosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books.
This week we kick off the episode with a discussion of the recently revealed advance solicitations for Bat-family collected editions coming out this fall.
And then diving into the books, we discuss:
Face the Face story arc (Batman 651-54, Detective 817-820) Realworlds: Batman World's Finest 302
And finally, this week the Top 5 list examines the Bat-family characters that we want to see have bigger roles going forward.
Send us your feedback to thetaylornetworkofpodcasts@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.
Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 24 My Winnipeg
item.description:
BACK! BY (what should have been) POPULAR DEMAND! The ARTS AND CRAP crew make Darrell "Anti-Life" Taylor take another bite at the maple-flavored apple that is the oeuvre of Canadian avant-garde auteur , Guy "One of the greatest film directors in history" Maddin! Long-time listeners know we covered Maddin's feature debut, TALES FROM THE GIMLI HOSPITAL, in episode 5 and Darrell was . . . not happy. After viewing this 2007 masterpiece, which starred Ann Savage (What a woman!, Two-man Submarine, Saved by the Bell), and Lewis Negin (Sissy-Boy Slap-Party, The Forbidden Room), did Darrell revise his opinion of the celebrated cinematic innovator? Or is he still a friggin' idiot?*
Also, what did Sheila "Friend of the Working Man" Villari think? And why does Chris "Kindness, love, butterflies, rainbows, peace, and stuff" Kipiniak put up with either of them? Listen . . . and find out!
*Darrell Taylor did not approve this message
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast
E-mail your thoughts, your oral histories of local hockey clubs, or suggestions of things you'd like us to talk about to:
artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com
http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com
You can hear this episode and other podcasts on the network on the TaylorNetwork stitcher radio.

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 8 Beware of Ra's Al Ghul
item.description:
Welcome to episode 8 of Gotham by Geeks, a Batman comics podcast. Join cohosts Darrell, Russ, Mike, and Chris as they discuss the world of Batman comic books.
This week is another Bat-Essential topic: the Ra's Al Ghul trilogy by O'Neil and Adams and others. The introduction to Ra's is a must read for any Bat fan.
Specifically, the issues covered are:
Batman 232 Batman 242 Batman 243 Batman 244
And back again is our top 5 list. This week it's top Batman movies.

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 148:Colleen Coover and Paul Tobin
item.description: The 2016 Eisner nominations were just announced and several have rightfully gone to the creative team of the exceptionally charming "Bandette", artist Colleen Coover and writer Paul Tobin. They both take the time to talk to Wendi about the thrilling fun and whimsy of "Bandette" and how to create such a unique and timeless take on their interpretation of Paris. They discuss what makes a good heist story, their European comic influences, the endearing nature of Audrey Hepburn, as well as their previous collaboration "Gingerbread Girl" and Tobin's work on such comics as "Colder" and "Plants vs. Zombies".

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 6 The rise and fall of Gotham city

Crime Bible #1-5

Gotham Knights #1
Gotham Central #1

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 147 Daniel Jun Kim
item.description: Daniel Jun Kim has been producing thought provoking content for years through his blog, Pop Mythology. He has used his personal struggles and chronic illness as an impetus to inspire others and writes about the heroes and characters who influence him. Whether its having the Deadpool mindset, thinking small like Ant Man or feeling the interconnectedness of life like Guardians of the Galaxy, Kim taps into how we use pop culture as motivation. Currently he has a kickstarter for an inspirational book, "Your Superhero Origin: Transform Suffering into Superpowers", which you can donate to through https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/popmythologist/your-superhero-origin.

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode146: Sean E. Williams/Joelle Jones
item.description:
First up in this double header episode, the esteemed writer and entrepreneur, Sean E. Williams (Fairest, Sensation Comics, Artful Daggers, Vampire Diaries). Comicker is his brand new digital imprint and he brings insight into the modern face of digital publishing, through his background of writing for Monkeybrain and his current work on the groundbreaking Stela app. They talk about the diversity of the creators and stories he's picked for Comicker and what the future holds for print versions as well.
The second half is a chat with the exceptional Joelle Jones. Her Dark Horse comic "Lady Killer" is a sleek and stylish masterpiece that combines her love of meticulous detail and some dirty violence. To say this beautifully crafted retro tale of gender roles and assassination invokes Mad Men doesn't begin to scratch the surface of how cool and fun it is. She also talks about her work on Cullen Bunn's horror epic "Hellheim" and working with Max Landis on "Superman: American Alien".

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 36: 2015 in Film with Dominic Griffin
item.description:
Episode 36 starts a three episode stint on 2015 in Film. The first conversation is with my friend Dominic Griffin. He writes reviews of film (and other forms of art) on different blogs along with the Baltimore City Paper. We go over our thoughts on some of the films this year and filmmakers and the industry itself. We also talk a bit about the Academy Awards which is prime for this year’s Oscars.
Check out and follow Griffin online: https://twitter.com/captain_fuck http://deadshirt.net/author/dom/ http://www.citypaper.com/search/dispatcher.front?Query=Dominic+Griffin&target=all&spell=on
Music in this episode: Frank Ocean - You Are Luh Kanye West (feat. Kid Cudi) - Father Stretch My Hands pt. 1 A$AP Rocky (Feat. Pharrell) - Hear Me Kali Uchis - Ridin’ Round J.U.S.T.I.C.E. League (feat. Rick Ro$$ & Drake) - Empire Baauer (feat. Novelist & Leikeli47) - Day Ones Azealia Banks - The Big Big Beat Kanye West - 30 Hours (GOOD Fridays version)
All the music copyright their respective owners

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 145- Mike "McBeardo" McPadden
item.description: Outspoken writer Mike "Mcbeardo" McPadden has had a long and tawdry history with cinema, including writing for online phenomenon Mr. Skin as well as Hustler and VH1 and Esquire. He joins Wendi for an engrossing and fun talk about his life in NY during the grindhouse era, his epic book "Heavy Metal Movies" and his current research into the history of teen sex comedies, as well as their shared disdain for ironic "so bad its good" films.

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 5 Batman and friends
item.description:
Welcome back to episode 5 of Gotham by Geeks, a Batman comics podcast! Join Darrell Taylor, Russ Latham, Mike Myers, and Chris Campbell as they dive in and discuss a selection of Bat-family comics.
Covered this week are the following:
Batman #251 Batman #0 Batman and the Outsiders #1 Detective Comics #618-621
And back again is our top 5 list, where we each rank our favorite current Bat-family series.

Send us your feedback to thetaylornetworkofpodcasts@gmail.com and we'll read it on the show.
Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.
Episodes are available on iTunes, hipcast or direct download at the Taylor Network of Podcasts website. We are also available on Stitcher under the Taylor Network feed.

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 23 The shorts episode!
item.description:
The shorts episode! No, we're not talking summer fashions,we're talking short films!
Darrell and Chris discuss the 2016 Academy Award Nominated Animated and Live Action Shorts (it was originally supposed to be just the animated shorts, but SOMEONE doesn't read his e-mail correctly and watched the wrong damn thing . . . )!
The Animated shorts included Pixar's Sanjay's Super Team, the Russian buddy-astronaut short We Can't Live Without Cosmos, the Chiliean film Bear Story, World of Tomorrow by Don Hertzfeldt, and Prologue which includes . . . well, I don't want to spoil it. Live action shorts were the comedy Ave Maria, the war story Day One, the family drama Everything Will Be Okay, war through the eyes of a child in Shok, and the romance Stutterer.
Did you see any? Did our picks win? Listen and find out!
Which were our favorites
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast E-mail your thoughts, your bittersweet vignettes, or suggestions of things you'd like us to talk about to:
artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com

item.title: JK’s Happy Hour : Nik Virella
item.description:
00:00:01 JK’s HAPPY HOUR THEME SONG Artist: NOFX Album: They’ve Actually Gotten Worse Live! 2007 Fat Wreck Chords
00:00:28 INTRODUCTION – Darell and J.K. talk "Bat Trump", Darrell's first trip to SDCC,strange pantless customs at Heroes Con, our "New York Jewish mothers", c2e2 and the sleepless EOC party, & a self serving Behemoth spiel! Fortunately they soon head to the bar before it gets too ridiculous.
00:21:38 "AT THE BAR" WITH NIK VIRELLA – Nik’s origin story – Night of the Living Deadpool – 1872 – G.I.JOE – Hyperion – We go on a brief Gargoyles tangent(WE all love that animated series) – the working artist's schedule – Nik's experiences in art school – technique – con experiences – temporal confusion drinking game!
01:00:36 OUTRO MUSIC Artist: John Lennon Album: Sometime in New York City 1972 Apple Records
RELATED LINKS NIK VIRELLA: http://www.nikvirella.com/ https://www.facebook.com/nik.virella https://twitter.com/niK_IT http://marvel.com/news/comics/24605/the_origin_of_nik_virella

TAYLOR NETWORK: http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/ https://www.facebook.com/groups/taylornetworkofpodcasts/
https://twitter.com/taylornetwork

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 35: Best of 2015 featuring Longboxes on 22s (
item.description:
On side B of the Best of 2015 episode of ignorant Bliss, my collaborator Sean Causley and I aka Longboxes on 22s talk about our favorite television shows and some thoughts on the events in 2015 and sports in Washington DC. We also talk about our convention plans for this year aka the Longboxes on 22s Convention Tour. Also in the episode you’ll hear from Shawn Pryor of his Top 10 of 2015 and Jared K. Fletcher of his Best of 2015. Enjoy!
Music in this episode: Frank Ocean - You Are Luh Puff Daddy - Auction (feat. Lil’ Kim, King Los & Styles P) Drake & Future - Big Rings Justin Beiber - Trust Goldlink - Spectrum Drake - 6PM in New York Phony Ppl - End of The Night (Louis Fulton Remix) Kendrick Lamar - Untitled 1
Here is the link for our spotify Best of 2015 playlist - https://open.spotify.com/user/julianlytle/playlist/60urkvPMdwFLnDGZWIuy6m

item.title: Gotham by Geeks Tom King returns
item.description:
In light of the DC announcements on the creative teams coming out of the Rebirth event we decided to record a special episode. in the first part we have comic creator Tom King returning to talk about his upcoming run as the new writer on Batman as well as his thoughts on the other Batman Family of books. In the second part we discuss the teams more thoroughly.
Send us your feedback to thetaylornetworkofpodcasts@gmail.com and we’ll read it on the show.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 144- Con Prep
item.description:
The summer convention season is upon us! If this is your first con or 100th, if you like to meet celebs, buy Star Wars toys or exhibit at artists alley hopefully this episode will be informative and helpful. Artist Tom Kelly, publisher/writer Jon Westhoff and collector Chris Revekant provide insight on proper etiquette dealing with artists, buying original pages, getting commissions, what a jam piece is, setting up your space to sell effectively and much much more! We also break down next week's C2E2 guest list, who we are looking forward to meeting and where to party.
You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts
Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or ITunes
review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.
You can hear us on Stitcher Radio from the taylornetwork feed

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 143 Mitch Gerads
item.description: Mitch Gerads has made a name for himself as the artist on such military themed comics as "The Activity", "The Punisher" and now DC/Vertigo's "Sheriff of Babylon"- a murder mystery set in the early days of the Iraq war. He discusses how, with writer Tom King, they crafted the look of a very specific time that wasn't heavily documented. Gerads puts emphasis on everything from body armor to tea cups in his own inimitable style. He and Wendi also discuss how they'd redesign cereal boxes, and whether or not he can draw sexy ladies.

item.title: Gotham by Geeks ep 2 The Laughing fish
item.description:
Welcome back to episode 2 of Gotham by Geeks, a Batman comics podcast! Join Darrell Taylor, Russ Latham, Mike Myers, and Chris Campbell as they dive in and discuss a selection of Bat-family comics, ranging from the Dark Knight's appearance in John Byrnes's Man of Steel series from the 1980's to the pitch perfect 1970's stories from Marshall Rogers and Steve Englehart in Detective Comics.
Covered this week are the following:
Batman #229 Detective Comics #569-570 Man of Steel #3 Detective Comics #475-476
And back again is our top 5 list, where we each rank our favorite Bat-family series (apart from Batman and Detective).
Send us your feedback to thetaylornetworkofpodcasts@gmail.com and we'll read it on the show.
Follow us on Twitter at @ByGotham or check out our Facebook page.
You can hear us on iTunes , hipcast or download
we are also available on stitcher radio under the TaylorNetwork feed.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 142- David Walker/Sanford Greene
item.description:
David Walker and Sanford Greene are the duo behind the hotly anticipated new "Power Man and Iron Fist". They join Wendi to discuss the new direction of the book, the legacy of their supporting characters, Vietnam vets, interracial bromance, black history month, Walker's upcoming Shaft novel and new comics, blaxploitation and the seriousness of 70s fashion, the Marvel hip hop covers controversy, Earth, Wind and Fire and so much more.
Available on the TaylorNetwork feed on , Stitcher Radio

item.title: Ignorant Bliss ep 35: Best of 2015 featuring Longboxes on 22
item.description:
On side B of the Best of 2015 episode of ignorant Bliss, my collaborator Sean Causley and I aka Longboxes on 22s talk about our favorite television shows and some thoughts on the events in 2015 and sports in Washington DC. We also talk about our convention plans for this year aka the Longboxes on 22s Convention Tour. Also in the episode you’ll hear from Shawn Pryor of his Top 10 of 2015 and Jared K. Fletcher of his Best of 2015. Enjoy!
Music in this episode: Frank Ocean - You Are Luh Puff Daddy - Auction (feat. Lil’ Kim, King Los & Styles P) Drake & Future - Big Rings Justin Beiber - Trust Goldlink - Spectrum Drake - 6PM in New York Phony Ppl - End of The Night (Louis Fulton Remix) Kendrick Lamar - Untitled 1

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 140 Zander Cannon
item.description: One of the most talked about and deservedly praised new comics of 2015 was Zander Cannon's "Kaijumax", the story of Electrogor, an oversized monster sent to a prison island of monsters. We discuss Godzilla and Gamera, balancing cute art with prison rape, tropes of "women in prison" films, his career doing layouts for books like Alan Moore's "Top Ten", and the religious preferences of mecha kaiju!

item.media:title: Double Page Spread ep 140 Zander Cannon
item.media:text: One of the most talked about and deservedly praised new comics of 2015 was Zander Cannon's "Kaijumax", the story of Electrogor, an oversized monster sent to a prison island of monsters. We discuss Godzilla and Gamera, balancing cute art with prison rape, tropes of "women in prison" films, his career doing layouts for books like Alan Moore's "Top Ten", and the religious preferences of mecha kaiju!

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 21 Brooklyn
item.description:
BROOKLYN is not a movie about overpriced artisanal pickles or self-satisfied smirks curling underneath twee facial hair configurations. Instead, it’s a study of self-determination as shown through the story of a young woman coming to America from Ireland in the 1950s. (spoiler alert: it’s a wonderful film!)
It stars Saoirse Ronan (The Christmas Miracle of Jonathan Toomey, Muppets Most Wanted) and Domhnall Gleeson (Anything in 2014 or 2015 . . . Name it, he’s in it . . . ) and has a screenplay by Nick Hornby (High Fidelity – the novel, not the screenplay, though the screenplay was based on his novel).
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast
E-mail your thoughts, your grandmother’s anecdotes about delousings at Ellis Island, or suggestions of things you’d like us to talk about to:
artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com
http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com
You can hear this episode and other podcasts on the network on the TaylorNetwork stitcher radio.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 141 Bizarre Love Triangles
item.description: In the annual Valentine's Day episode Wendi is joined by returning dear friends, Dan Pua and Andrew Shaw of Earth 2 Network's "Boob Toob" podcast! They talk about the return of the X-Files, famous comic book love triangles from Superman, Walking Dead, Fantastic Four, Archie and so many more, plus Dan giggling over sex toys and much discussion of cake!

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 20 The Danish Girl
item.description:
Aaaaand we’re back . . . This week, the crew discusses THE DANISH GIRL, Tom Hooper’s period drama exploring love, marriage, and self, as well as – oh yeah – gender reassignment surgery in the early 20th century. The movie is based on a novel which is kinda sorta inspired by the true story of Lili Elbe and Gerda Wegener.
Oscar winner Tom Hooper (EastEnders: The Mitchells – Naked Truths) directs Oscar winner Eddie Redmayne (Animal Ark, Doctors) in hopes of being Oscar winners again!
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast
E-mail your thoughts, landscape paintings, or suggestions of things you’d like us to talk about to:
artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com
http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com
You can hear this episode and other podcasts on the network on the TaylorNetwork stitcher radio https://www.stitcher.com/

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 34: A chat with Warren Bernard
item.description:
So I had the pleasure of meeting and talking to Warren Bernard, executive director of Small Press Expo and author of the book Cartoons for Victory. I met him at this past year’s SPX and was kind enough to invite me over to his house to see his extensive collections of comics, cartoons, and books library then to talk to me for this here show. This might be the closest to an interview I’ve done so I hope you enjoy it. Check out the blog post to see some a pic of stuff from the visit and please check out SPX if you haven’t and a link to the book. P.S. here are some pictures of the Hambone’s Meditations that was talked about in the episode. Please note this is hella racist but it is history.
Also I’ve restarted my Teespring campaign with Ignorant Bliss apparel to help me but some new recording equipment. You can get it here, and also I’ve opened up an email for the show you can email the show at ignorantblisspodcast [at] gmail [dot] com.
Here’s links about Warren’s book and to purchase it:
http://www.fantagraphics.com/cartoonsforvictory/
http://www.amazon.com/Cartoons-Victory-Warren-Bernard/dp/1606998226
Follow Small Press Expo:
http://www.spxpo.com/
http://spx.tumblr.com/
https://www.facebook.com/SmallPressExpo
https://www.instagram.com/spxcomics/
https://www.youtube.com/user/smallpressexpo
https://twitter.com/spxcomics
Music in this episode:
Frank Ocean – You Are Luh
Sergio Mendes – Samba Da Bencao
Nat King Cole – Day in, Day Out (Cut Chemist remix)
All the music copyright their respective owners
Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, IG, Snapchat, Tumblr, Soundcloud & Vine

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 139 Daniel White
item.description: Daniel White is a comic artist based in Brooklyn, where he puts out his own work and eats Italian pastries. This episode is a very loose, fun dialogue between two friends discussing the hot topics of the industry, building the momentum of Patreon to help young artists, copyright issues and flexibility of fan art, as evidenced in his new work "Fan Fiction", bringing the love back into comics, and plenty of talk about the new Star Wars film! Find Daniel and his art on Instagram @birdsinboxes.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 138 Ramon Perez
item.description: Ramon Perez came on to the scene with a bang with the multi-Eisner winning Boom! studios graphic novel "Tale of Sand", based on the unreleased screenplay by Jim Henson. He discusses the unique challenges of living up to the Henson legacy, how much original input he got to have, the distinctive look and much more, as well as his work for Marvel including "Wolverine and the X-Men" and the taking over from the legendary Matt Fraction and David Aja run on "Hawkeye" to the new run with Jeff Lemire.

item.title: MagnumCast episode 21The sun rises on a new season
item.description:
Luke and Col. Kehaar begin 2016 with the beginning of their look at season three. And what better way to start a new year off right than with a review of Did You See the Sun Rise? parts 1 and 2, said by many people to not only be the best episodes of Magnum, PI, but some of the best TV ever. The guys agree. Do you? Listen along, then tell them what you think!
Luke Foster Cartoonist
The Center of Somewhere http://centerofsomewhere.com
Drawn Away: A Cartoonist Tours America http://drawnaway.centerofsomewhere.com
Moon Freight 3 http://moonfreight3.centerofsomewhere.com
The Gang From the Store: True Tales From the Comic Book Shop http://gangfromthestore.centerofsomewhere.com

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 137 Brenden Fletcher
item.description: It's been over a year since DC shook up the Bat universe with the very youth driven Batgirl and Gotham Academy titles. Co-writer Brenden Fletcher talks about Gotham Academy's recent change in tone as well as it's inclusion of "Batman: the Animated Series" characters and the upcoming "Gotham Academy Yearbook". We also chat life in Burnside for Barbara Gordon and her crew, including the recent wedding of transgender groundbreaker Alysia Yeoh and artist Babs Tarr's fashion and design choices. Recently Fletcher has been writing Dinah Lance's spin off, "Black Canary" and we talk about her place beside the recent comic girl bands like Jem and the Holograms and Spider-Gwen, and his own musical background.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 136- Behemoth and PI Jane
item.description:
In this episode, Wendi talks to two creative teams of popular webcomics- first half with artist JK Woodward (Star Trek, Doctor Who, Fallen Angel) and writer Chris Kipiniak about their book, Behemoth, now available in a 4 story arc from Monkeybrain Comics. Best described as "Island of Dr. Moreau meets the Dirty Dozen" it details the story of a girl's descent into monsterhood and joining an elite mercenary team of teens in varying degrees of transformation. All of it is available now digitally, only 99 cents each, through Comixology.
After that, it's time for the team behind the long running book, PI Jane- cowriters Lauren Burke (Womanthology) and Greg Sorkin and artist Tony Maldonado. They bring their comedic sensibilities to discussing the funny, irreverent, pop culture style of the girl detective, as well as the popular side story of "Cake Vs. Pie" and Tony's skill at drawing violent food. Soon to have new issues released through Caliber, you can find the story until now at Monkeys Plus Typewriters.

item.title: Rants and Raves ep 27 - It's Only Ok In The Movies
item.description:
This week, Rene & MIke talk The Hateful 8, The Revenant, Star Wars Hate, Netflix's Making Of A Murderer and a lot more!!! Check us out this week, and remember, acting like a racist jackass is only ok in the movies!!! Not in real life!!!! Hateful 8: http://thehatefuleight.com/
The Revenant: http://www.foxmovies.com/movies/the-revenant

item.title: Double Page Spread 135 Star Wars Roundtable
item.description: Right before "The Force Awakens" Wendi sits down with 3 very outspoken Star Wars fans- Darrell Taylor of the Taylor Network, Rene Alvarado, co-host of "Rants and Raves" podcast, and Terry Gant, owner of Third Coast Comics and co-host of "Stakes is High" podcast. Together they break down everything Star Wars from the new Battlefront video game to the Marvel comics, try to find redeeming things about the prequels, what makes Chewbacca so cool, will BB-8 be any good? favorite toys and Wendi's kinky Boba Fett/Princess Leia doll wedding.

item.title: JK's Happy Hour ep Sarah Gaydos, Mike Johnson, and Ryan Parr
item.description:
JK and Darrell briefly discuss Darth Trump, DC's "Prez",kids(pets), Darrell's crazy kid slaying, laser tag weekend, 2 day hangovers,euthanasia for old drunks,and before it get's too ridiculous we run off to the bar. At the bar we run into Sarah Gaydos, Mike Johnson, and Ryan Parrott where we talk all things Star Trek and a bit about Ryan's haircut(because you really need to see it!!)
00:00:00 JK's Happy Hour Theme Music: "I wanna be an Alcoholic" Artist: NOFX Album: They've Actually Gotten Worse Live! Released 2007
00:17:38 Interview with Sarah Gaydos, Mike Johnson, and Ryan Parrott - Star Trek/Green Lantern Spectrum Wars - 50th Anniversary of Star Trek - Star Trek issue 50, 51 & 52 ( The mirror universe arc) - "The Legacy of Spock" - Star Fleet Academy- IN STORES TODAY! - and much more of what's coming up in the ongoing. - Ryan's haircut
01:02:37 outtakes
01:06:47 outro music: "Theme from Star Trek" (originally scored under the title, "Where no man has gone before") Released 1966

item.title: MagnumCast episode 20 Luke and the Colonel rip on each other
item.description:
There must have been something in the water, because Luke and the Colonel spent even more time making fun of each other than usual. They also came up with a dynamite, award-winning idea for a Magnum, PI reboot/sequel that Hollywood should totally hire them to write. They also, in spite of themselves, managed to wrap up their look at season two with reviews of The Elmo Ziller Story and Three Minus Two. So enjoy your holidays with the guys' ridiculous ramblings and we'll see you all in 2016!​
Luke Foster Cartoonist
The Center of Somewhere http://centerofsomewhere.com
Drawn Away: A Cartoonist Tours America http://drawnaway.centerofsomewhere.com
Moon Freight 3 http://moonfreight3.centerofsomewhere.com
The Gang From the Store: True Tales From the Comic Book Shop http://gangfromthestore.centerofsomewhere.com

item.title: Comic Racks Snarkcast ep 18 White Lines and Purple Passion
item.description:
In this uncharacteristically emotional episode, Gerri and Darrell get all emo about chemo as they take on Marvel’s The Mighty Thor written by Jason Aaron with art by Russell Dauterman. The pathos is real as they discuss the Marvel Max classic, Alias from Brian Micheal Bendis and Michael Gaydos and then move on to more lighthearted, semi-autobiographical fun by tackling the outrageously meta Image mini run, Airboy from writer/artist team James Robinson and Greg Hinkle. Don’t miss the super-spoiler ending as they cover the Netflix series Jessica Jones starring Krysten Ritter as Jessica and the uber-rapey Purpleman, played by David Tennant!
Questions? Comments? Complaints? Suggested reading? Email us at rookieandthegeek@gmail.com
Follow the Taylor Network of Podcasts for news, articles and a variety of podcasts at http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.me/
Check us out on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/TheRookieAndTheGeek
Or, just catch us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Rookie_Geek

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 19 IN THE SOUNDLESS AWE
item.description:
On a very special arts and crap, we go to the "thee-uh-tuh" (must be said in British accent)! Chris Kipiniak (Love Life, writer of BEHEMOTH from Monkeybrain comics, co-host of Arts and Crap) is performing in the play IN THE SOUNDLESS AWE, by Jayme McGhan, Andy Pederson directed by Sarah Norris about the worst Naval Disaster in U.S. History, the sinking of the U.S.S Indianapolis. Darrell came and saw. Did he love it? Or was he content to heckle and throw pretzels at the stage? Before that we talk about some of the tv/films we have been watching like the Netflix show Master of None by Aziz Ansari and Beast of No Nation from director Cary Joji Fukunaga
The show is produced by the New Light Theater Project (http://www.newlighttheaterproject.com/ ) at the Access Theater in New York, throughDecember 12.
We discuss the play's themes, the difficulty of adaptation, and why oh why you haven't heard from us in a while.
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast
E-mail your thoughts, fish stories, or suggestions of things you'd like us to talk about to:
artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 134: Tom King
item.description: Tom King is on a hot streak right now writing popular books for Marvel and DC, as well as his own creator owned property for Vertigo. He discusses the hit, "Grayson", which he cowrites with Tim Seeley, and the versatility of the Dick Grayson/Nightwing character throughout Batman and beyond, as well as what it's like to write beefcake for a character best defined by a shapely behind! He talks about the resurrection of "Omega Men" from cancellation, his layout and panel technique, "Vision" and the American suburban dream, and the underlying politics of all his titles. King's experience serving in the CIA also informs his new book "Sheriff of Babylon", set in the early days post 9/11 days of the war on terror.

item.title: Sunday Comics podcast ep 29 Tom Fowler explains it all
item.description:
Sunday comics podcast has returned and to start us off is comic creator Tom Fowler who has just started his own Kickstarter titled D&D&D: The Tabletop Fantasy Art of Tom Fowler . We have a fun discussion on how the idea for the project came about. Also how comic art has changed over the years along with some the greats who's art styles have stood the test of time. To check out the kickstarter go to
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/cadenceselect/danddandd-the-tabletop-fantasy-art-of-tom-fowler

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 133- Mark Schultz
item.description: Writer/artist Mark Schultz is a renowned illustrator with a mastery of drawing dinosaurs, cars and sexy women. In this episode he goes deep inside the artistic process with Wendi as they discuss his legendary book, "Zenozoic Tales" being made into an IDW Artists Edition and the cartoon, "Cadillacs and Dinosaurs". He discusses his recent intricate carbon pencil work in the illustrated story, "Storms at Sea" as well as his interest in environmentalism, his work writing "Superman" and "Prince Valiant", the evolutionary anatomy of drawing Aliens and Predators, and much more!

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 132: Brett Weldele
item.description: Brett Weldele is a painter and comic artist best known for books like "The Surrogates", which became a film with Bruce Willis, and the tie in comics for "Southland Tales". Currently he is working on a Vampirella story and talks about his unique break in the craft industry, designing a custom line of steampunk and zombie stamps and scrapbook accessories.

item.title: Nothings On ep 198 Clay found the Hand of God
item.description:
On this episode we a very special guest Jeff King who is the executive producer of the Amazon prime original series "Hand of God" which stars Ron Perlman, Dana Delany, Andre Royo, Garret Dilahunt and many more. Jeff shares what the an executive producer does and he other work on shows such as Stargate SG1, Continuum and White Collar. We also dig into his move from not just tv but also comics where he was the writer on the latest DC comics even Convergence along with his current book Tellos. Don't forget to email us so we can read it on the 200th episode extravaganza.

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 131: Lovecraft Halloween
item.description: On this very spooky episode of DPS, Wendi is joined by Kat Rocha and Josh Finney of 01 Publishing. In addition to their comics they've also released two volumes of short fiction related to H.P. Lovecraft, so who better to bring in on an episode devoted to the elder gods? They explore every aspect of Lovecraft's influence on movies, comics and games, from Stuart Gordon to Sam Raimi to Dungeons and Dragons. Does the Cthulhu mythos still have the bite it once did? How was Lovecraft connected to the other writers of his day, like Robert E. Howard?

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 130: Bill Zanowitz
item.description: Bill Zanowitz, co-host of the Comic Book Bears and T.H.U.N.D.E.R.C.A.S.T. podcasts returns to discuss his latest venture, writing the new comic, "Crimefighter Inquiry" with artist Mark Parmon. He and Wendi have a great deal of music discussion including debating a potential Husker Du reunion, the history of New Jersey bands and which Fall Out Boy songs are tolerable.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 129 Dirk Manning
item.description: Acclaimed horror comic writer Dirk Manning (Nightmare World, Tales of Mr. Rhee) joins Wendi for a very insightful and knowledgable discourse on promoting your work and getting noticed in the current comic climate. They discuss the recent convention controversies of artists charging for autographs, how to build a supportive fanbase, making money selling original comics and not a wall of prints... and karaoke!

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Steve Orlando
item.description:
In this episode we have special guest joining us at the pub comic creator Steve Orlando. We jump into the fan favorite DC book starring everyone's favorite trench coat wearing vigilante The MIDNIGHTER. Steve shares what goes into writing a well rounded comic character that is set in the fantastic world of superheroes. Plus a little info on his upcoming issue in BATMAN and ROBIN eternal #5. Then we dig into his creator owned Image comic VIRGIL which has a nice blending of the revenge exploitation films. VIRGIL is a heavy-hitting and heartbreaking tale of one man's battle against an oppressive and violent community. Steve expresses how he writes the lead character who is gay as a real character and not a stereotype. Follow Steve Orlando on twitter @thesteveorlando http://thesteveorlando.blogspot.com/
Follow us on twitter @JKsHappyHour
Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Leave us email by putting the show you are commenting on in the heading thetaylornetworkofpodcasts@gmail.com Follow the show on twitter: @JKsHappyHour And also the show Facebook page To see more updates from JK go to http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/ http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Don’t forget to pick up JK’s latest project Behemoth available on Comixology and Monkeybraincomics

item.title: Valiant Podcast ep 47 NYCC 2015 SHENANIGANS
item.description:
We are joined by Martin and Paul of the Valiant Central to catch up on all the announcements that came out of New York Comic Con 2015. We talk about Wrath of the Eternal Warrior, Book of Death, Bloodshot Island,Shadowman and more then dive into some of the things that Valiant is doing right (and wrong) with their merchandising initiatives.
We can be found on Twitter at @valiantpodcast, at http://www.taylornetworkofpodcasts.comand our Facebook page. Thanks for listening!​

item.title: MagnumCast Episode 18: At Least the Colonel is Good at His J
item.description:
Sometimes Luke is good at podcasting. Luke is not good at fixing lawn mowers. Today he tried to fix a lawn mower. It didn't work. He also tried coordinating with the person who DOES know how to fix the mower while simultaneously podcasting, so apologies if he sounds a little distracted. But he and the Colonel still manage to review season two episodes "One More Summer" and "Texas Lightning," and they both liked them, so that's something.
Luke Foster Cartoonist
The Center of Somewhere http://centerofsomewhere.com
Drawn Away: A Cartoonist Tours America http://drawnaway.centerofsomewhere.com
Moon Freight 3 http://moonfreight3.centerofsomewhere.com
The Gang From the Store: True Tales From the Comic Book Shop http://gangfromthestore.centerofsomewhere.com

item.title: IGNORANT BLISS EP 33 D-PI 4
item.description: So here we have the 4th conversation with my friend Ron Wimberly. We talk about Ta-Nehisi Coates’ new book Between The World and Me. We also talk about how the people co-opt slang using the phrase “Basic Bitch”. We then talk about the dissemination of art and music in American society along with the comics industry. We focus on “blerd” and geek culture and if we feel we fit into it all along with just life and making work. I hope you enjoy. Follow Ron: https://twitter.com/raynardfaux https://instagram.com/ronaldwimberly/ http://d3-14.tumblr.com/ http://d-pi.tumblr.com/ http://gratnin.tumblr.com/ http://princeofcats1.tumblr.com/ https://www.facebook.com/Ronald-Wimberly-409034515833175/timeline/ Music theme this episode – GoGo Music Frank Ocean – You Are Luh The Junkyard Band – The Word The Junkyard Band – Loose Booty The Junkyard Band – Sardines Rare Essence – Overnight Scenario The Junkyard Band – Ruff It Off DJ Flexx – The Water Dance Chuck Brown and the Soul Searchers – Woody Woodpecker All the music copyright their respective owners Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, IG, Snapchat, Tumblr, Soundcloud & Vine Subscribe on iTunes also please leave a review if you can! Also on Stitcher Also on Soundcloud Also on the Taylor Network of Podcasts

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Ron Garney
item.description:
Joining us at the pub is comic veteran Ron Garney who has worked on everything from Spider-man, Captain America, Wolverine, Justice League, Hulk and most recently the creator owned dark thriller "Men of Wrath" with critically acclaimed writer Jason Aaron and the upcoming Daredevil ongoing with writer Charles Soule coming out of the All New All Different Marvel line this fall.
Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Leave us email by putting the show you are commenting on in the heading thetaylornetworkofpodcasts@gmail.com Follow the show on twitter: @JKsHappyHour And also the show Facebook page To see more updates from JK go to http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/ http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Don't forget to pick up JK’s latest project Behemoth available on Comixology and Monkeybraincomics
follow Ron Garney on twitter

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 127- Secret Wars Roundtable
item.description: Its a Taylor Network all star roundtable as Wendi is joined by fellow podcasters Darrell Taylor, Rene Alvarado (Rants and Raves), Rafael Sanz (No Apologies), and Gerri Atkinson (Comic Rack Snarkcast). They tackle the biggest crossover of the summer, Marvel's "Secret Wars"- the main book and most of the adjacent tie ins. So find out if you really needed to read every title, or even the main one, how weird is Weirdworld? what were the best bromances? are the Thors fascist cops? Does A-Force need some testosterone? All these questions answered and more!

item.title: COMIC RACKS SNARKCAST ep 15 Its Tricky
item.description:
In this episode we discuss the Gotham season two premiere before digging into "We Are Robin" by Lee Bermejo, Rob Haynes and Khary Randolph then we jump head first into the hard hitting action packed revenge story "Virgil" by Steve Orlando and JD Faith. Saving the spoiler filled talk of the comic version of Walking Dead vol 23 by Robert Kirkman and CHARLIE ADLARD, STEFANO GAUDIANO, & CLIFF RATHBURN email us your feedback to Comicracksnarkcast@gmail.com
follow us on twitter @Rookie_Geek

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 18 The Guest
item.description:
Knock-knock! Who's there? Why, it's The Guest! Come on in! Adam Wingard (You're Next)'s 2014 film is a . . . well, to start attributing genres might give stuff away. But there's definitely violence. And a lot of synth music.
It stars former British heartthrob (meaning pudgy) turned Hollywood heartthrob (meaning distractingly jacked) Dan Stevens (Downton Abbey, Masterpiece Classic) and Lance Reddick (The Wire, What the Deaf Man Heard).
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast
E-mail your thoughts, criticisms of the military-industrial-complex, or suggestions of things you'd like us to talk about to:
artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com
http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com

item.title: Double Page Spread ep Matt Sturges/Dave Justus
item.description: The hilarious writing duo of Matt Sturges and Dave Justus share in some outrageous conversation on this episode- bragging about skin diseases, comparing best birthdays, playing Duran Duran bass lines and so much more. Together they co-write the spin off comic "Fables: The Wolf Among Us", based on the popular video game and give a karaoke recap of the Fables Wake, the final party sending off Bill Willingham's long running DC title. OnSept. 23 they release the fantasy comedy "Public Relations", the first new book from the relaunched First Comics imprint. The duo even wrote their own theme song for this episode!

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 32: A fresh conversation with Ramon Villalobo
item.description: This episode is with rising star Ramon Villalobos currently artist on the Marvel Secret Wars title E for Extinction. This episode was recorded in July a little before San Diego Comic Con. In this we talk about Yeezys, growing up as an Mexican American, representation in comics and media, pop culture influences, attitudes in doing comic art, Grant Morrison’s Batman and New Gods and of course rap music. Follow Ramon: https://twitter.com/RamonVillalobos http://ramonvillalobos.tumblr.com/ https://instagram.com/theramonvillalobos/ buy art from Ramon: https://society6.com/ramonvillalobos http://www.redbubble.com/people/ramonvillalobos/shop Music theme this episode – Kanye West: Late – Kanye West – Late Registration Jukebox Joints (2nd half) – A$AP Rocky featuring Kanye West from At.Long.Last.A$AP Christian Dior Denim Flow – Kanye West featuring Kid Cudi, Pusha T, John Legend, Lloyd Banks, & Ryan Leslie – GO.O.D. Fridays All Day – Kanye West featuring Theophilus London, Allan Kingdom & Sir Paul McCartney – SWISH All Your Fault – Big Sean Featuring Kanye West – Dark Sky Paradise Don’t Stop – C.R.S. (Child Rebel Solider: Kanye West, Pharrell, Lupe Fiasco) – G.O.O.D. Fridays Wolves – Kanye West featuring Sia and Vic Mensa Can’t Tell Me Nothing – Kanye West – Graduation All the music copyright their respective owners Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, Tumblr, Soundcloud & Vine Subscribe on iTunes also please leave a review if you can! Also on Stitcher Also on Soundcloud Also on the Taylor Network of Podcasts

item.title: Comic Racks Snarkcast ep 14 Drew Geraci
item.description:
In the first part we are joined by creator Drew Geraci to talk about his new novel THE DEMANDS about a fictional Pittsburgh rock band who builds a following one bar at a time, some of which are owned by the Russian mob.We also talk about the transition of being an inker and moving to writing.
In the second part we review the Secret Wars tie in Thors by Jason Aaron and Chris Sprouse
email us your feedback to Comicracksnarkcast@gmail.com follow us on twitter @Rookie_Geek http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 17 Inside Llewyn Davis
item.description:
This week, we go inside, Inside Llewyn Davis, the Coen Brothers' take on music, art, life, and the merchant marine. This is the movie that made a star of Oscar Isaac, playing a difficult, flinty, self-important Artiste who has more dignity than sense. Any similarity between the main character and one of this podcast's hosts is not so much coincidental as LIBELOUS!
Starring the afore-mentioned Isaac (Julliard grad, class of 2005, Drive), and Carey Mulligan (Doctor Who, Drive).
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast
E-mail your thoughts, song lyrics, or suggestions of things you'd like us to talk about to:

item.title: Double Page Spread: Episode 125- Chris Eliopoulos
item.description: Chris Eliopoulos is a man who has worn every conceivable hat in the comic industry- prolific letterer, writer and cartoonist. We discuss different aspects of lettering, funny animal books, the real deal with Free Comic Book Day, RunDisney and nerd physical fitness, inspirational children's books with Brad Meltzer, CowBoy, his book with Nate Cosby, his mentor Gene Colan and much more!

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 31: Why comics might need a Dame Dash with Ja
item.description: On this episode I talk to my friend Jared K. Fletcher. He’s a letterer in the comics’ industry getting his start on staff at DC Comics years ago. He’s worked on many comics and a lot of modern classics like DC: The New Frontier, Batman Year 100 and new stuff like Southern Bastards at Image. He’s also an accomplished designer designing a lot of the modern logos for Marvel Comics hot titles. We talk about a lot of our thoughts on the business of comics and the mind state of the people within it. We then trail off on talks about Akira Toriyama and Legos. Follow Jared: http://www.jaredkfletcher.com/ https://twitter.com/jaredkfletcher Music in this episode: Frank Ocean – You Are Luh You Don’t Know remix instrumental Czarface 2 – When the Gods Go Mad, Deadly Class, Ka-Bang, & Nightcrawler Action Bronson – Strictly 4 My Jeeps, Bird on a Wire, & Baby Blue All the music copyright their respective owners Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, IG, Snapchat, Tumblr, & Vine jared k fletcher x studio fantabulous jaredkfletcher.com

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 124- Mairghread Scott
item.description:
Accomplished writer of animation and comics, Mairghread Scott comes on the show to discuss her latest project from Archaia, "Toil and Trouble" with artists Kelly and Nicole Matthews. "Toil and Trouble" is a Shakespearian labor of love, depicting the story of Macbeth from the perspective of the three witches. The book is fully comprehensible if you've never read the play and provides a richer interpretation if you're already a fan.
She also answers many question about her wealth of work in the Transformers universe, including writing Windblade and the recent crossover event "Combiner Wars". Animation secrets are divulged including exactly how long a character is allowed to scream for and exactly what is a "Keep alive groan"?

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 123 - Mike Fury
item.description: Mike Fury is a multitalented dynamo- writer, martial artist and drummer who recently released his first book. "Life of Action: Interviews with the Men and Women of Martial Arts and Action Cinema". We discuss the work and admiration he has for over 30 actors, directors and stunt people he covers in this book including Isaac Florentine, Scott Adkins, Mark Strange, and Darren Shalhavi. We get into the differences between Hong Kong and Western traditions, the rise of recent action films like "The Raid" and "John Wick" and Netflix's "Daredevil", the value of acting vs. fighting, Youtube fan films like "Street Fighter", where to learn more about the current indie action scene and much more! You can order his book through Amazon or www.mikefury.net

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Mike Johnson/Scott Tipton
item.description:
JK' Happy Hour returns with a jam packed episode with not one but two guests. First we have writer Mike Johnson who is currently writing STAR TREK, STAR TREK/GREEN LANTERN, upcoming STARFLEET ACADEMY and original series EI8HT from Darkhorse
Then we are joined by past guest and friend of the show writer Scott Tipton who is currently working on the Nicholas Myers The Seven-Per-Cent solution. Scott and JK were recent guests at Star Trek Las Vegas 2015 and they shared some of their adventures

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 122 - Marvel and Hip Hop
item.description:
Recently Marvel comics announced a month of hip hop themed variant covers, recreating famous album covers with their titles. This brought into light an issue about the lack of African Americans hired by the company and diversity both on the page and behind the scenes. In this episode Wendi is joined by artist Julian Lytle (Ignorant Bliss podcast), Rafael Sanz (No Apologies podcast) and Darrell Taylor (Taylor network of Podcasts). For years Julian and Shawn Pryor worked on the "Longboxes on 22s" tumblr (www.longboxeson22s.tumblr.com ) that mashed up hip hop culture and comic books only to go ignored by Marvel and DC.
This discussion goes far beyond the ideas of cultural appropriation into a discourse of hiring practices, how to find new talent, what the role of an editor should be and being racially tactful. Also what rappers really do fit which superheroes!

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 29: A conversation with Girl Gone Geek
item.description:
This episode features a conversation with Jamila Rowser better known online as Girl Gone Geek. She’s a blogger, writer and panelist on comics and pop culture. She has the blog GirlGoneGeekblog.com and also one of the founders of Geek Girl brunch. Jamila and I talk about a lot of things this episode from race and current events to movies and josei manga.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 212 SDCC 2015
item.description: It's all the news that's fit to geek out over as Wendi is joined by fellow podcasters Dan Pua and Andrew Shaw (The Boob Toob) and Darrell Taylor (Taylor Network of Podcasts). They dissect all the movie trailers- Suicide Squad, Batman v. Superman, Deadpool, etc and break down all the new comic titles announced by Marvel, Vertigo, and Image. Many many listener questions are asked and much joy is had over the return of Rom: Space Knight!

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 120: Alejandro Rosado
item.description: Alex Rosado exudes fun through every element of his personality. He's a soft spoken, upbeat and charming gent who conveys all of that in his art. His longrunning children's book, "Sofa Kingdom" captures the whimsy and goofiness of boyhood and he has a new creator owned title called "The Element Factor" as well as his work with Art Baltazar and Franco on " Aw Yeah Comics". This episode was taped after he and Wendi were locked out of her house for an hour with the oven on! Follow him on twitter and Instagram as @aleroart.

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 16 Dope
item.description:
On this week's show, these dopes discuss . . . Dope, Rick Famuyiwa's new comedy about a geek growing up in Inglewood, CA. He wants to be himself but everybody else - from his guidance counselor to a local drug dealer - seems to be conspiring to make him anything but. Is it a comedic Boyz In the Hood, or Risky Business with a little more ballast?
Starring Shameik Moore (An Elf's Story: The Elf on the Shelf), Kiersey Clemons (Prom?!, Good Luck Charlie), and Zoë Kravitz (X-Men: First Class, Mad Max: Fury Road). Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast E-mail your thoughts, college essays, or suggestions of things you'd like us to talk about to: artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 28 A Talk across the pond with Taylor Pithers
item.description:
This episode is a conversation with my friend Taylor Pithers from England. Taylor has been on episodes with me on Shawn Pryor’s show The Black Box. This episode is just an overall (and long) conversation about pop culture. We cover the basis of movies, sports, tv, shoes and music. We talk a lot about current rap happenings and a nice overview of Grime music from the UK and it’s origins and our thoughts on how it connects to Hip Hop in the states.
Follow Taylor on twitter @taylorpithers
All the music in this episode is Grime:
Skepta feat. Idris Elba – SHUTDOWN (remix)
Sir Spyro – Bruce Wayne
JME – 96 Fuckries
Wiley – Morgue
Flowdan – Ambush
Pulse X
Danny Weed – Creeper
Frisco – 123
DJ Slimzee – All in 1 Riddim
Dizze Rascal – Fix Up, Look Sharp
TEMPZ – Next Hype
Skepta feat. Jammer – I Spy (Spaceship Riddim)
D Double E – Street Fighter Riddim
Skepta – That’s Not Me (US Remix)
Fekky feat. Tempa T, Skepta, Jammer, D double E, JME, Frisco, Kano – Still Sittin’ Here
Music copyright their respective owners.
Get at me @julianlytle on Twitter, IG, Snapchat, & Vine

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 119- Zack Kruse
item.description: Zack Kruse has been organizing the well regarded Appleseed convention in Fort Wayne, IN, as well as putting out his own stories and doing academic work in comic history for some time. He has a chat with Wendi about nurturing young creators at conventions, fairy hoaxes, if Dana Scully was a pragmatist or a dogmatist, and a lengthy discussion of his research on the reclusive Steve Ditko- who really created Spider-Man, similiarities between Peter Parker and Blue Beetle, his use of objectivism and the introspective nature of his work. It's an interesting discourse for anyone fascinated by the backstory of Marvel Comics and Stan Lee.

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 15 Housebound
item.description:
ARTS AND CRAP FIELD TRIP! Darrell and Chris are joined by Sheila Valleri for beer, schnitzel and a discussion of Housebound, Gerard Johnstone's horror-comedy which comes to us from Australia's little brother, New Zealand! We alternate between comments like that and salient points about cinema. The film stars Morgana O'Reilly (The Jaquie Brown Diaries, Rebecca 2 [but not Rebecca 1, if there is such a thing]), Rima Te Wiata (Kevin Rampenbacker and the Electric Kettle, Hinekaro Goes on a Picnic and Blows Up another Obelisk [both of which are real titles!!]) and a bunch of other talented Kiwis.
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast E-mail your thoughts, anecdotes about graduating high school with Sam Neill, or suggestions of things you'd like us to talk about to: artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com

item.title: Wades World ep 7 Its our Anniversary
item.description: This one we talk about The 17th Anniversary of Jetta: Tales of the Toshigawa and celebrate our time together as a creative unit. We talk about how 17 year hike through the back roads of comicbookdom with our special guest, Jetta model, Sara Fretas and announce the re-release of our first book to hit the market, Jetta: Tales of the Toshigawa - Defiance! Join us as we take a trip down memory lane (as well as all the detours that went with it).

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 118 C2E2
item.description:
The majority of this episode was taped at the C2E2 after event, ICE, the Indie Comics Expo, held by King Bone Press in Chicago back in May. The first live panel is a discussion of independent publishing featuring Jon Westhoff and Bobgar Ornelas of King Bone Press and the Earth 2 podcast network, as well as James and Jason Ford, of the Wombmates podcast and "The Servant" comic. They discuss the challenges of getting your comic noticed and going digital vs. print.
The second panel is with writer Ed Brisson. He has recently reissued his breakthrough title "Murder Book" as well as an excellent sc-fi prison tale "Cluster" and his unconventional superhero story "The Mantle" from Image.
In part 3 Wendi catches up with writer James Robinson, creator of "Starman" and recent writer of Fantastic Four. They discuss the legacy of Jack Knight, the chemistry of sobriety, Battleworlds and his semi-autobiographical new series from Image, "Airboy".

In part 3 Wendi catches up with writer James Robinson, creator of "Starman" and recent writer of Fantastic Four. They discuss the legacy of Jack Knight, the chemistry of sobriety, Battleworlds and his semi-autobiographical new series from Image, "Airboy".

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: David Walker
item.description:
In this episode we are joined by writer David Walker who recently did a 6 issue arc on based on the book and popular movie character Shaft published by Dynamite Entertainment. available in print and digitally. David explains how the story came about and the differences between the book version and the movie version of the character. We also delve into how he got into comics along with his transition from indie to mainstream comics with the upcoming DCyou ongoing Cyborg. In addition to being a comic writer he is also a book author. His all ages action adventure in the Super justice Force series : The Adventures of Darius Logan Book One which is available on amazon about an ordinary kid living in an extraordinary world of superheroes, and finding the strength within himself to be a better person than he ever imagined possible.To see all of his current projects go to his website http://thedavidwalkersite.com/ and follow him on twitter @DavidWalker1201
Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Leave us email by putting the show you are commenting on in the heading thetaylornetworkofpodcasts@gmail.com Follow the show on twitter: @JKsHappyHour And also the show Facebook page To see more updates from JK go to http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/ http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Dont forget to pick up JK’s latest project Behemoth available on Comixology and Monkeybraincomics

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 117: Jaime Hernandez
item.description: Live from Appleseed Con in Ft. Wayne, IN its a very special panel with indie comic legend, Jaime Hernandez! He discusses 30 years of creating "Love and Rockets" with his brothers, his artistic style of drawing naturalistically and letting the characters age with the audience, 80s SoCal punk rock and the evolving nature of independent comics. Thank you so much to Zack Kruse for this opportunity.
