item.title: MagnumCast episode 14: Don't call it a comeback
item.description:
The boys are back after a one-month hiatus (the colonel had dishpan hands or the vapors or something. Luke wasn't paying attention) to review the season two episodes "Mad Buck Gibson" and "The Taking of Dick McWilliams." So listen in and hear what the guys had to say. Have thoughts of your own? Drop us a line and tell us!​

item.title: Valiant Podcast ep 40 Valiant Noise
item.description: Welcome to episode 40 of the Valiant Podcast. The whole team is back, with Darrell, Chris and Mike discussing everything and anything on this 2-hour show. We specifically look at Bloodshot Reborn #2 and Dead Drop #2, as well as answer some listener questions. We can be found on Twitter at @valiantpodcast, at www.taylornetworkofpodcasts.com and our Facebook page. Thanks for listening!

item.title: Sundays Comics podcast ep 27 Whatcha Reading?
item.description:
This week its a round table of what are you reading and Donny is joined by Jim Deitz, Luke Foster and Farrah Ware. we discuss our every first issues that got us into comic books,we also talked a little Secret Wars, Convergence and a few tie-ins from each event,squirrel girl,Ivan the time walker,Fresh Romance by Janelle Asselin, Space Riders #1 by Black Mask Studios, Mad Max Fury road Nux and Immortan Joe, Brian Wood's take on Moon Knight, more of Donny's Dark Horse Star Wars omnibus obsession, Jem & the Holograms #1+2 from IDW as well as the trailer and Curb Stomp #1 by the team of Ryan Ferrier, Devaki Neogi and Neil Lalonde.
Twitter: @sundaycomicspod http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/

item.title: Wades World ep 6 Family Time
item.description:
After some technical difficulties, we return with our 6th episode. This time, Anakin joins us as we talk about our favorite anime movies and shows and why we love them so much. We also sprinkle a little Arrow and Flash talk in here because Anakin said we had to. Also, I finally understand why we are drawn to certain anime rather than others. Be prepared for some weird Wade Family conversation.
Remember to find get in touch with us at wadesworld@gmail.com and check out our comic books and art at www.toshigawa.com

item.title: Double Page Spread - Dan Dougherty
item.description: Apologies, first of all, for some sound issues in this episode- a new headset mic was being used and it ran a bit hot and picked up too much breathing. Artist Dan Dougherty comes on to discuss his long running, award winning newspaper cartoon, Beardo - how syndication works, how comic strips are staying alive, and the legacy of cartooning. He is also 6 issues deep into a supernatural thriller comic called "Touching Evil", about a woman with a deadly gift she can't seem to shake. They discuss his varying art styles, working with actor Dan Fogler, the consistency of placenta and much more!

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 14 Ex Machina
item.description:
This week we discuss Ex Machina, the robot thriller (?) that allows novelist-screenwriter-producer-videogamewriter-brit-human to add "director" to his already exhausting list of hyphenates. The movie says something about humanity, I guess. Or maybe it says something about robots. Either way, it stars Alicia Vikander (Min balsamerade mor, Levande föda) as the robot, Domhnall Gleeson (Frank, and an episode of Black Mirror where HE was the robot), Oscar Isaac (the guy in the new Star Wars trailer who looks really excited to be flying an X-wing), and literally 7 other people. That's it.
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast
E-mail your thoughts, counterfeit feelings, or suggestions of things you'd like us to talk about to:
artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com
http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com
And leave us an itunes review! A nice one!!

http://www.nonplayercomic.com/ @NateSonOfSimp NONPLAYER #1, 3rd printing (Diamond Code = JAN158233) will be available on April 1. The final order cutoff deadline for retailers is Monday, March 9.

item.title: Sundays Comics podcast ep 26 Whats up with Archie?
item.description:
Donny Salvo is joined by cartoonist/podcaster Luke Foster and head of the network Darrell Taylor to discuss the recent issues with Archie comics from the now canceled Kickstarter to books being pushed back. They also discuss what makes Archie a fan favorite and the current run of books the guys are reading.

item.title: Double Page Spread Episoe 115: Joyce Chin
item.description: This week, Wendi talks to the delightful Joyce Chin. Joyce's history starts from pencilling "Guy Gardner: Warrior" for DC back in 1995, and currently she's an accomplished cover artist, doing many covers for Dynamite, including the Gail Simone penned crossover event, "Swords of Sorrow". They have a fun discussions about geek parenting, the recent Frank Cho controversy and sexy art, licensing and merchandising rights and a lot more. Featuring guest appearance from her husband, legendary X-book artist and "Monkeyman and O'Brien" creator, Arthur Adams!

item.title: Ignorant Bliss 26: Shawn Pryor
item.description: This episode is with my good friend Shawn Pryor. Shawn has been in the comics game for a bit starting out with his own imprint PKD media and then as one of the Founders of Action Lab Entertainment. Shawn also has a long running podcast called The Black Box podcast (one in which I've been a guest on plenty of times). After a brief sabatical from making comics he's returning with a new all ages comic Cash & Carrie from his new company Crowntaker Studios. He's funding the first comic with a Kickstarter that is currently in progress. In this episode we talk about all manner of things, observations of the the comics game, fandom, diversity in media, R&B and Hip Hop, execution of ideas and much more. http://www.crowntakerstudios.com/ https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/23808096/cash-and-carrie Music in this episode: Pusha T feat. 2Chainz & Big Sean - Who I Am Rick Ro$$ feat. Puffy & French Montana Jodeci - Forever My Lady (screwed and chopped - Chopstars) T.I. feat. Young Thug - About the Money Drake - Worst Behaviour Tyler, the Creator feat. Lil' Wanye - Smuckers Jadakiss feat. Styles p - We Gonna Make It Drake feat. Lil' Wayne - Used To Missy Elliot - Hot Boys remix Junior Mafia feat. Notorious B.I.G.- Get Money Wu-Tang clan - Method Man Junior Mafia feat.Notorious B.I.G.- Player's Anthem Jay Electronica & Jay Z - We Made It Follow me on Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat & More - @julianlytle Follow Shawn on Twitter - @shawnrpryor

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 114- Gene Ha and Onrie Kompan
item.description:
Gene Ha is one of the most thorough, detailed and good natured artists working in comics today. Known for his DC work such as "The Shade" and "Project: Superman" as well as Alan Moore's "Top Ten", it's time for him to step into his own creator owned fantasy. Which is exactly what he's doing with "Mae", a young adult, female driven story about friendship and sisterhood and strange creatures with Czech names. He and Wendi talk about this new project, how to run a successful kickstarter and the appeal of smart brunettes!
Check out the kickstarter for Mae right here- https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/geneha/mae-graphic-novel
Onrie Kompan is an international storyteller who has earned acclaim in Korea for his comic, Yi Soon Shin, detailing the daring exploits of a brave Korean Naval Commander. His gritty historical epic is perfect for those who like bloodshed and dark adventure. He and Wendi discuss the delicate balance of vulnerability in female characters and how to craft a successful sales pitch at conventions.
Check out the kickstarter for Yi Soon Shin right here-

item.title: Arts and Crap Episode 13: Under The Skin
item.description: This week we have 50% more crap! Sheila Valleri joins us again to discuss Under the Skin, Jonathan Glazer (Sexy Beast – that’s a movie, not an assessment)’s 2013 film about an alien who prowls the streets of a Scottish city (Edinburgh, maybe?) shot using hidden cameras, non-professional actors, and one of the world’s biggest movie stars. Not, however, using a lot of dialogue. The film stars Jeremy McWilliams (prize-winning motorcyclist, screen debut), Dougie McConnell (screen debut), Andrew Gorman (screen debut), and Scarlett Johansson (Ghost World). Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast E-mail your thoughts, impressionistic metaphors, or suggestions of things you’d like us to talk about to: artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 113- Kelly Thompson and Joe Caramagna
item.description:
This week Wendi is joined by Kelly Thompson. The podcaster and columnist has her first major comic writing gig with IDW's "Jem and the Holograms", with "Glory" artist Sophie Campbell. They discuss all things 80s hair and fashion, what 21st century Jem music would sound like, plus her upcoming book with Kelly Sue DeConnick, "Captain Marvel and the Carol Corps"!
Then it's time for a brief returning visit from Marvel letterer Joe Caramagna (Daredevil, Secret Wars). He fills us in on his long awaited book. "The Further Travels of Wyatt Earp", and gives a surprise announcement about his unconventional signing event.

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 12: Killer Of Sheep
item.description:
Charles Burnett (To Sleep with Anger, The Glass Shield)’s MFA thesis film went without a theatrical release for about 30 years due to difficulty in obtaining music licenses. But in 2007 the rights were secured and the world at large was introduced to his chronicle of urban life in the 70s, shot in a style reminiscent of the Italian neo-realists. Sure, The National Society of Film Critics says it’s one of the 100 Essential Films, but more important, what does the Arts and Crap crew think?
The film starts Henry G. Sanders (Whiplash [so you can program yourself an Arts and Crap/Henry G. Sanders playlist], The Rockford Files), and Kaycee Moore (Bless Their Little Hearts, Daughters of the Dust).
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast
E-mail your thoughts, bittersweet vignettes about struggling to forge intimacy in a world whose casual cruelties threaten to blunt the soul, or suggestions of things you’d like us to talk about to:
artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com
http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com

item.title: Wades World ep 5 The Return of Anakin
item.description:
Anakin joined us again this week as he talked about Skylanders, Plants Vs Zombies, Mario Kart and Super Smash Brothers. We then talk about Lexington Comic and Toy Con and the pros and cons of setting up at a con and the changing landscape of the convention world. That was the majority of the discussion.
http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 112 Furious 7
item.description: In this very special emergency episode, Wendi is joined by fellow comic podcasters Rafael Sanz of "No Apologies' and Julian Lytle of "Ignorant Bliss". This episode is entirely spoilers for Furious 7, so go out and see the movie first! They break down every aspect of what makes the Rock, Vin Diesel and the whole Toretto crew the Black Avengers. So go into some deep Fast and Furious analyzing as they break down what makes each movie great, how it relates to Dungeons and Dragons, and make up plots for the franchise to #10 and beyond, including a full Hobbs spinoff world!

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 11 Wetlands
item.description: Wetlands was described as, “the most wtf, nsfw movie at this year’s sundance film festival,” by whoever was quoted on the poster. This German coming-of-age story is based on Charlotte Roche’s debut novel and focuses on a girl who has divorced parents and unconventional views on hygiene. Was it a groundbreaking exploration of the limits of intimacy, or a loose retelling of The Parent Trap with anal fissures as a plot device? The film stars up-and-comer Carla Juri (Stationspiraten, Der Kriminalist), and Meret Becker (Die kleine Meerjungrau) in a role unlike anything you’ve seen her in before! We are joined by guest co-host Sheila Valleri as we probe all the nooks, crannies and orifices of this film which co-host Darrel Taylor said made him want to, “bleach my [his] eyes.” Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast E-mail your thoughts, boogers, or suggestions of things you’d like us to talk about to: artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 111- Kaare Andrews
item.description: Kaare Andrews has never limited himself to one dream. Whether he's drawing Spider-Man or directing Cabin Fever: Patient Zero, Andrews is challenging himself in the best medium to tell the most complete story. Which is what makes "Iron Fist: The Living Weapon" such a definitive piece in the character's legacy. He and Wendi have an extensive talk about the real origins of the kung fu character, why you have to fight a robot after a dragon, a shared love of Scott Adkins and modern action stars and control issues between genre filmmaking and comics.

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 10 The Affair pt 2
item.description: The exciting conclusion of our 2-part discussion of Showtime’s The Affair, a show which, like this podcast, is built around diverging perspectives on the same story. This week we discuss episodes 6-10, including the season finale. More subjectivity! More adultery! More Hamptons! It still stars all the same people, including Maura Tierney (NewsRadio, The Wooster Group’s 2010 revival of North Atlantic at the Baryshnikov Arts Center), and Joshua Jackson (Racing Stripes, The Skulls) as the wronged spouses, and Darren Goldstein (Limitless, the 2015 short film, Love Life). Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast E-mail your thoughts, moral teachings, or suggestions of things you’d like us to talk about to: artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 110 Todd Stashwick
item.description: Todd Stashwick may be the most versatile character actor on tv right now. With a list of shows such as 12 Monkeys, Supernatural, Gotham, The Originals, Justified, Curb Your Enthusiasm, Heroes, and The Riches, he brings his unique range of comedy and menace to every role. Todd and Wendi get nerd deep in some conversation analyzing gender swapped roles, translating movies to tv and what it means to be a genre fan. He shares all the info he's allowed to regarding the Star Wars video game he's writing, as well as his long running webcomic, "Devil Inside" with Dennis Calero. Plus?? he sings several songs and plays ukelele! Stashwick is a load of fun and an incredible joy to talk to.

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 9 Cake
item.description: This week, Darrell and Chris are joined by comic book auteur/mental health professional Alan White (http://thepowerprinciple.co/) to discuss Cake – Daniel Barnz’s dramedy (come-rama?) about grief, pain and fear. It is only tangentially related to baking. The movie stars Jennifer Anniston (Leprechaun, Horrible Bosses 2, every American woman’s hair-style in 1996-7), Adriana Barraza (Tres piezas de amor en un fin de semana, CSI: Miami) and Sam Worthington (Avatar, Australia [the country, not the movie]). Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast E-mail your thoughts, recipes, or suggestions of things you’d like us to talk about to: artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 109 Chip Zdarsky
item.description: Brimpin aint easy as the hilarious Chip Zdarsky drops on by to talk to Wendi. They discuss the overwhelming popularity of he and writer Matt Fraction's "Sex Criminals", how to organically build a fanbase (the Brimpers), writing a comic that balances sexiness and heart, and why Robert Z'Dar did not appear at Zdarscon. This month Chip's run writing "Howard the Duck" begins at Marvel, so go check that out!

item.title: Valiant Podcast Special 2
item.description:
In the wake of the huge news from Sunday regarding Valiant's new investment from DMG, we are proud to bring you the 2nd Valiant Podcast Special. Join Darrell, Mike, and Chris as they dive into the discussion and bring you analysis of what has been revealed thus far, and some interesting speculation on what may be in store from Valiant Entertainment and DMG. And don't forget to head over to the Valiant Podcast Facebook page to learn about our X-O Manowar Deluxe Hardcover contest being held on March 20th, 2015. Thanks for listening!​
twitter: @Valiantpodcast website: http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 8 The Affair
item.description: Showtime’s The Affair is a new drama about a . . . (wait for it . . .) affair, told each week from both his and her point of view. Think of it as Rashomon: the series. Many hailed the first episode as the best pilot of the new television season. Was it? It stars Ruth Wilson (2009’s The Prisoner remake, one of the many Jane Eyres), Dominic West (John Carter, Punisher: War Zone) and also has the guy who plays Carmine Falcone in Gotham. In the first of a special two-parter, we talk about the first 5 episodes as well as our own personal failings! Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast E-mail your thoughts, deepest secrets, or suggestions of things you’d like us to talk about to: artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/

item.title: JK's Happy Hour Rachael Stott
item.description:
Joining the boys at the pub this episode is talented artist Rachael Stott to talk about her work on the Star Trek/Planet of the Apes: The Prime Directive written by Scott and David Tipton. In between the arguments of which Enterprise Captain is better Rachel manages to get in a few words about how she got started in comics as well as her con schedule.
http://rachaelstott.tumblr.com/ twitter - https://twitter.com/rachaelatwork

item.title: Double Page Spread 108- Woodward and Tipton
item.description: Harlan Ellison's teleplay for his legendary Star Trek episode "City on the Edge of Forever" has been adapted for comics by writers Scott and David Tipton with artist JK Woodward. Scott and JK talk to Wendi about the differences between the original script and the episode, Ellison's politics, JK dressing like a bum, and so much more. Also the Tiptons are currently releasing their Star Trek/Planet of the Apes crossover comic, "The Primate Directive". You can't miss this epic tale of Captain Kirk meeting Charlton Heston's classic character, George Taylor, plus Klingons and apes!
item.itunes:summary: Harlan Ellison's teleplay for his legendary Star Trek episode "City on the Edge of Forever" has been adapted for comics by writers Scott and David Tipton with artist JK Woodward. Scott and JK talk to Wendi about the differences between the original script and the episode, Ellison's politics, JK dressing like a bum, and so much more. item.media:title: Double Page Spread 108- Woodward and Tipton

Scott and JK talk to Wendi about the differences between the original script and the episode, Ellison's politics, JK dressing like a bum, and so much more. Also the Tiptons are currently releasing their Star Trek/Planet of the Apes crossover comic, "The Primate Directive". You can't miss this epic tale of Captain Kirk meeting Charlton Heston's classic character, George Taylor, plus Klingons and apes!

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 107- Valentine's heartbreak
item.description: Love is in the air at Double Page Spread, or not, as Jason Ford of the Wombmates podcast visits to discuss the greatest heartbreaks in comics. So get ready for some tears as they dissect the saddest comic book moments from classics like Sandman, Cerebus, Spider-man, Swamp Thing, anything Jeff Lemire or Brian K. Vaughn write, and much more. They break down the tragedy of cancer tales, what's wrong with immortality and what connects you to a character enough to cry over them.

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Landry Walker/Eric Jones
item.description:
The boys get together to talk about the recent project JK has been working on that will be available on monkeybrain comics "Behemoth" with writer Chris Kipiniak. After some quick comic talk we head over to the pub to talk to comic creators Landry Walker and Eric Jones about their Image book " Danger Club" and other project past and future.

item.title: Sunday Comics podcast ep 25 Sunday Summit
item.description:
Donny assembled the round table of Darrell Taylor, Shawn Pryor, Julian Lytle and Martheus Wade to take a honest look at not just black characters but also black creators that have contributed to the medium along with the good and bad of the amount of diversity their is in comics.
follow the show on twitter @sundaycomicspod http://taylornetworkofpodcasts.com/

item.title: MagnumCast episode 10: Ramble On
item.description:
Luke and the Colonel greet the new year and a new season of Magnum PI with talk about "Small Wonder," "You Only Live Twice," and about a hundred other topics that distract them. And they also manage to review the episodes "Billy Joe Bob" and "Dead Man's Channel." Drop the guys a line or leave them a review and tell them what you think!
Luke Foster Cartoonist

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 7 Top Five
item.description:
This week we discuss Top Five, the new film from comedian-cum-auteur Chris Rock, and easily his most personal. It stars Rock himself, along with Rosario Dawson (Kids, Clerks 2), Gabrielle Union (Bring It On), and a whole bunch of comedians! The film is so chock-full of themes we couldn't get to them all . . . But we tried!
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.me/ email us your thoughts about the show or movies/TV/comics/books you'd like us to discuss to: artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Ed Brisson
item.description:
This episode we shine the drunken spotlight on the comic creator and letterer Ed Brisson who is finishing up his prolific run on the Image book SHELTERED which is about the bunker community called Safe Haven which is anything but safe. The graphic novel anthology MURDER BOOK collects gritty and unrelenting crime comics published by Darkhorse.
And his upcoming book from Boom Studios CLUSTER the sci fi series about criminals who find themselves fighting alien menaces across the galaxy. http://edbrisson.com/
twitter: @edbrisson
@JKsHappyHour You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx

item.title: Comic Rack Snarkcast ep 4Who Let the dog out?
item.description:
Welcome to another snarky episode of the Comics Rack Snarkcast! Join Amy, Darrell and Gerri on another adventure. In this episode we talk: Antman #1, The Valiant, Gotham by Midnight and the coming Top Cow book Postal #1. We also talk about the new ABC series Agent Carter.
Questions? Comments? Complaints? Suggested reading? Email us at rookieandthegeek@gmail.com
Follow the Taylor Network of Podcasts for news, articles and a variety of podcasts at http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.me/

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 103- Best of 2014
item.description:
Wendi is joined by Darrell Taylor, Rafael Sanz and Gil Colon of the "No Apologies" podcast to discuss their picks for the best books of 2014!
If you enjoyed the "black nerd" episode, you'll enjoy this incredibly outrageous, occassionally politically incorrect, and always hilarious dissection of the year in comics- featuring many Rick Remender, Valiant titles, Spider-Man and Image Comics appearances. See who Wendi deems superhero of the year or who is considered the least essential new character introduced in 2014.

item.title: MagnumCast episode 10: Ramble On
item.description:
Luke and the Colonel greet the new year and a new season of Magnum PI with talk about "Small Wonder," "You Only Live Twice," and about a hundred other topics that distract them. item.title: Double Page Spread ep 105- June Brigman
item.description: It was a thrill and an honor to talk to the legendary June Brigman. She discusses the impact of"Power Pack", the pre-teen Marvel superteam she and Louise Simonson co-created in the 80s, as well as her syndicated work on "Brenda Starr". We also discuss her Supergirl miniseries, Star Wars, the joy of drawing horses, what she teaches her students now and her upcoming cats in space caper!

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 6 Whiplash
item.description:
Sundance 2014 was all about Whiplash - Damien Chazelle's directorial debut, a sort of music-conservatory-set version of To Sir With Love . . . only without the love. It stars Miles Teller (Mr. Fantastic from the upcoming Fantastic Four film) and J.K. Simmons (J.Jonah Jameson from Raimi's Spider-Man, the loveable nazi from Oz). We discuss the film along with themes of genius, spoiled-brattedness, and Stockholm syndrome.
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.me/ email us your thoughts about the show or movies/TV/comics/books you'd like us to discuss to: artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Gabriel Hardman /Corinna Bechko
item.description:
As we ring in 2015 we discuss the IDW acquiring Top Shelf news as well as the new upcoming books announced at the latest Image Expo. In this weeks comics we put the spotlight on the comic work of Gabriel Hardman & Corinna Bechko.
Sensation Comics Featuring Wonder Woman Chapter 16-18
"Dig for Fire" part 1 of 3! Wonder Woman accepts a covert mission from Queen Hippolyta: infiltrate Apokolips, find a group of Amazons imprisoned there by Darkseid, and bring them home alive.
SAVAGE HULK (2014) #6-7
HULK VS DOCTOR STRANGE! • An inter-dimensional race against oncoming ARMAGEDDON!!! • Will HULK destroy an entire city to get revenge on DOCTOR STRANGE?
STATION TO STATION (ONE-SHOT)
Something terrible has happened to the Bay Area. A pipeline explosion has totaled Treasure Island and destroyed the Bay Bridge. At least, that’s the official story . . .
An interdimensional monster has been brought to San Francisco, and only the men responsible can fight it off, but can they resist its brainwashing? From the pages of Dark Horse Presents!
INVISIBLE REPUBLIC #1 IMAGE COMICS (W) Gabriel Hardman, Corinna Bechko (A/CA) Gabriel Hardman Breaking Bad meets Blade Runner. Arthur McBride's planetary regime has fallen. His story is over. That is until reporter Croger Babb discovers the journal of Arthur's cousin, Maia. Inside is the violent, audacious hidden history of the legendary freedom fighter. Erased from the official record, Maia alone knows how dangerous her cousin really is...
Item Code: JAN150568 In Shops: 3/18/2015
http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.wordpress.com/ Follow us on twitter: @jkshappyhour

item.title: Arts and Crap ep 5 TALES FROM THE GIMLI HOSPITAL
item.description:
This week we find out how different Darrell and Chris really are when we discuss TALES FROM THE GIMLI HOSPITAL, the 1988, feature film debut of Canadian avant-garde film director Guy Maddin. Is it art? Is it crap? You decide!
This episode may contain spoilers, but it's a little hard to tell.
Follow us on twitter: @ArtsCrappodcast http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.wordpress.com/ email us your thoughts about the show or movies/TV/comics/books you'd like us to discuss to: artsandcrappodcast@gmail.com

item.title: JK Happy Hour: Mutant misfits & Spider-men
item.description:
In the first half of the show we discuss the greatness that is the Marvel Unlimited app, All New X-Factor, Punks the comic and Spider-verse. And after a new Captain Bertrand log we join creator Peter David at the pub to hear what projects he's working on with a few surprises.
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123 and our guest : https://twitter.com/PeterDavid_PAD https://twitter.com/Crazy8Press Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171 Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 99- Sampsa Granstrom
item.description:
It's the return of everyone's favorite Helsinki native, Sampsa Granstrom, back to talk more comics! Sampsa and Wendi discuss what they're reading and watching lately (She Hulk, Gotham Academy, Batgirl, Wicked and Divine and more), discuss the merits of limited series, and then get into some reviews.
They discuss 3 books from Steve Niles' new imprint, Black Mask Studios. "Critical Hit" (Matt Miner, Jonathan Brandon Sawyer), "Pirhouette" (Mark Miller, Carlos Granda) and "Last Born" (Patrick Meaney, Eric Zawadzki). Upon typing this, Wendi now realizes that is Mark MILLER, not MILLAR and feels kinda silly.
They also dissect "World War Kaiju" from 01 Publishing, written by Josh Finney, art by Patrick McEvoy.
Wendi absolutely despised one of these books and very much loved another, so listen to find out!
And please consider contributing to the fund for our late friend, Jeremy Dale, to help his family cover funeral expenses. www.gofundme.com/jeremydale

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 98- Halloween with Archie
item.description:
In the past couple of years Archie Comics has taken a number of risks, none more daring than launching adult horror comic, "Afterlife with Archie". This zombie take on good ol' Riverdale has become a tremendous success and now spawned a spinoff comic, "Chilling Adventures of Sabrina", featuring the popular teen witch.
Wendi talks to "Afterlife" variant cover artist, Andrew Pepoy, about his fun, pin up style approach to Betty and Veronica getting terrorized. He shares "breaking in to the business" stories and talks about his original characters, "Simone and Ajax". His work can also be seen as an upcoming variant to "Archie meets Predator" #4.
Next Robert Hack comes by to discuss his unique, sepia tinged style on "Sabrina". He talks about his horror influences and how much he's allowed to get away with on an Archie book. Both titles take a lot of chances and feature unique creative styles unlike anything else on the comic rack.

item.title: MagnumCast episode 7: Meet Floyd and Adelaide
item.description:
Luke and the Colonel are back for another month of Magnum fun as they review "All Roads Lead to Floyd" and "Adelaide." Did they like them? Did they hate them? Did they shout their praises from the rooftops? Did they salt the earth so episodes like this would never appear again? Do you really think we'd tell you in the show notes? And after you listen, drop us a line and tell us what YOU thought!
Luke Foster Cartoonist
The Center of Somewhere http://centerofsomewhere.com

Moon Freight 3 http://moonfreight3.centerofsomewhere.com

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 97- Linnea Quigley and Jim Wynorski
item.description:
​Linnea Quigley has made a name for herself in over 150 movies as America's scream queen. She's been bad girls, zombies, victims and predators in films such as "Return of the Living Dead" and "Night of the Demons". Wendi gets to talk briefly to her horror girlcrush and learns about the sisterhood of scream queens. Recently Linnea had some tremendous damage to her roof and needs some help through crowdsourcing. Go check out her cause at http://www.gofundme.com/8tvf3o.
Director Jim Wynorski first broke with the 80s terrorizing robots in "Chopping Mall". Since then he's made over 12 creature features on SyFy ("Camel Spiders", Dinocroc vs. Supergator") and many Cinemax soft core porn parody films like "The Bare Wench Project", "CleavageField", "The Hills have Thighs". He enlightens Wendi on shooting films quickly and under budget, giving Traci Lords her first non-porn role, and the joys of women in prison movies. The man who gave us "Vampirella" and "Return of Swamp Thing" also gives the best answer about what comic book movie he'd really like to make.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 96- Jeremy Dale
item.description: Action Lab Comics is leading the way in quality all ages books, and certainly at the forefront is Jeremy Dale's "Skyward". Writer/artist Dale talks to Wendi about this coming of age tale about a boy and his dog dealing with issues of war and death. They discuss fantasy world building, his work on GI Joe and what that fandom is like, predicting the future through NFL comics and one of the greatest commission stories ever!

item.title: Double Page Spread Episode 95: Denise and Dave Dorman
item.description: Last week there was outrage over a post made by Denise Dorman on her blog, comicbookwife.com. The wife of reknowned sci fi cover artist Dave Dorman (Star Wars, GI Joe, Alien, Predator), frankly discussed the issues affecting artists at conventions recently and how the changing demographics are decreasing sales. Denise and Dave were kind enough to join Wendi in an open dialogue of how the industry is changing and what artists and fans can do together to keep commerce alive and our interests relevant.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 94 Peter Bagge
item.description: Peter Bagge has one of the most legendary styles in indie comics history. His Buddy Bradley and "Hate" comics were a pivotal part of 90s Seattle underground culture and his work still shows up in a diverse array of places, from DC and Marvel to Mad magazine and political journals. He discusses overcoming the "slacker" and grunge stigma, engages in an extensive discussion of Zora Neale Hurston and race relations in light of Ferguson, and where he gets treated better- indie art shows or Wizard World. It's a funny conversation with many enlightening moments.
item.itunes:summary: Peter Bagge has one of the most legendary styles in indie comics history. He discusses overcoming the "slacker" and grunge stigma, engages in an extensive discussion of Zora Neale Hurston and race relations in light of Ferguson, and where he gets treated better- indie art shows or Wizard World. It's a funny conversation with many enlightening moments.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 93- Dave Wachter
item.description: ​"Guns of Shadow Valley", the western comic with a tremendously successful kickstarter campaign, has finally seen publishing through Dark Horse Comics in a gorgeous hardcover edition. Artist Dave Wachter talks to Wendi about westerns and the mixing of multiple genres, as well as debating if Star Wars is really sci fi. Also available is his current miniseries from IDW, "Godzilla: Cataclysm", so we discuss the Godzilla fandom, favorite eras of kaiju, the difficulties in drawing giant monsters and so much more!

Also available is his current miniseries from IDW, "Godzilla: Cataclysm", so we discuss the Godzilla fandom, favorite eras of kaiju, the difficulties in drawing giant monsters and so much more!

item.title: ​Double Page Spread likes to talk a lot about all ages comic
item.description: ​Double Page Spread likes to talk a lot about all ages comics and books that can appeal to both kids and parents equally. In this episode Wendi interviews Tom Fowler, who has worked for every major company, but now is the artist on "Howtoons (Re)Ignition" with writer Fred Van Lente. This Image title combines detailed instructions of DIY science experiments of varying degrees with a fun narrative of kids surviving by their wits. They discuss the difficulties of drawing science experiments, the problems with fan art, getting back to finding joy in drawing and more.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 91- Steve Bryan
item.description: ​Wendi offers up her opinions on the Milo Manara "Spider-Woman" variant and free speech. Then she gets into it with the affable Steve Bryant, discussing unmade David Lynch projects, what it's really like at SDCC for small press vendors and speculating what the comics from his children's generation will be like. Steve has the upcoming "Athena Voltaire Compendium" coming from Dark Horse and discusses creating an original daredevil lady pulp character and all the classic style of storytelling involved.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 90 Wendi Goes to SDCC
item.description:
Wendi goes to San Diego Comic Con and gets to interview some fantastic creators!
Eisner Award winner Vivek Tiwary talks about Brian Epstein and the Beatles, his latest Broadway venture and Wendi tries to pry out Fifth Beatle movie casting news!
Royden Lepp shares his sepia tinged kid friendly robot vision in Archaia comic "Rust". They dish on whether its better to date a samurai or a ninja and he has some movie news of his own!
Mark Buckingham and Steve Leialoha bring "Fables" to an end! All the tears are held back, but Bucky talks about the joy of writing animal stories in "Fairest" and his ongoing work in "Dead Boy Detectives" from Vertigo and reuniting with Neil Gaiman in "Miracleman".
Eric Powell takes us through the seedier side of Chinatown in BOOM!'s "Big Trouble in Little China"! Ol' Jack Burton gets his first comic and "The Goon" creator talks about the influences of John Carpenter's work and what makes Kurt Russell such a dynamic screen presence.

Mark Buckingham and Steve Leialoha bring "Fables" to an end! All the tears are held back, but Bucky talks about the joy of writing animal stories in "Fairest" and his ongoing work in "Dead Boy Detectives" from Vertigo and reuniting with Neil Gaiman in "Miracleman".

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 89 Josh Fialkov/Gabo and Tidewater Con
item.description:
​In this episode Wendi goes to Aw Yeah! Comics to celebrate the release of Oni Press' "The Life After" with writer Joshua Hale Fialkov and artist Gabo! They discuss the new book and it's concepts of spirituality and purgatory as well as his previous work on "The Bunker" and "I, Vampire". Then he makes suicide sound very appealing.
Next is a conversation with Mike Federali, organizer of Tidewater Con, an upstart comic convention in Virginia Beach. He's an energetic, enthusiastic proponent of really making comics part of the community for everyone. He's assembled this convention with guests like Sam Huntington, Joel Hodgson, Pop Mahn, Nancy Collins and more. In the wake of SDCC it's interesting to hear someone from the other end of organizing discuss cosplay issues, the evolution of artists alley and what the real logistics are.
item.itunes:summary:
​In this episode Wendi goes to Aw Yeah! Comics to celebrate the release of Oni Press' "The Life After" with writer Joshua Hale Fialkov and artist Gabo! They discuss the new book and it's concepts of spirituality and purgatory as well as his previous work on "The Bunker" and "I, Vampire". Then he makes suicide sound very appealing.
Next is a conversation with Mike Federali, organizer of Tidewater Con, an upstart comic convention in Virginia Beach. He's an energetic, enthusiastic proponent of really making comics part of the community for everyone. He's assembled this convention with guests like Sam Huntington, Joel Hodgson, Pop Mahn, Nancy Collins and more. In the wake of SDCC it's interesting to hear someone from the other end of organizing discuss cosplay issues, the evolution of artists alley and what the real logistics are.

item.media:text:
​In this episode Wendi goes to Aw Yeah! Comics to celebrate the release of Oni Press' "The Life After" with writer Joshua Hale Fialkov and artist Gabo! They discuss the new book and it's concepts of spirituality and purgatory as well as his previous work on "The Bunker" and "I, Vampire". Then he makes suicide sound very appealing.
Next is a conversation with Mike Federali, organizer of Tidewater Con, an upstart comic convention in Virginia Beach. He's an energetic, enthusiastic proponent of really making comics part of the community for everyone. He's assembled this convention with guests like Sam Huntington, Joel Hodgson, Pop Mahn, Nancy Collins and more. In the wake of SDCC it's interesting to hear someone from the other end of organizing discuss cosplay issues, the evolution of artists alley and what the real logistics are.

item.title: JK's Happy Hour - SDCC Special
item.description:
Once again, we bring you JK's Happy Hour! In this episode, JK and Darrell are joined by writer Scott Tipton to attempt to talk about the IDW miniseries Star Trek: Harlan Ellison's City on the Edge of Forever. The trio is joined by a Star Trek newbie Paul Tesseneer to get his thoughts on the book from a different perspective.
You can catch Scott and JK At IDW's booth at SDCC THIS WEEKEND. Head over to booth #2643:
Friday: 2:00 – 3:00 Star Trek – Scott Tipton, David Tipton, Mike Johnson, Tony Shasteen, J.K. Woodward, Joe Corroney
Saturday: 6:00 – 7:00 Star Trek – Scott Tipton, David Tipton, Mike Johnson, Tony Shasteen, J.K. Woodward, Joe Corroney

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 88 Live from Third Coast Comics
item.description:
Just in time for Marvel to announce a black Captain America! It's DPS Live from Third Coast Comics in Chicago!
Wendi is joined by documentary filmmaker Tony G. Williams (Carbonerdious: the Rise of Black Nerd Culture), retailer Terry Gant and podcast mogul Darrell Taylor. It's a hilarious and raucous time as Wendi lets loose on the ignorant #firerickremender blogger and the group tackles race relations such as Reginald Hudlin and the Black Panther/Storm relationship, why black characters generally have lightning/electrical powers, rappers dressed like Spawn and the legacy of Dwayne MacDuffie and Milestone.

item.title: Double Page Spread- ep 87 Josh Emmons
item.description:
Josh Emmons is a longtime partner of Four Star Studios, Chicago's greatest comics collective, with Tim Seeley, Mike Norton, Sean Dove and Jenny Frison. Wendi tries to get him to dish on some of their highly anticipated projects, like the new Batman title "Grayson", and "Sundowners" from Image.
It's a loose, fun conversation between friends on topics from the Muppet musicians, how Charles Xavier makes his money, the David Finch Wonder Woman controversy, and extensive Jim Steranko stories.
So join in on the conversation and feel free to send feedback! You can always record an mp3 and send it to doublepagespread@gmail.com or Wendi will read your letters on the air.

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 86- Tim Hanley and Vanesa Del Rey
item.description:
Tim Hanley recently wrote a book on the history of Wonder Woman- "Wonder Woman Unbound- the Curious History of the World's Most Famous Heroine" that breaks down the fascinating story behind her legendary creator. He discusses that as well as all of her eras from Themyscyra to karate chopping, from her George Perez period to the best known Greg Rucka stories. We delve into her full feminist and fetishist past!
Next Wendi talks to artist Vanesa Del Rey, whose inky noir style can be seen in crime thriller "Hit" and Image's spy tale, "Zero". She is currently working on the upcoming "The Empty Man" with Cullen Bunn and shares stories of her artistic upbringing in Cuba, as well as her father's daring escape on a homemade boat during a hurricane!

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 85 Stephen Scarlata
item.description:
Recently there was an exceptional documentary, "Jodorowsky's Dune", that examined the failed attempt of director Alejandro Jodorowsky to create a movie of Paul Herbert's legendary sci fi epic, "Dune". Wendi talks to one of the producers of the film regarding this extraordinary experience that involved such art luminaries as Moebius, HR Giger, Dan O'Bannon and Salvador Dali. Even after the project failed Jodorowsky and Moebius went on to create some of the most imaginitive works in comics- "The Incal" and "Metabarons", as well as creating tremendous impact on films such as "Star Wars".
http://doublepgspread.tumblr.com/
Twitter: @DoublePgSpread

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 83- Katie Cook
item.description:
Katie Cook's adorable style and irreverent humor have made her a popular Con fixture for over 10 years. She schools Wendi on how to deal with know it all children, the class system inherent in her "My Little Pony" comics, taking the piss out of Star Wars, and the best time to visit DisneyWorld! You can catch up on her super cute monster comic, Gronk, at www.gronkcomic.com, as well as reading "My Little Pony" from IDW.
Please be sure to leave a review or rating for us at iTunes. That helps exposure considerably, as well as follow @doublepgspread on twitter or like "Taylor Network of Podcasts" on FB and say hi to all our great shows!

item.title: Double Page Spread ep 82- C2E2 Podcaster Roundtable
item.description: ​This is the Second Annual C2E2 Podcaster Roundtable! I was very honored to be asked to chat with John Siuntres of WordBalloon, John Mayo of Comic Book Page, Chris Marshall of Collected Comics Library and Stevie D of the Comic Book Queers. We talked about Patreon fundraising, which companies are less than forthcoming and other behind the scenes podcast nitty gritty!

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: The Super Episode
item.description:
JK's Happy Hour is going on Hiatus until September, but to kick off our summer vacation in style, we have: CHUCK DIXON! JAMAL IGLE! C.P. WILSON III! and ERIK LARSEN!!
also: EVERY SINGLE CAPTAIN MARCUS BERTRAND LOG EVER RECORDED, an unbearable string of intros, the usual charming banter, a review of Peter David's Star Trek:New Frontier books, upcoming news and 1 minute of "ums"!
We couldn't possibly pack more into this double sized monster!!

item.title: Comic Book Road Show John Layman
item.description:
We are joined by John Layman to talk about how he go into comics from his days as an editor to making the successful and long running Image comic Chew. John shares some exciting things coming up with the Chew series as well as some cool foreshadowing of whats to come. Also we get into wrapping up his run on the DC Batman series Detective and his involvement in the weekly series Batman Eternal.
http://chewcomic.blogspot.com/ twitter: @themightylayman
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by
Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/
Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx
Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com
http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ Leave us email by putting the show you are commenting on in the heading thetaylornetworkofpodcasts@gmail.com Follow us on twitter: @taylornetwork

item.title: Sunday Comics podcast ep 12 Ladies Night
item.description:
In this episode Darrell Taylor subs for Donny to talk to Gerri Atkinson, Wendi Freeman and Amy Tomaso about what some female comic fans think of comics and what got them into the hobby. They also talk about what are some of the current comics that they are into reading.
Wendi Freeman is the host of the comic podcast Double Page Spread http://doublepgspread.tumblr.com/
Amy Tomaso and Gerri Atkinson are the hosts of the podcast Rookie and the Geek which will be posting new episodes soon. @Rookie_Geek
email feedback to thesundaycomicspodcast@gmail.com
http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.com/
twitter: @sundaycomicspodcast

item.title: No Apologies ep 164 There can be only one
item.description:
In this episode we answer listener emails and review Deadly Class, She Hulk, Superior Spider-man and Fantastic Four. Also the crew composes their list of the top ten influential writers in comics.
1. Alan Moore 2. Frank Miller 3. Chris Claremont 5. Lee/Kirby/Dikto 6. Denny O2019Neil 7. Grant Morrison 8. Carl Barks 9. Art Spieglman 10. Geoff Johns/Bendis

We are now on Stitcher radio Send any feedback to nothingsonpodcast@gmail.com http://www.hhwlod.com/ http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 160 It's a boy!
item.description:
Superman The Man Of Steel. We re watched it and now we want to talk about it again! Has your opinion changed? Is it better, worse? How has the killing at the end aged? How have the performances held up?
What do you re-read? Why? Are comics more re-readable than other mediums? Are there comics that have gotten better or worse on re-reading? Do you recommend any comics that people should give a second chance? Are there comics that you wish people would just stop fucking reading.
In TV corner we discuss HBO's True Detective
Campbell Quiz Endorsement Forever Evil: Rouge Rebellion, Parker series:Slay ground, HBO's Treme, Arrow,
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Chris Peterson!
item.description:
Darrell has a new microphone and can't stop bragging, but its o.k. because he's gotten 4 great guests for the show to be announced soon. (we drop hints though). J.K. recaps his dinner with Paul Chadwick and Harlan Ellison and then they both talk some comics.
00:27:45 - CAPTAIN MARCUS BERTRAND'S LOG - Meet the "pleasure pet". Bertrand once again shows us that there are no depths to which he won't sink. Like him on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
00:30:54 - THIS WEEKS COMICS - Black Dynamite! J.K. reviews issue 1 of an IDW mini series, based on the movie and animated series on Adult Swim. Darrell reviews EGO's; a much awaited title since having creator Stuart Moore on the show. It more than lives up to our expectations.
00:45:43 - OFF TO THE PUB - We are joined at the pub by Chris Peterson to talk about his amazing work on DarkHorse's GrindHouse. you can follow up on and all his upcoming projects here: http://vsrobots.com/ and here: https://gumroad.com/l/pulp and here: http://vsrobots.com/post/63401925589/pulp-is-a-24-page-comic-written-by-jeremy-holt
01:08:12 - BLOOPERS
01:09:38 - OUTRO MUSIC Sir Charles Hughes - "Dynomite" (Theme from Black Dynamite)
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/vsRobots
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx
Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 159 The Wizard strikes again
item.description:
In this crazy episode the most recent Alan Moore interview sparked a discussion about what Alan Moore work we like and dislike and why. Plus we do a rundown on the new upcoming Image books that were announced at the Image Expo. Then off to take the Campbell Quiz.
Endorsements are The Forever Evil: Arkham War, He-Man Masters of the Universe, Star Wars Jedi Academy, Revolutionary War Alpha

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Gerry Duggan
item.description:
We are joined by Gerry Duggan to talk about his writing career on tv, film and comics. He shares his time working on Attack of the Show and how he transitioned to comics. We discuss his current run on Deadpool which he co writes with Brian Posehn as well as the digital first Deadpool story THE GAUNTLET. Plus his recent takeover of the cosmic adventure comic NOVA.
http://gerryduggan.com/
twitter:@Gerryduggan
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by
Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/

Next episode will be the Favorites of 2013 so you still have some time to email us your list. While Donny is still away on business Jim and Darrell discuss some movies and tv they caught up on while off for the holidays like:
American Hustle , Hobbit 2, Computer Chess, Covert Affairs Season 4, The Bridge, Burn Notice the finale, and Nikita.
We are now on Stitcher radio Send any feedback to nothingsonpodcast@gmail.com
http://www.hhwlod.com/
http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Dan Jolley!
item.description:
After a brief holiday hiatus, Darrell and J.K. catch up by recapping their holiday adventures. Its SO much fun to watch Darrell light up when he talks about Christmas!
00:32:53 - CAPTAIN MARCUS BERTRAND'S LOG - Bertrand falls asleep at the heel and blows up the ship. [spoiler alert] Like him on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
00:25:10 - OFF TO THE PUB - Dan Jolley recently revived his Bloodhound story originally published at DC with the new Dark Horse, 5 part mini series, Bloodhound:Crowbar Medicine. It will continue the story while introducing new readers to the characters. Dan joins us at the pub to tell us all about it, as well as discussing his previous work on JSA: The Liberty Files and his upcoming work on Terminator: Enemy of my Enemy from Dark Horse. you can follow up on Bloodhound, Dan Jolley, and all his upcoming projects here: www.danjolley.com and here: https://www.facebook.com/pages/Dan-Jolleys-BLOODHOUND/465175943518668
00:54:26 - BLOOPERS
00:55:15 - OUTRO MUSIC - "You're a Mean One, Mr. Grinch" By ... someone on the internet?... I dont' know! I googled it and downloaded the first free version that I thought was funny. What the hell do you want from me?!?
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/_DanJolley
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx
Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 157 We are all just chasing the dragon
item.description:
In this episode we list our favorite series and single issues of 2013. We take the Campbell Comic Book Quiz. We also answer the question of why we forgive certain things in comics.
Our Endorsements are Wonder Woman 1-26, Aquaman 26, Bloodhound: Crowbar Theory 1-2, Halo Escalation 2

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Micheal Moreci
item.description:
We have returning guest Michael Moreci here to talk about his new 4-issue miniseries "Curse," along with Tim Daniel, with art by Riley Rossmo and Colin Lorimer and also a Robocop one shot for Boom Studios. Michael also shares some of what coming with the new arc of the now ongoing Image series Hoax Hunters. And for MonkeyBrain comics Skybreaker & also Prime -8s.

item.media:text:
Justin Jordan joins us to talk about his latest project from Image DEAD BODY ROAD which is a beautifully drawn story by Matteo Scalera. Also Justin lets us know the aftermath of the recent Green Lantern crossover Lights Out. And what that means for Kyle Rayner in the Green Lanterns:New Guardians. Plus some other surprises

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Joshua Hale Fialkov
item.description:
Joshua joins us to talk about his creator owned project The Bunker. Joshua shares the reasons why he decided to do the project digitally only first and how it got to Oni press. Also what he has cooking up in the Marvel Ultimate universe with the current event Cataclysm which will define what the fate of the Ultimate universe line will be. Plus for the Dark Horse superhero line Skyman.
twitter @JoshFialkov thefialkov.com
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Peter David!
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. talk a bit about their upcoming appearance on Double Page Spread for their second annual "Top Ten" episode, the new addition to Taylor Network family: The Valiant Podcast, Thanksgiving Day festivities and who would win in a battle between Doctor Who vs. Galactus.
00:15:49 - CAPTAIN MARCUS BERTRAND'S LOG - Back by popular demand, Captain Marcus Bertrand's Log!! This week, the captain is called to Wolf 359 to help in a hopeless battle against the Borg. Fortunately for him and his lady friend from Risa, communications are down, phasers are offline and there is a "warp core breach" that prevents him from responding. Like him on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
00:20:45 - THIS WEEK's COMICS - JK tries to discuss Dark Horse's "5th Beatle" but ultimately decides that IDW's new mini, "Mr.Peabody and Sherman" http://read.idwpublishing.com/Mr-Peabody-Sherman/comics-series/12012 will annoy Darrell even more. Darrel introduces us to "Bunker" by Fialkov. http://www.thebunkercomic.com/
00:25:10 - OFF TO THE PUB - Darrell and JK are joined again by "friend of the show" Peter David! We talk about his incredible 8 year run on X-Factor and what's in store for the new Marvel Now series!! http://www.denofgeek.us/books-comics/x-factor/231487/marvel-comics-preview-all-new-x-factor-1 Don't miss out on DCBS's Marvel Bundle deal: http://www.dcbservice.com/category.aspx?id=4 We also talk about Crazy8 Press, a collection of great authors and titles all available in one place. http://www.crazy8press.com/ We speak in detail about his latest Crazy8 title, "Fearless", co-written by his daughter Caroline with cover art by J.K.Woodward. http://www.crazy8press.com/our-books/fearless/
00:54:26 - BLOOPERS
00:55:15 - OUTRO MUSIC - Mr. Peabody & Sherman Episode 25: The Great Wall of China Original air date: 3/24/1960 http://www.amazon.com/Episode-25-Geronimo-Marquis-Queensbury/dp/B009FC1HM4
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/PeterDavid_PAD
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx
DCBS Marvel Now Bundle: http://www.dcbservice.com/category.aspx?id=4 Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Jimmy Palmiotti
item.description:
We are joined by comic creator Jimmy Palmiotti to talk about his most recent DC project he has with Amanda Conner the ongoing comic Harley Quinn along with how issue 0 came about and what the tone of the ongoing will be. Jimmy also talks about the DC comic Batwing and All Star Western how the arcs are coming along and what are some of the cool things we can expect with the titles in the near future. And Jimmy discusses his creator owned book with Joe Quesada Painkiller Jane that is currently being published by Marvels Icon and his Daredevil Dark Knight story .
http://jimmypalmiotti.blogspot.com
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Mitch Gerads!
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. talk about last weekends con experiences. Darrell reflects on over indulgence and debouchery of Washington DC's Savage Con, while J.K. talks Portland Maine's C4(Coast City Comic Con). http://coastcitycomicon.com/ There's some talk about mentions of Darwin Cooke's Before Watchmen run, Tim Seeley, Mike Norton, Christian Dibarri, Eric Burnham and many more who attended the con
00:12:00 - CAPTAIN MARCUS BERTRAND'S LOG - Back by popular demand, Captain Marcus Bertrand's Log!! He nearly blows up the ship while talking about his space diabetes and STD's ENJOY! Like him on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
00:15:51 - THIS WEEK's COMICS - This week JK discusses Amazing X-Men #1 and ignites a fun little pro/con back and forth with Darrell. Darrell talks about the fruit of Gail Simone and Jim Califiore's kickstarter; Leaving Megalopolis. http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/2069222802/leaving-megalopolis
00:31:10 - OFF TO THE PUB - Darrell and JK are joined by a very special returning guest, Mitch Gerads. They give him a hard time, but that's just because they love him.(and they're kind of drunk jerks). Mitch Gerads is on the fast track in the comic biz. He's not only talented and hard working, but a genuinely decent person and enthusiastic comic fan. We talk about his work with Nathan Edmondson http://www.amazon.com/The-Activity-Volume-1-TP/dp/1607065614 and then get in depth about that same creative team on the new Marvel Now's Punisher. http://www.mitchgerads.com/2013/10/all-new-marvel-punisher-announced.html
01:02:03 - BLOOPERS
01:03:40 - OUTRO MUSIC - "Spirit of the 90's" Portlandia Season 1, Episode 22
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/MitchGerads
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.media:title: Yea I Said it ep 30 the Aftermath
item.media:text: Simba and Darrell went to New York Comic Con and they both lived to tell about it.

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: SAL!
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. move quickly through the introduction to get to the pub as quickly as possible!
00:01:19 - CAPTAIN MARCUS BERTRAND'S LOG - Back by popular demand, Captain Marcus Bertrand's Log!! He nearly blows up the ship while talking about his space diabetes and STD's ENJOY! Like him on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand 00:05:29 - OFF TO THE PUB - Darrell and JK are joined by a very special guest, Sal Abbinanti. If you've ever heard him CGS or 11o'clock Comics, then you already know what a riot this is. We talk a bit about Atomika, http://www.mercurycomics.com/ repping for Bill Sienkiewicz and Alex Ross, http://www.comicartshop.com/ComicArtShopsByCat.asp?PView=A&age=1&GCat=12185&GSub=%25&Order=Date and then the rest is Sal being Sal. This may be the best Pub segment yet!!!
01:01:40 - OUTRO MUSIC - Soviet National Anthem(remix)
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/SalAbbinanti
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171

Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 149 Whats up my NOOGIE?
item.description:
In this episode we take a little time to wish a safe journey to a very good friend of the Nicholas "Marcus" Almand and then we get into a hearty discussion about diversity in comics and also our thoughts on Pretty Deadly, Velvet, the original run of Quantum and Woody, Marvels Civil War, and Usagi Yojimbo
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Dan Jolley
item.description:
We have comic creator Dan Jolley to talk with us about the recent relaunch of his creator own Bloodhound: Crowbar Medicine which is now published by Darkhorse. We also talk about his earlier work on comics such as JSA Liberty Files and Firestorm. He also has a new new TERMINATOR mini-series called "Enemy of My Enemy," with artist /creator Jamal igle.

item.title: Rookie and the Geek ep 9 The Halloween show
item.description:
In honor of Halloween we each picked our favorite movies and comics that make great use of the supernatural and horror themes like:
Maneater of Hydra, The Brain the Wouldn't Die, Pan's Labyrinth, The Omen, Invasion of the Body Snatchers, Poltergeist, Paranormal Activity, The Car, Halloween 1978 version, 28 days later, Dark Knight of the Scarecrow, I Zombie, 30 days of Night, American Vampire and much more.
you can follow us on twitter: @Rookie_Geek If you have any comic suggestions or feedback for the podcast just email us at rookieandthegeek@gmail.com http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.com/

item.title: Comic Book Road show Frank J Barbiere
item.description:
We are joined by writer Frank J. Barbiere to talk about the completion of his first arc of the hit action adventure series Five Ghost from Image comics drawn by Chris Moonieham. Frank also drops some hints on what fans can look forward in the next arc to come. Frank is also doing a book for Darkhorse crime drama White Suits with art by Toby Cypress
Twitter: @atlasincognita Website: atlasincognita.com

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: The New York Comic Con 2013
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. recap their experiences at NYCC! Everything from Comic Con crop dusting to Jamal's Molly Danger release party. See some photos from NYCC 2013 here: http://www.jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/2013/10/photos-from-new-york-comic-con-2013.html and the commissions JK did here: http://www.jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/2013/10/nycc-commissions.html
00:24:10 - CAPTAIN MARCUS BERTRAND'S LOG - Back by popular demand, Captain Marcus Bertrand's Log!! He nearly blows up the ship while talking about his space diabetes and STD's ENJOY! Like him on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand 00:29:59 - IDW PANEL NYCC 2013 - Some very exciting guests and announcement from IDW this year. We won't spoil it for you here, just listen.
01:11:55 - BLOOPERS
01:15:08 - OUTRO MUSIC - "New York City" Some Time In New York City (Remastered) John Lennon, Yoko Ono, The Plastic Ono Band, Elephant's Memory & The Invisible Strings Released: Oct 01, 2010 Digital Remaster 2010 The copyright in this sound recording is owned by EMI Records Ltd https://itunes.apple.com/album/new-york-city/id392346353?i=392346402&ign-mpt=uo%3D5
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/IDWPublishing https://twitter.com/NY_Comic_Con
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171

Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 147 Pink Tacos
item.description:

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: The Granite State Coimic Con
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. talk about the upcoming cons they'll be guests at in the upcoming month. Granite State Con, Manchester, NH and NYCC!
00:13:42 - CAPTAIN BERTRAND'S LOG - Back by popular demand!! we attempt to gain insight about our favourite Starfleet captian by listening to 2-3 minutes of his daily Captain's Log, recently salvaged from the wreckage of the USS Potemkin after the devestating massacre at Delta IV. ENJOY! Like him on Facebook.
00:18:15 - THIS WEEK's COMICS - This week Darrell talks about Forever Evil from DC Comics and J.K. reviews Volume 1 of Liard and Eastman's Teenage Ninja Mutant Turtles, The Ultimate Collections Hardcover from IDW.
\ 00:40:23 - OFF TO THE PUB - This week we run into Bryce Carlson. In addition to being a full time managing editor at BOOM! Studios, Bryce is also the creator/writer of BOOM!'s new hot crime mini series, HIT. We discuss issue 1, the process, origin, development and future of this new seductive title!
00:59:02 - BLOOPERS
01:02:05 - OUTRO MUSIC "Crime Don't Pay" The Nobles Klik Records
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/brycercarlson https://twitter.com/boomstudios
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: JK's Happy Hour:Bryce Carlson - HIT #1
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. talk about the upcoming cons they'll be guests at in the upcoming month. Granite State Con, Manchester, NH and NYCC!
00:13:42 - CAPTAIN BERTRAND'S LOG - Back by popular demand!! we attempt to gain insight about our favourite Starfleet captian by listening to 2-3 minutes of his daily Captain's Log, recently salvaged from the wreckage of the USS Potemkin after the devestating massacre at Delta IV. ENJOY! Like him on Facebook. https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
00:18:15 - THIS WEEK's COMICS - This week Darrell talks about Forever Evil http://www.comixology.com/Forever-Evil-2013-1-of-7/digital-comic/46586 from DC Comics and J.K. reviews Volume 1 of Liard and Eastman's Teenage Ninja Mutant Turtles, The Ultimate Collections Hardcover from IDW. https://shop.idwpublishing.com/teenage-mutant-ninja-turtles-the-ultimate-collection-volume-1.html
00:40:23 - OFF TO THE PUB - This week we run into Bryce Carlson. In addition to being a full time managing editor at BOOM! Studios, Bryce is also the creator/writer of BOOM!'s new hot crime mini series, HIT. http://www.comixology.com/Hit-1-of-4/digital-comic/46726 We discuss issue 1, the process, origin, development and future of this new seductive title!
00:59:02 - BLOOPERS
01:02:05 - OUTRO MUSIC "Crime Don't Pay" The Nobles Klik Records
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/brycercarlson https://twitter.com/boomstudios
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171

Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 145 The Coat Hanger Arrow
item.description:
If you going to New York Comic Con happening on Oct 10-13 join us in Podcast Alley
Before we get down to business we want to send a shout out to friend of the show Marcus,
Congratulate Donny Salvo on his new show Sunday Comics podcast that had Christopher and Rafael as guests. Check out the first episode here.
http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.com/the-sunday-comics-podcast/
Shout out Juan Castro who will be working on the New Halo comic from Dark Horse. We also review the current Ultimate Ultimates from Marvel, Aquaman 23.1, Batman Black/White 1, Batman 23.1, Ocean at the End of the Lane, Infinity 3, Hit, and Ruby Sparks.
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Kurtis Wiebe
item.description:
Returning guest Kurtis Wiebe to talk about his new dark comedy action series published by Image Rat Queens. Kurtis talks about how the series came about and some of the influences involved in putting the story together. Also we talk about his hit comic Peter Panzerfaust now on its 3rd arc.
If you are going to NYCC happening from Oct 10-13 you can see Kurtis Wiebe in Artist Alley in section Q10.
You can also see us both at the podcast arena in the TaylorNetwork table
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by

item.title: The Sunday Comics Podcast ep 1
item.description:
Join your host Donny Salvo and a rotating panel of co-hosts as they discuss what they're reading, favorite creators and comic book industry news. episode description- in this episode Donny is joined by fellow pod casters Jim Dietz from the HHW/LOD Podcast and Nothing's On, Chris Keszycki and Rafael Sanz from the No Apologies podcast and The Taylor Network of Podcasts, and Mike Myers of the DC Noise and Geek Brunch podcasts. In this episode they talk about Trinity War, Villains month, Forever Evil, Mark Waid, Matt Fraction, Matt Kindt, team up comics,superior spider man, favorite batman artists, captain midnight,thor,flash,aquaman, Red Sonya,Conan, King Conan,Jack Kirby,Campbell Con, and for some reason comedy and comedians
http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.com/

item.title: No Apologies 144 King of Quasi-Unintentional A-hole
item.description:
Join the TaylorNetwork at NYCC on Oct 10-13 http://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/
In this episode we recap our adventures at Baltimore Comic Con and more importantly Campbell Con, discuss our thoughts on what we think of the current state of DC comics, debate Jonathan Hickmans run on Avengers so far, plus review East of West 1-5, Mighty Avengers 1 and God is Dead

item.description:
Come join the TaylorNetwork at podcast Alley for this years New York Comic Con Oct 10-13 http://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/
In this episode Juan Castro returns to share his con adventures at Fan Expo, Forever Evil, Infinity, and a lot of crazy in between.
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Erika Lewis
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. talk about the upcoming cons they'll be guests at in the upcoming month. Asheville Comic Expo, NC, http://www.jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/2013/09/asheville-comic-expo-commission-pre.html Granite State Con, Manchester, NH and NYCC! Then, in the tradition of Jerry Lewis, JK brings the manic fun to a screeching halt with a serious moment as he talks about a very important fundraiser he's started. http://www.jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/2013/09/get-some-comic-art-help-my-friend.html Darrell then lightens things back up with some hilarious highlights from Baltimore Comic Con!
00:29:10 - CAPTAIN BERTRAND'S LOG - Back by popular demand!! we attempt to gain insight about our favourite Starfleet captian by listening to 2-3 minutes of his daily Captain's Log, recently salvaged from the wreckage of the USS Potemkin after the devestating massacre at Delta IV. ENJOY! Like him on Facebook. https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
00:34:14 - OFF TO THE PUB - This week we run into Erika Lewis. Erika Lewis ran programming and production at G4 for 5 years. We talk to her a little bit about her time at G4 as well as her new graphic novel for Archaia illustrated by JK Woodward & scheduled to be realeased in 2014, "49th Key"!
00:58:01 - BLOOPERS 01:00:06 - OUTRO MUSIC
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/ErikaElyLewis https://twitter.com/Archaia
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Jason Trost & Mark Poulton
item.description:
We are joined by director, writer and actor Jason Trost to discuss his indie movie "All Superheroes Must Die". The film will be adapted to comics by Jason and, friend of the show, Mark Poulton. The adaptation will be published by Action Lab. Jason shares what its like to make the film and also his future goals with raising money for the sequel on indie go go
Indiegogo for A World Without Superheroes: http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/a-world-without-superheroes/x/252697 All Superheroes Must Die Saga Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AllSuperheroesMustDieSaga And you can check out the first movie on Amazon/itunes/DVD
You can find more work from Mark here http://avengelyne.keenspot.com/
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by
Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/
Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx
Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com
http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/
You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or ITunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

item.title: Nothing's On ep 110 Is it Pym or Pym?
item.description:
In this ep we shout out ComiConn 2013 which Darrell and Donny recently attended and also a shout out to Steve from Alt3red Egos podcast http://Www.Alt3redEgos.com for having a mini con at his house afterward. Also answer listener questions, talk recent casting news, sum up the recent MTV awards in 20 seconds. For the retro tv segment Quincy ME ep 2 Who's Who in Neverland Venture bros season 4

item.title: No Apologies ep 142 Uncle Tom's Comics
item.description:
With Chris and Juan on assignment the rest of the crew is swept away in a wave of childhood nostalgia when Tom finds an old cartoon advertisement in the back of his comics .
http://www.misterkitty.org/extras/stupidcovers/stupidcomics90.html On this crazy journey we bring up the bizarre introduction of the DC character BloodWynd , Jon Cryer, Rambo, Triumph, the end of the first arc of Rick Remender's Captain America, and the most bizarre Superman story by John Byrne ever written.
For the videos we discussed you can find them here http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-NNb1pgQlQo http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X34iQIm5rn4
The Al Ewing Mighty Avengers interview is here http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.com/2013/07/21/comic-book-road-show-al-ewing/
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by
Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/
Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx
Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com
http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/
You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or ITunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

item.title: Comic Book Road Show JT Krul
item.description:
Creator JT Krul returns to talk about his prose story The Lost Spark a fantasy adventure which is enjoyable for all ages. What the experience was like to write his first novel http://www.amazon.com/The-Lost-Spark-J-Krul/dp/0985447338/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1378141937&sr=8-1&keywords=the Lost Spark
We also talk about his participation in the Aspen comics 10 for 10 program which celebrates the 10th anniversary of the company, which has 10 issues published all for a dollar an issue. Some are from the past catalog like Soulfire which JT is the writer and some new titles like JIRNI which JT also pens. http://aspencomics.com/
And also he shares his thoughts on wrapping up the DC digital first series Superman Beyond. http://jtkrul.blogspot.com/ twitter:@jtkrul
You can also hear the show on Stitcher http://www.stitcher.com/ This podcast is sponsored by
Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/
Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx
Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com
http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/
You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or ITunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.
