item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Ibrahim Moustafa
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. talk abouty the upcoming cons they'll be guests at in the upcoming month. ASheville Comic Expo, NC. Granite State Con, Manchester, NH and NYCC! Then the meet a vagabond cartoonist who tells them all about his adventures on the road. Luke Foster recaps his journey and talks about his online comic journal. http://drawnaway.centerofsomewhere.com/
00:29:06 - CAPTAIN BERTRAND'S LOG - We introduce a new ongoing segment to the show where we attempt to gain insight about our favourite Starfleet captian by listening to 2-3 minutes of his daily Captain's Log, recently salvaged from the wreckage of the USS Potemkin after the devestating massacre at Delta IV. ENJOY! Like him on Facebook. https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
00:33:18 - OFF TO THE PUB - This week we run into Ibrahim Mustafa, artist on Monkey Brain's High Crimes to talk about his work on an exciting crime story in an extraordinary setting! http://www.monkeybraincomics.com/titles/high-crimes/
00:58:01 - BLOOPERS 01:00:06 - OUTRO MUSIC Punk Rock Candy Mountain The Rock n' Roll 3-Way 2007 Drool City Records Performed by Ashtray https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/the-rock-n-roll-three-way/id263343836
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/CartoonistLuke https://twitter.com/Ibrahim_M_ https://twitter.com/xtop https://twitter.com/Monkeybrain_inc http://highcrimescomic.tumblr.com/ https://www.facebook.com/highcrimescomic http://theartofibrahimmoustafa.blogspot.com/
Read High Crimes: http://www.monkeybraincomics.com/titles/high-crimes/
and Drawn Away: http://drawnaway.centerofsomewhere.com/
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

00:29:06 - CAPTAIN BERTRAND'S LOG - We introduce a new ongoing segment to the show where we attempt to gain insight about our favourite Starfleet captian by listening to 2-3 minutes of his daily Captain's Log, recently salvaged from the wreckage of the USS Potemkin after the devestating massacre at Delta IV. ENJOY! Like him on Facebook. https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
00:33:18 - OFF TO THE PUB - This week we run into Ibrahim Mustafa, artist on Monkey Brain's High Crimes to talk about his work on an exciting crime story in an extraordinary setting! http://www.monkeybraincomics.com/titles/high-crimes/
00:58:01 - BLOOPERS 01:00:06 - OUTRO MUSIC Punk Rock Candy Mountain The Rock n' Roll 3-Way 2007 Drool City Records Performed by Ashtray https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/the-rock-n-roll-three-way/id263343836
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Follow our guests: https://twitter.com/CartoonistLuke https://twitter.com/Ibrahim_M_ https://twitter.com/xtop https://twitter.com/Monkeybrain_inc http://highcrimescomic.tumblr.com/ https://www.facebook.com/highcrimescomic http://theartofibrahimmoustafa.blogspot.com/
Read High Crimes: http://www.monkeybraincomics.com/titles/high-crimes/
and Drawn Away: http://drawnaway.centerofsomewhere.com/
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 141 Fanboy Rage
item.description:
Join us at Baltimore Comic on Sept 7-8 http://baltimorecomiccon.com/ and New York Comic Con on Oct 10-13 http://www.newyorkcomiccon.com/
In this very angry episode while Juan Castro enjoys Fan Expo the rest of the gang argues/ discusses the casting of Ben Affleck as Batman and the right of fandom to voice opinions about it. Plus we review Batman Detective by Paul Dini Day Men #1 Roger Stern's Spider-man and Avengers run Daredevil 21-23 Bloodshot 0

item.title: No Apologies ep 140 Spring Break Forever
item.description:
On August 22-25 you can go see Juan Castro who is a guest and Fan Expo Canada and after that you can head on over to Baltimore Comic Con happening on Sept 7-8 where Darrell, Chris Campbell , and Tom King will be in attendance. Also check out Juan in an interview about his work on Jamal Igle’s Molly Danger http://comicshavok.blogspot.mx/2013/08/interview-with-molly-dangers-inker-juan.html
On this crazy episode we have the return of everybody’s favorite Drunk Chris Campbell and special guest artist Drew Moss whose most recent project The Colonized from IDW just wrapped up. We also discuss Faction leaving F4, Morrisson on the intended Killing Joke ending, Infinity, Suicide Risk, Batman Annual 2, Flashpoint Paradox, and in the hipster d bag segment the hipsters talk Spring Breakers.
You can also hear the show on Stitcher This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or ITunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Drew Gaska and The Doctor
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. recap Boston Comic Con from beginning to end
00:29:06 LIVE RECORDING OF THE BOSTON COMIC CON DOCTOR WHO PANEL - Turns out Darrell was in the audience the whole time and captured the whole thing.
01:35:09 - OFF TO THE PUB - This week we run into Drew Gaska. we talk about his pulp novels, Critical Millennium, Conspiracy of the Planet of the Apes, Space:1999, and the upcoming, Buck rogers and Frenzy! find out more about Frenzy here: http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1867085351/frenzy-an-illustrated-novel
01:59:20 - BLOOPERS 02:01:37 - OUTRO MUSIC

item.description:
Yes. We are back. Dammit. Welcome to episode 6 where we talked Awakenings, featuring the art of Alex Eckman-Lawn - which leads to discussion of Mouse Guard: Legends of the Guard Volume 2. Darrel bring Satellite Sam to the table. Of course - we HAVE to talk Dexter too!! Join us. Grab a snuggie and a glass of vino...
You can follow us on twitter @Rookie_Geek For comic, tv,and podcast news bookmark http://thetaylornetworkofpodcasts.com/
email us at rookieandthegeek@gmail.com

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Mike Carey
item.description:
00:00:00 INTRO In this week's episode, Darrell chastises J.K. about his drinking(nypocrite) before discussing San Diego Comic Con, Boston Comic Con and Darrell's vagina.
00:25:51 CAPTAIN MARCUS BERTRAND'S LOG Back by popular demand, Captain Marcus Bertrand's Log!!ACTION CAPTAIN! Captain Marcus and ensign Woodward beam dopwn and take on the Orion Syndicate. https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand
00:30:52 - THIS WEEK's COMICS - JK reviews "The Ghoul" by Steve Niles and Bernie Wrightson and Darrell reviews "A Once Crowded Sky" by Tom King. A Once Crowded Sky by Tom King http://www.amazon.com/Once-Crowded-Sky-Novel/dp/1451652011/ref=tmm_pap_title_0?ie=UTF8&qid=1375190728&sr=1-1 Salvation Sally by Tom King http://www.amazon.com/Harbinger-Salvation-Kindle-Worlds-ebook/dp/B00CSUV0MM You Are Not the First and There Will be More After You by Tom King http://www.amazon.com/Harbinger-First-Kindle-Worlds-ebook/dp/B00DET5LB2/ref=sr_1_1?s=digital-text&ie=UTF8&qid=1375191193&sr=1-1&keywords=you are not the first
00:59:09 - OFF TO THE PUB - This week we run into Mike Carey. We talk to him about his incredible career and his recent title for BOOM! Studios, "Suicide Risk". Then we run out on the tab. http://www.boom-studios.com/series/title?series_id=915&name=Suicide%20Risk
01:30:47 - BLOOPERS 01:33:30 - OUTRO MUSIC

item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. have a short(and possibly JK's drunkest) intro.
00:07:20 CAPTAIN MARCUS BERTRAND'S LOG Back by popular demand, Captain Marcus Bertrand's Log!! He spends most of the time chastising a drunk ensign and bragging about sexual exploits. https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Al Ewing
item.description:
We are joined by comic writer and novelist Al Ewing to talk about how he got started in comics and his various work on projects like Jennifer2019s Blood, Ninjettes, 200AD as well as Judge Dredd. And his upcoming comic from Marvel Mighty Avengers. We also talk about his recent novel The Fictional Man available here http://www.amazon.com/The-Fictional-Man-Al-Ewing/dp/1781080941/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1374432669&sr=8-1&keywords=al ewing
Follow Al on twitter @Al_Ewing And his tumblr http://alewing.tumblr.com/ You can also hear the show on Stitcher This podcast is sponsored by
Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/
Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx
Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com
http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/
You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or ITunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

00:25:42 THIS WEEK'S COMICS DC's Digital First: Batman 66 and Monkey Brain's High Crimes.

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Joshua Williamson
item.description:
We have returning guest writer Joshua Williamson to talk about his new supernatural crime thriller Ghosted which comes out of Image comics Skybound publishing. We also talk about his successful Mask and Mobsters series on Monkeybrain comics that now are collected in print by IDW publishing. Joshua is also bringing an old skool ccomic character from WWII into the present Captain Midnight coming out of DarkHorse publishing.
You can follow Joshua on twitter @Williamson_Josh
Website http://www.bbcinnercircle.blogspot.com/
You can also hear the show on Stitcher This podcast is sponsored by

item.title: The Rookie & the Geek ep 4
item.description: We discuss X-Man #1 by Brian Wood and Olivia Copiel's all-female team and Stumptown by Greg Rucka featuring art by Matthew SouthWorth! We take a look at Star Trek Into Darkness - from the perspective of a fan and a newbie... (spoiler - it's great!). We also discuss the controversial children's TV show 'Shezow' and the topics chatter has brought up. Join us! And questions! Contact us at rookieandthegeek@gmail.com. Follow the snarkiness @Rookie_Geek on Twitter. You can follow our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/TheRookieAndTheGeek. Itunes reviews are always appreciated. Enjoy!

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Gabriel Hardman
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. beg for reviews before discussing the upcoming Boston Comic Con, stalking Chris Ryall, Luke Foster's Road Trip. http://drawnaway.centerofsomewhere.com/ and a typical ending to Darrell Taylor's date nights. 00:17:08 - CAPTAIN MARCUS BERTRAND'S LOG - We introduce a new ongoing segment to the show where we attempt to gain insight about our favourite Starfleet captian by listening to 2-3 minutes of his daily Captain's Log, recently salvaged from the wreckage of the USS Potemkin after the devestating massacre at Delta IV. ENJOY! Like him on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand 00:21:56 - THIS WEEK'S COMICS - JK discusses IDW TMNT Micro-Series Villains #3 Old Hob from Writer Jason Ciaramella and artist Dave Watcher. Darrell discusses Thanos Rising from writer Jason Aaron and artist Simone Bianchi. 00:43:04 - OFF TO THE PUB - We meet Gabriel Hardman at the pub where we ask about his recent trip to Denver Comic Con and everything from his storyboard work to his stunning comics career: everything from his Marvel work, (Atlas, Hulk,etc.) to his recent scifi work for Boom!(Planet of the Apes) and Darkhorse(Star Wars: Legacy) to his creator owned work for Double Feature (The Liar - ) and Monkey Brain (Kinski) Gabriel's website: http://www.gabrielhardman.com/ Double Feature- The Liar: http://fourstarstudios.com/doublefeature/action-doublefeature-1-1 WE STRONGLY RECOMMEND YOU CLICK THIS LINK AND CHECK OUT KINSKI RIGHT NOW http://www.monkeybraincomics.com/tag/gabriel-hardman/ 01:26:37 - BLOOPERS 01:31:50 - OUTRO MUSIC
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123 and our guest : https://twitter.com/gabrielhardman
Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/pages/JKs-Happy-Hour/164886523650171
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com
Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: Nothings On ep 101 Stay On Topic
item.description: After a small break to recover from episode 100 we jump right back into the tv talk with answering listener emails. We discuss of Game of Thrones that recently wrapped up its third season. We also talk about the new HBO show Family Tree, USA2019s Graceland about a group of undercover agents, Season five of the fan favorite Venture Bros from cartoon network. item.title: Comic Book Road Show James Tynion IV
item.description:
We have returning guest writer James Tynion IV to talk about the latest twist and turns of DC's Talon series and the latest crossover story with Birds of Prey. We also talk about his taking over the reins of Red Hood and the Outlaws and his continued back up stories in the Scott Snyder/Greg Capullo Batman book which is now starting the new Year Zero storyline. James has also spread his wings with the horror weekly web comic series from Thrillbent THE EIGHTH SEAL drawn by Jeremy Rock.
http://jamesthefourth.tumblr.com/ @JamesTheFourth http://thrillbent.com/comics/the-eighth-seal/#1 We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or Itunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: David Wachter
item.description: In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. briefly discuss the "Man of Steel" movie and looting hamburgers in a Kryptonian crisis. 00:06:35 - Then we forgo this week's comic reviews and go straight to the pub to speak with Dave Wachter about "Guns of Shadow Valley", his new kickstarter, http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/davewachter/the-guns-of-shadow-valley-complete-graphic-novel the newly released, "Breath of Bones" with Steve Niles, his TMNT villian microseries one shot and more! 1:02:44- Blooper reel

item.title: Comic Book Road Show John Rogers
item.description: We have John Rogers who has written and produced a wide range of television series including COSBY and JACKIE CHAN ADVENTURES; most recently he co-created the hit caper series LEVERAGE for TNT. His film work includes over twenty scripts and rewrites including THE CORE and TRANSFORMERS. He was also the co-writer with Keith Giffen on the Blue Beatle series before taking over as sole writer. John discusses how he and Mark Waid created Thrillbent as well as his current title on Thrillbent ARCANUM. http://kfmonkey.blogspot.com/ http://thrillbent.com/ @jonrog1 We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or Itunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

item.title: JKs Happy Hour: Peter David
item.description: In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. discuss Starfleet shuttle rendezvous, Denver Comic Con and Heroes Comic Con 2013 For this week's comic review J.K. picks "Perhapanauts" by Todd Dezago and Craig Rousseau http://www.perhapanauts.com/ and Darrell talks DC's Earth 2, from James Robinson. http://www.dcbservice.com/product.aspx?id=411036#dt Then they head over to the Pub where they meet Peter David who discusses his time recovering from a stroke, ending his phenomenal run on X-Factor, hints to a new series at Marvel, a new Fallen Angel mini at IDW and "Fearless", his new sequel to Tigerheart. http://www.crazy8press.com/

item.title: The Rookie & the Geek ep 3
item.description: In this riveting episode, we discuss the documentary "Wonder Women: The Untold Story of American Super heroines" by Kristy Guevara-Flanagan and produced by Kelcey Edwards. The attempted Amazon series "Zombieland" series is reviewed along with discussion of the comics Superman: Birthright written by Mark Waid and drawn by Leinil Franis Yu and the new Ben Templesmith masterpiece Ten Grand written by J. Michael Straczynski. As always, there is the 'rookie question'. We love feedback! And questions! Contact us at rookieandthegeek@gmail.com. Follow the snarkiness @Rookie_Geek on Twitter. You can follow our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/TheRookieAndTheGeek. Itunes reviews are always appreciated. Enjoy!

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Duane Swierczynski
item.description:
In this week's episode, Darrell and J.K. discuss Mel Caylo's BBQ, meeting Bobak;Flight director on the Mars Science Laboratory Curiosity mission, Denver Comic-Con, the sweet scent of Erin Gray, and the innevitable dementia waiting for all comic creators. For this week's comic review J.K. picks John Byrne's "High Ways" mini series from IDW http://shop.idwpublishing.com/comics/series/g-l/the-high-ways.html and Darrell talks about his love of "SEX", from Joe Casey and Piotr Kowalski. http://www.imagecomics.com/comics/5423/Sex-1 Then they head over to the Pub where they meet Duane Swierczynski who talks about his work on X, Bloodshot, Judge Dredd and past and upcoming crime novels. http://www.amazon.com/Duane-Swierczynski/e/B001I9W5XC
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123 and our guest : https://twitter.com/swierczy

Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Jeff Lemire
item.description:
We have returning guest Jeff Lemire to discuss the aftermath of the Rotworld arc on Animal Man. We also discuss the current character building run of Green Arrow and the New 10-Issue sci-fi series coming in 2013 limited series from Vertigo TRILLIUM. We dip into the upcoming Trinity War DC comic2019s event and what it could mean for the DC 52 universe. http://jefflemire.blogspot.com/

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Whine, Women & Wrong
item.description:
In this special ladies edition of JK's Happy Hour, Darrell and J.K. talk with lady-nerd podcasters, Amy Tomaso from Rookie and the Geek http://www.hipcast.com/podcast/HT8yJb & Wendi Freeman from Double page Spread http://doublepgspread.tumblr.com/. Together they talk about the Con that never happened, Boston Comic Con. Darrell gives a first hand account of his weekend there. Then they review IDW's Colonized by Chris Ryall and Drew Moss, before saying goodbye to Amy and Wendi and meeting the ladies of The Mouthy Broadcast http://mouthybroadcast.com/ at the pub. There we learned that we should never be allowed in public together without adult supervision. COMING SOON: Dance Rumble 2013! JK's Happy Hour vs. Mouthy Broadcast!
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123 and our guests: https://twitter.com/AmyJeanTomaso https://twitter.com/Rookie_Geek https://twitter.com/DFWendi https://twitter.com/DoublePgSpread https://twitter.com/mouthybroadcast
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/
Join us on the forums at: http://www.forumforgeeks.com

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Christina Blanch & Chris Carr
item.description: We are joined by the writers of the Thrillbent web comic THE DAMNATION OF CHARLIE WORMWOOD. Christina Blanch is an educator who uses comic books as teaching tools. She has taught on college campuses, for online courses such as the 201CGender Through Comic Books201D SuperMOOC, and in the correctional system. Chris Carr has taught English composition and literature at three Midwestern universities. He also spent several years teaching inside correctional facilities where he met Christina. They share with us some of the experiences of teaching in prison and how that inspired them to write this story. You can find this and many other great stories at http://thrillbent.com/ We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or Itunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

item.description: In this episode we discuss Amy taking a class in Gender through comic books, Fredric Wertham, Using comics as teaching tools and Walking Dead season 3. item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Star Trek: Mr. Scott2
item.description:
In this episode Darrell and J.K. celebrate "Star Trek: Into Darknness" with an all Star Trek episode. We talk to the 2 Scotts of comic book Trek; writer Scott Tipton and IDW editor Scott Dunnbier. Tipton joins us for the intro and review segments of the show. Here, we discuss the modern day legend of Captain Marcus Bertrand https://www.facebook.com/CaptainMarcusBertrand?fref=ts before a review of the movie leads to tangents from "Star Trek II: Wrath of Kahn" to TNG character development and TOS episodes like "Space Seed" and "The Cage" featuring "Serial Killer Spock" Then we join Dunnbier in Ten Forward for some green drinks and a discussion of IDW's current, past, and upcoming Star Trek releases.
Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/JKsHappyHour https://twitter.com/JK_Woodward https://twitter.com/theVoice123
Discount Comic Book Services: http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades: http://www.instocktrades.com/

Blogs: http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Frank J Barbiere
item.description:
We are joined by Frank J. Barbiere . Barbiere has published a number of comic titles independently via his Atlas Incognita brand, as well as Divine Intervention from Arcana Studio, and has been featured in Dark Horse Presents. He is currently developing The White Suits at Dark Horse Comics as well as the hit Image miniseries Five Ghosts: The Haunting of Fabian Gray . You can follow Frank on twitter @atlasincognita and his website http://atlasincognita.com/
We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or Itunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Revival, Tim Seeley and Turra:Gun Angel!
item.description:
We talk about our upcoming appearances at Comic Geek Speak Super Show http://www.comicgeekspeak.com/supershow/ ,Boston Comic Con http://www.bostoncomiccon.com/ then review the first 6 issues of Revival http://revivalcomic.com/
Then we're off to the pub where we find Greg Gray, director of a Turra Gun Angel(based on the comic by Matheus Wade) and Rachel Alig who plays Turra herself. We take 20 minutes to talk to them about their incredible new movie!http://turragunangel.com/
Then we find Tim Seeley, author of "Revival", buy him a beer and talk a bit about "Revival" as well as his new kickstarter project, "Mini Comics Included" http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1168046118/mini-comics-included-0/posts .

item.title: NoApologies ep 123 The M-word
item.description:
Join us at these years Boston Comic con from April 20-21 http://www.bostoncomiccon.com/index.html
While Tom king is away at Wondercon we had Alan (New Mutant) sit in with us as he talks about his new Kickstarter for the Power Principle http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/newmutant/the-power-principle-trade-paperback We discuss the new Wolverine 2 trailer recently released and Robert Redford being added to Captain America 2.The new Quantum and Woody book by James Asmus and Tom Fowler. item.title: Comic Book Road Show: Mark Waid
item.description:
We are joined by comic legend Mark Waid who has worked on such comic characters such as The Flash, Spider-man, Superman as well as his own creator owned projects. He is also currently working on Daredevil, Green Hornet, and Indestructible Hulk. On this episode we talk to Mark about his free digital comics website Thrillbent which you can find here http://www.thrillbent.com/ and the exciting new titles and creators that are joining the site. You can follow Mark Waid on twitter @MarkWaid
We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or Itunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

item.title: Comic Book Road Show: Jonathan Hickman
item.description:
We are joined by comic writer and artist Jonathan Hickman well known for such runs as The Nightly News, Pax Romana, Shield and most recently Image Comics Manhattan Projects as well as for Marvel Avengers and New Avengers. We talk to Jonathan Hickman about his start in comics and what to look forward to in his creator owned as well as his mainstream work. item.title: JKs Happy Hour : Joe Harris
item.description:

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Dan Slott
item.description:
We are joined by Dan Slott the comic writer best known for his work on such books as Amazing Spider-man, She- Hulk, Batman Adventures as well as the current Marvel Now Superior Spider-man. We talk about his start in comics and his work in comics behind the scenes to working on one of the most well-known character in comics. You can follow Dan Slott on twitter https://twitter.com/DanSlott

item.title: No Apologies ep 118 Sleep like a baby
item.description:
In this episode we have Tom king promoting his new comic Time Warp a science fiction anthology by Vertigo. item.title: Comic Book Road Show Matt Wagner
item.description: We are joined by comic legend Matt Wagner best known for such for his comic creations such as the mastermind assassin, GRENDEL. Also best known for this epic creation and his other, more personal, allegory, MAGE, Wagner has also worked on such classics as the fan-favorite Vertigo title, SANDMAN MYSTERY THEATRE. We talk to Matt Wagner about his most recent projects such as the supernatural action adventure series The Tower Chronicles drawn by Simon Bisley and published by Legendary. Also the upcoming eight part Dynamite series The Shadow Year One as well as some future projects. http://www.mattwagnercomics.com/home.html We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or Itunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

We have returning guest Image comics musically influenced supernatural story 27 writer Charles Soule to talk about his new projects Strange Attractors which is available digitally in chapters on Comixology from Archaia Entertainment. item.title: No Apologies ep 115 Where is the Human Condition?
item.description: Were down a man tonight due to Tom King being sick. But we begin the show with movie discussion. DT gives his feeling on Django Unchained. We talk Abrahams directing new Star Wars 2015 as well as Avengers 2 and a possible JLA film. We also debate if Cyborg feels like a Justice League member. How great Kyle Higgins Nightwing has been. Our disappointment with Gail Simone Batgirl run so far and if she need a change . Chris Campbell ask where his Rai or Ninjak books are at from Valiant. Our boredom with Guy Gardner in Green Lantern Corp. We review The Flash 15, JlA and Aquaman 16 , Young Avengers 1 Uncanny X Force 1. Rafael reviews Scott Snyder /Scott Tufts Severed series from Image which brings up talk of the film Changeling. Juan Castro dives into the first volume of Preacher from Garth Ennis and Vertigo. Quick shot talk of Phonogram, Fearless Defenders and Vengeance. We end the show with the return of Chris Dylan. We talk Abrahams directing new Star Wars 2015 as well as Avengers 2 and a possible JLA film. We also debate if Cyborg feels like a Justice League member. How great Kyle Higgins Nightwing has been. Our disappointment with Gail Simone Batgirl run so far and if she need a change . Chris Campbell ask where his Rai or Ninjak books are at from Valiant. Our boredom with Guy Gardner in Green Lantern Corp. We review The Flash 15, JlA and Aquaman 16 , Young Avengers 1 Uncanny X Force 1. Rafael reviews Scott Snyder /Scott Tufts Severed series from Image which brings up talk of the film Changeling. Juan Castro dives into the first volume of Preacher from Garth Ennis and Vertigo. Quick shot talk of Phonogram, Fearless Defenders and Vengeance. We end the show with the return of Chris Dylan. item.title: Comic Book Road Show David Schulner
item.description: We have the talented comic and TV writer David Schulner to talk about his new sci fi-meets-conspiracy thriller comic Clone from Image Comics Skybound imprint. We talk about how the series came about and some teasers of what2019s to come. We also talk about his upcoming NBC series 201CDo No Harm201D about renowned neurosurgeon whose body is 201Covertaken201D every night by a 201Cdangerous alternate personality. item.title: No Apologies ep 114 Shadows & Talking Monkeys
item.description:
On this episode Juan Castro leads off the show with his take on the complete201D Planetary201D by Warren Ellis and John Cassidy... Rafael and Chris Campbell talk about their love of the Punisher2019s previous runs. Tom King reviews New Avengers # 2. Darrell reviews Thor #3, Chris Keszycki talks of his enjoyment of The Animal Man rot world cross over with Swamp Thing. Chris Campbell reviews Captain America# 3 ,Chris Keszycki gets into the creepiness of Batman 16. We debate who we think will not survive Death In the family. Rafael shows some love to the current Spawn artist Syzmon K udranski . Quick shots review of Batman Inc. 6, Executive Assistant from Aspen Comics, Shadow Man 3 Darrell express his unhappiness with DC Comics and editorial decisions . We answer Gil Colon At The very end we shout out Manuel A C armona of Truthful Comics books http://www.truthfulcomics.com/ & Alan Whites Power Principle. https://twitter.com/TPowerPrinciple .

item.title: JK's Happy Hour: Mitch Gerads
item.description:
We are joined by comic artist Mitch Gerads artist on the hit Image series 201CThe Activity201D - INTELLIGENCE SUPPORT ACTIVITY, or Gray Fox. Within Gray Fox is a team of elite men and women whose mission is flexible, whose technology is bleeding edge, and whose execution is precise and lethal. They are Team Omaha, and they serve THE ACTIVITY. We talk about the first year of the book and some of what is to come in issue 11 201CThe Butterfly Effect201D . http://www.warfarewithoutwarning.com/ http://www.mitchgerads.com

item.title: No Apologies ep 113 Blowin in the wind
item.description:
In this episode we talk about the end of Hack Slash and the Comics Buyer Guide, We also talk about indie writer Charles Soule taking over Swamp Thing after Scott Snyder leaves after issue 18.We discuss Superior Spider-man 1, Sweet Tooth, Star Wars #1, The Tooth 1, and Thanos Quest You can send well wishes to writer Peter David who recently suffered a stroke. The address is Peter David c/o Second Age, Inc., P.O. Box 239, Bayport, NY 11705.

item.description:
In this episode we have returning guest writer/inker Brian Buccellato to talk about how his current run as the co-writer on the DC 52 FLASH . item.title: JK's Happy Hour: How's Peter's doing
item.description:
Well known comic book and novel writer Peter David recently suffered a stroke. And to let fans know about Peter2019s progress and recovery we are joined by his wife Kathleen David who has been there with Peter throughout this trying ordeal. To keep up with Peter2019s daily recovery you can go to Kathleen2019s blog http://kathwp.malibulist.com/ which she updates on a regular basis. http://www.peterdavid.net/

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Glen Brunswick
item.description: We are joined by writer Glen Brunswick of the Image comic 201CJersey Gods201D to talk about his latest project with Image co-founder Whilce Portacio 201CNon-Humans201D which follows the adventures of Oliver Aimes, a down-on-his-luck cop investigating a mysterious serial killer in the grim future of 2041. http://www.thenonhumans.blogspot.com/ http://www.imagecomics.com/ We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or Itunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

item.title: No Apologies ep110 A Vertigo Retrospective
item.description: In this episode we talk about Gail Simone being taken off and put back on Batgirl as well as the new changes with DC2019s Vertigo imprint since the announcement of Karen Bergers upcoming departure. In honor of Karen Berger2019s tenure at the company we give a retrospective of the company and its contributions past and present to the comic Industry. We also discuss Fantastic Four #3 Avengers #2 Thor #3 These are some projects that No Apologies member Juan Castro is currently working on Transformers More Than Meets the Eye# 13, GIJOE real American Hero #186,& Batwing #16 http://juancastroinker.deviantart.com/ We also have member Tom King as he and artist Tom Fowler contribute to the Vertigo anthology Time Warp #1 Written by DAN ABNETT, MATT KINDT, DAMON LINDELOF, PETER MILLIGAN, TOBY LITT, RAY FAWKES, SIMON SPURRIER, TOM KING and GAIL SIMONE Art by MARK BUCKINGHAM, JEFF LEMIRE, M.K. PERKER, VICTOR SANTOS, JORGE CORONA, RAFAEL ALBUQUERQUE, TOM FOWLER, I.N.J. CULBARD and others Cover by EDUARDO RISSO 1:10 Variant cover by JAE LEE One-shot 2022 On sale MARCH 20 2022 80 pg, FC, $7.99 US 2022 MATURE READERS Let2019s do the time warp again! It2019s time for another fantastic Vertigo anthology filled with spectacular sci-fi stories. Robots, deep space and lots of time travel twists by a bevy of comic greats and the up-and-coming stars of tomorrow. Damon Lindelof and Jeff Lemire bring us a blast from DC2019s past, plus another installment of the 201CDead Boy Detectives201D from Toby Litt, Buckingham and Victor Santos, Matt Kindt presents a stirring story of man vs. machine2014and so much more! We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/

item.title: Comic Book Road Show Joe Harris
item.description:
We are joined by comic writer Joe Harris who worked on such comics as Slingers, Bishop: The Last Xmen and The Legend of the Dark Knight: Haunted Arkham 3 part story.
He conceived and co-wrote the screenplay for the hit Sony Pictures film, Darkness Falls and the politically-themed slasher movie and Fox release, The Tripper.
We are happy to get him on the show to talk about his latest creator owned Image comic "GREAT PACIFIC" the smart sci fi thriller adventure based on true realistic events. We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts Also we ask that if you have some time leave us a rating and or Itunes review because that helps us greatly to promote the show.

item.title: No Apologies ep 107 Valiant is back baby!
item.description:
In this episode we answer some of the Facebook questions while talking about Greg Land2019s art style on the Marvel Now Iron Man, DC comics Dennis O'Neil's the Question before we delve deep into the Valiant Universe by first giving a little publishing history of the characters from the beginning to the present with Valiant Entertainment. http://www.valiantentertainment.com/ . We give a little spoiler free intro into the Five ongoing titles: X-O Manowar, Archer & Armstrong, Bloodshot, Harbinger, and Shadowman.

We are joined by critically acclaimed writer B Clay Moore to talk about his upcoming series coming out of DC JSA: THE LIBERTY FILES 2013 THE WHISTLING SKULL with art by Tony Harris. We also talk about his recent 3 part Batman story with art by BEN TEMPLESMITH- LEGENDS OF THE DARK KNIGHT. We also talk about his previous work on his on HAWAIIAN DICK and BATTLE HYMN. http://bclaymoore.com/
We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts

item.title: No Apologies ep 108 ST IDES and Comics
item.description: We talk about the news of Karen Berger stepping down from Vertigo and answer more Facebook questions . The books we review this episode are the last issues of Scalped, Avengers#1, All New Xmen#2, Clones#1, Legend of Luther Strode#1. Also checkout Tom Kings comic book debut on the Vertigo anthology and pick up his book A Once Crowded Sky. http://pages.simonandschuster.com/once-crowded-sky TIME WARP #1 Written by DAN ABNETT, MATT KINDT, DAMON LINDELOF, PETER MILLIGAN, TOBY LITT, RAY FAWKES, SIMON SPURRIER, TOM KING and GAIL SIMONE Art by MARK BUCKINGHAM, JEFF LEMIRE, M.K. PERKER, VICTOR SANTOS, JORGE CORONA, RAFAEL ALBUQUERQUE, TOM FOWLER, I.N.J. CULBARD and others Cover by EDUARDO RISSO 1:10 Variant cover by JAE LEE One-shot 2022 On sale MARCH 20 2022 80 pg, FC, $7.99 US 2022 MATURE READERS Let's do the time warp again! It's time for another fantastic Vertigo anthology filled with spectacular sci-fi stories. Robots, deep space and lots of time travel twists by a bevy of comic greats and the up-and-coming stars of tomorrow. Damon Lindelof and Jeff Lemire bring us a blast from DC's past, plus another installment of the "Dead Boy Detectives" from Toby Litt, Buckingham and Victor Santos, Matt Kindt presents a stirring story of man vs. machine-and so much more! We are now on Stitcher Radio This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ Discount Comic Book Services http://www.dcbservice.com/index.aspx Instock Trades http://www.instocktrades.com/ Join us on the forums at http://www.forumforgeeks.com http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ You can also join us on the Facebook group TaylorNetwork of podcasts

item.title: JK's Happy Hour ep 14 HAPPY BIRTHDAY JK
item.description:
In this episode we sit down with artist/writer Jamal Igle about his recent work on the KISS comic book published by IDW andalso his kickstarter project called "MOLLY DANGER" which you can support by going here: http://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mollydanger/molly-danger
We also celebrate JK's birthday while being stood up at the bar and our ole pal the actor/writer Chris Kipiniak joins us. Check out a very funny video Chris did here : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QEdXhH97Z7E . The host of Dr Who The Tavern podcast also joined us http://www.tardistavern.libsyn.com/ Darrell also talks about the recent ComiCONN in Connecticut . We also get another funny emberrassing JK story. http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/

item.description:
In this episode we are joined by comic artist Kevin Mellon to talk about how he got started in comics as well as his work on the Image comic "Heart" with Blair Butler & his most recent comic "American Muscle" written by Steve Niles which is featured in "Creator-Owned Heroes". We also talk about his work on the hit animated show "Archer" on the FX channel.

item.title: ComicBookRoadShow ep180 Jimmy Palmiotti
item.description:
We have returning guest comic writer and industry veteran Jimmy Palmiotti to talk about his projects like Creator Owned Heroes, GI Combat & All Star Western Tales to name a few. We also talk about his views on doing creator owned work and also his start using the Kickstarter program and his advice to would be creators interested in using it. We also learn about the upcoming DC comics fighting game Injustice: Gods Among Us

item.title: Nothing's On ep 59 A podcast within a podcast
item.description:
In this very special podcast crossover ShawnPryor of PKD The Black box joins Donny Salvo and Darrell Taylor as they discuss their TV review podcast "Nothings On," why reality television is destructive, reasons why viewers are walking away from network tv, how NBC lost it's identity and continues to stay losing, Darrell's hatred of the Muppets, 60's Batman, sci-fi shows and tangents aplenty.
In other words, we're talking a lot about TV on this one.
Be sure to listen to the aftershow segment after the episode ends. Trust me.
http://hhwlod.com/pkd-media-black-box/blog
http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: Happy hour ep 11Kevin Colden
item.description:
In this episode we talk to Kevin Colden is an Eisner Award-nominated, Xeric Grant winning American comic book writer and artist. Primarily known as a webcomics artist, his work has been published in print by Zuda Comics, IDW Publishing, Image Comics, Alternative Comics, and Top Shelf Productions. And his most recent project the Crow published by IDW.
http://www.kevincolden.com/
http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/ http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

We also talk about his new upcoming book "Revival" written by Tim Seely published out of Image comics.http://www.ihatemike.com/

item.title: Comic Book Road show ep 168 Richmond Clements
item.description:
In this episode we are joined by comic writer,artist and also colorist Richmond Clements who is also one of the organisers of the Hi-Ex International Comic Expo in Inverness, Scotland. We talk about his work in comics as well as his recent project Turning Tiger, a two part science fiction comic drawn by Alex Moore, for Renegade Arts Entertainment.
http://richwriting.blogspot.com/
TURNING TIGER: SPECIAL EDITION, a 58-page full-color paperback, will be on sale in stores April 25th for $7.99 and is available to order in the February 2012 edition of Diamond Previews (FEB120740, ISBN: 978-1-926914-87-9). For more information, please visit http://www.arcana.com/view_title.php?id=265
this podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics you can comment on this and other episodes at the Forum for geeks or go to our facebook page the TaylorNetwork http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

We talk about his work in comics as well as his recent project Turning Tiger, a two part science fiction comic drawn by Alex Moore, for Renegade Arts Entertainment.
http://richwriting.blogspot.com/
TURNING TIGER: SPECIAL EDITION, a 58-page full-color paperback, will be on sale in stores April 25th for $7.99 and is available to order in the February 2012 edition of Diamond Previews (FEB120740, ISBN: 978-1-926914-87-9). For more information, please visit http://www.arcana.com/view_title.php?id=265
this podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics you can comment on this and other episodes at the Forum for geeks or go to our facebook page the TaylorNetwork http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 88 The Manhattan Projects
item.description: In this episode we have Nick pull away from the studio to talk about his first onging book coming out of Image comics "The Manhattans Project" written by Jonathan Hickman. We get into how well the book is doing and what has changed since his last work on Red Wing also put out by Image. Plus Juan Castro tells us a little about his return to IDW's Snakes with artist Robert Atkins which gets a name change with issue 12 to Snake Eyes and Storm Shadow. This podcast is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics Also join us on the Forum for Geeks message board. http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.description:

We also talk about his early days working in Marvel/DC and his move to creator owned comics. http://jayfaerber.blogspot.com/ This podcast is sponsored by http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ If your enjoying the show please leave us an itunes review. item.title: ComicBookRoadshow ep 163 Paul Cornell
item.description:
In this episode we are joined by returning guest comic writer Paul Cornell to talk about his current DC title Demon Knights and his upcoming Vertigo title Saucer Country and the research that went into writing this UFO mythology. We also take a fun look at the differences and simalarities of the US and British political system and also Paul's views on the comic industry and what influences his writing.
http://www.paulcornell.com/ This episode is sponsored by http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ And if your enjoying the podcast leave us an itunes review & look for us on the facebook page. For more info on the show go to http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: Comic Book Road Show 162 James Tynion IV
item.description: In this episode we are joined James Tynion IV writer of the upcoming Batman Annual #1 which is co written by Scott Snyder introducing Mr Freeze to DC’s “New 52″ universe. We talk about how he got into comics and also the backup stories‘The Fall of the House of Wayne’ featured in the main Batman book which reveal the full extent of the Owls’ control, and their history with Gotham City.Which will be drawn by Snyder’s old American Vampire collaborator, Rafael Albuquerque. If you enjoyed this episode leave us an itunes review and check out our facebook page and our website http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ This podcast is sponsored by http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/

item.title: Happy Hour ep 7 J.K. gets a job
item.description: In the first half JK Woodward finally reveals his new project he has been busy working on and they review the episodes 3 "Are You True?' & 4 "Crash Into You" from season 1 of One Tree Hill. And in the second part they have some beers with comic artist/writer & Eisner/Harvey Award winner Alex Robinson about his books "Box Office Poison","Alex Robinson's Lower Regions","Too Cool to be Forgotten","Tricked", and the children's book "A Kidnapped Santa Claus". Alex also has a podcast called Ink Panthers. http://www.comicbookalex.com/ http://jkwoodwardart.blogspot.com/ http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: NoApologies ep 85 Zombies hate lawsuits
item.description:
In this episode we talk share our thoughts on the premiere episode of Kevin Smith’s Comic Book Men and the Walking Dead premier ep for the Second half of season two. Also Robert Kirkman's response to the Tony Moore suit,Creators response to the Gary Friedrich. Lawsuit decision,and Nick Pitarra shares gets into his upcoming ongoing Image book Manhattan Projects written by Jonathan Hickman & Shout outs to JK Woodward on his new project the IDW Dr Who/Star Trek The Next Generation crossover and to Sam Humphries for his being the new co writer on the Ultimate Comics Ultimates. The books we review are Secret Avengers # 21,21.1,22, Winter soldier# 1,Chew # 23,Punisher # 8,Severed # 7,Black Panther : The most dangerous man alive #529,Blue Estate #9
Leave us an itunes review and go to facebook and click the like button. For more info on this podcast and others on the network go to http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/
This episode is sponsored by http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 82 Robin!
item.description:
In this episode we have our regular gang along with Charles Paul Wilson III artist on comic 'Stuff of Legend" for Th3rd World Studios! and friend of the show Frank. We jump right into some discussion on comic censorship,Batman & Robin,Ghost Rider,Jason Aaron,X men:first Class,Blade Anime,Catwoman,Alcatraz,Red Skull Incarnate,Batman #5,Witchblade #151,Morning Glories vol 1,Green Lantern,Walking Dead,Animal Man#5,Invincible,digital comics vs floppies, Foster which is available here http://www.brianbooch.com/
And to find out more about Charles Paul Wilson III go to original art for sale - www.comicarthouse.com/cpw3.html forum with friends - www.tentonstudios.com and The Stuff of Legend Volume III tpb due out end of February
This episode is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: Comic Book Road Show ep 154 Paul Jenkins
item.description:
In this episode we are joined by veteran comic writer Paul Jenkins who has worked on some of the biggest comic stories such as Hellblazer from Vertigo,theMarvel Knights Inhumans,Spectacular Spiderman,Origin,Sentry and more from Marvel and currently DC Presents & The Dark Knight from the DC 52 relaunch. He and current Spiderman artist Humberto Ramos are self publishing Fairy Quest which you can order by email ramos&jenkins@gmail.com
This episode is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics You can email us at comicbookroadshow@comcast.net our website address is http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: NoApologies ep81 Gin & Juice
item.description:
In this episode we are joined by friend of the show Marcus to discuss the second wave of DC's 52 titles and the first wave of cancellations. Some upheavel at Marvel with an artist breaking his exclusive contract to go to DC. Also the annoucement of Rob Leifield taking over 3 DC 52 titles. We talk about the Walking Dead tv show and Boardwalk Empire and what shows keep our interest. Our comic picks are Batman the leviathan special,Xmen 17 - 19 xmen legacy 253 - 260,Hack/Slash,The Flash,American Vampire,Justice League,Whispers,Last of Greats,Scarlet Spider#1,Secret Avengers #21,WitchDoctor Resurrection,Activity 2, to hear from marcus go to http://www.sonsofnowhere.com/ http://www.webcastbeacon.com/first-issue-archive/
this episode is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics Leave us an itunes review and like our facebook page http://tinyurl.com/7ow28zp http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 80 Jamal Igle is in the building
item.description:
In this special episode we add Chris Campdell to the podcast and Jamal Igle sits in with us fresh off his announcement of his not renewing his contract with DC comics after signing an exclusive contract in 2005. We also have Lorrie Thomas join us as we discuss with Jamal some of his reasons for going freelance and what some of his upcoming projects may be.
The comics we talk about are Justice League #4 I, Vampire #4 I and Last of the Greats #4 ,Hack/Slash,Sixth Gun #17,Flash #4,Action comics #4,Uncanny X men #4,Wolverine and the Xmen,#3,Activity #1,Sacrfice #1, This episode is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics
http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ For more on Jamal Igle go to http://www.jamaligle.com/

item.title: NoApologies ep 79 The drunken rambling episode
item.description:
We have a full house in this episode with a very special guest Len 'Cruze' Webb of the radio & podcast "Black Tribbles" you can listen to the show live on G town radio. Before the fun we talk about the passing of comic legends Joe Simon creator of Captain America and joker creator Jerry Robinson and Teen Titan artist Eduardo Barreto. We get into the character of Green Arrow from his early years to now.We give a top comics,movies,and music for 2011.
http://www.blacktribbles.com This episode is sponsored by Friendly Nighborhood Comics http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: No Apologies ep 80 Jamal Igle is in the building
item.description:
In this special episode we add Chris Campdell to the podcast and Jamal Igle sits in with us fresh off his announcement of his not renewing his contract with DC comics after signing an exclusive contract in 2005. We also have Lorrie Thomas join us as we discuss with Jamal some of his reasons for going freelance and what some of his upcoming projects may be.
The comics we talk about are Justice League #4 I, Vampire #4 I and Last of the Greats #4 ,Hack/Slash,Sixth Gun #17,Flash #4,Action comics #4,Uncanny X men #4,Wolverine and the Xmen,#3,Activity #1,Sacrfice #1, This episode is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics
http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/ For more on Jamal Igle go to http://www.jamaligle.com/

item.title: Happy Hour ep 5
item.description: Happy Hour ep 5 This is a very special double episode in the first half we sit outside the bar in the cold and read listener feedback and review Star Trek and TMNT. In the second half we are joined by comic veteran Stuart Moore who's writing includes Iron Man, New Avengers/Transformers, and Wolverine (Marvel); Firestorm and Detective Comics (DC Comics); the multicultural superhero team The 99 and he sits down to tell us a little about the upcoming Marvel Comics Civil War prose novel. We also talk about the Activity by Nathan Edmonson & Mitch Gerads

item.title: No Apologies ep 82 Robin!
item.description: In this episode we have our regular gang along with Charles Paul Wilson III artist on comic 'Stuff of Legend" for Th3rd World Studios! and friend of the show Frank. We jump right into some discussion on comic censorship,Batman & Robin,Ghost Rider,Jason Aaron,X men:first Class,Blade Anime,Catwoman,Alcatraz,Red Skull Incarnate,Batman #5,Witchblade #151,Morning Glories vol 1,Green Lantern,Walking Dead,Animal Man#5,Invincible,digital comics vs floppies, Foster which is available here http://www.brianbooch.com/ And to find out more about Charles Paul Wilson III go to original art for sale - www.comicarthouse.com/cpw3.html forum with friends - www.tentonstudios.com and The Stuff of Legend Volume III tpb due out end of February This episode is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics http://friendlyneighborhoodcomics.com/ http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/

item.title: Comic Book Road show ep156 Owen Wiseman
item.description:
We have returning guest Owen Wiseman writer of the recently finished 6 issue mini Samurai’s Blood. We talk to him about the project now that its finished and his future work. Look for the Febuary release of SAMURAI’S BLOOD VOL. 1 TP and its also available digitally on Comixology. http://www.benaroyapublishing.com/comics/samurais-blood
This episode is sponsored by Friendly Neighborhood Comics. Leave us an itunes review and check out our website http://thetaylornetwork.wordpress.com/
